title: Operators and loops in R - for beginners (ქართულ ენაზე)
description:
• What we'll do
მომდევნო შეხვედრა გაიმართება 21 დეკემბერს. იგი გათვლილია დამწყებთათვის. შერჩეული თემა ფუნდამენტური და მნიშვნელოვანია, რადგან შეეხება R-ში ჩადებულ ლოგიკას. კონკრეტულად, დავიწყებთ კავშირის ოპერატორების - და, ან, არა - განხილვით, შემდეგ ვისაუბრებთ ლოგიკურ ოპერატორებზე. ამის შემდეგ გადავალთ "თუ-მაშინ" პირობით წინადადებებზე.
შეხვედრას დავასრულებთ "while loop"-ით. ვნახავთ, როგორ მარტივად და სასარგებლოდ შეიძლება მისი გამოყენება, მაგალითად, მანქანაში, მძღოლის დამხმარის მოწყობილობაში.

შეხვედრა გაიმართება ქართულ ენაზე და მას უმასპინძლებს ნინო მელითაური.

==============================
The next meetup is on December 21. It is suitable for beginners. The topic is about the logic of R. We will discuss relational operators like "and", "or", "not", and logical operators, followed by "if-else" conditional statements. We will end with "while loops" and try out an example.

The meetup is hosted by Nino Melitauri, in Georgian.

• What to bring

• Important to know

title: Data Christmas 2017
description:
Decemberben kivételesen két eseményünk lesz, ugyanis csatlakozunk az adatos meetup-ok karácsonyi rendezvényéhez is.

Join us for for the last meetup of the year, where we look back at the most significant and interesting events of 2017.

This meetup is jointly organized by the data meetups in Budapest. Current participants (in alphabetical order): BI Meetup (https://www.meetup.com/Budapest-BI-Meetup/events/245459960/), Big Data Meetup (https://www.meetup.com/Big-Data-Meetup-Budapest/events/245444973/), Data Science Meetup (https://www.meetup.com/budapest_data_science/events/245460641/), HUG-MSSQL (https://www.meetup.com/HUG-MSSQL/events/245693009/), PyData meetup (https://www.meetup.com/PyData-Budapest/events/245460002/), R meetup (https://www.meetup.com/Budapest-Users-of-R-Network/events/245454475/), R-Ladies (https://www.meetup.com/R-Ladies-Budapest/events/245460382/)

Schedule:
18:30 Doors open, pizza
19:00 The evolution of the Data Community in Hungary - Máté Gulyás
19:30 6 facts you should know about R-Ladies - Windhager-Pokol Eszter
19:45 Here we R - Gergely Daróczi
20:10 Machine learning trends in 2017 - Szilárd Pafka
20:30 Afterparty!

This is an English speaking event. Due to the parallelly organized, distributed nature of the meetup, RSVPs will be closed when to combined number of RSVPs from all participating meetups hits the limit.

title: R-Ladies Belgrade: Networking and Social
description:
Dobro došli na prvi R-Ladies Belgrade MeetUp!

Program:

18:00 - Otvaramo vrata

18:15 - Dobro došli na R-Ladies Belgrade: Uvod i najava

18:45 - Prezentacija i diskusija: Zašto R? Ilustracija kroz uporabu ggplot i magick paketa (Dr Tatjana Kecojević)

19:30 - Hang around: prilika za razgovor i upoznavanje

20:00 - Zatvaramo vrata

Razgovaraćemo o tome šta to R nudi i čini jedinstveno prikladnim za obavljanje nauke o podacima, bolje znane kao Data Science (DS). Razmotrićemo alate potrebne za rad na tipičnom DS projektu, koje ćemo ilustrovati na malom primeru. Razmenićemo razmisljanja o tome šta podrazumevamo pod terminom Data Science i najboljim načinima komuniciranja rezultata analiza s ciljanom publikom.

Voleli bismo da dodjete i da nam se pridružite u diskusijama i razmeni iskustava u radu na Vasim svakodnevnim DS projektima.

Ne morate biti korisnik R-a, niti njegov stručnjak da bi ste se pridružiti našim diskusijama. Potrebno je samo da imate interesovanje za učenje, rad i upoznavanjem sa DS projektima i R-om.

Nadamo se da ćete nam se pridružiti.

Zahvaljujemo se STARTIT Centru (https://startit.rs/beograd/) za pružanje mogućnosti održavanja ovog događaja.

title: [語意分析] 語意角色標註(semantic role labeling)
description:
Agenda

• 19:00-19:30 暖身活動: R Basic

• 19:30-20:30 主議程: 語意角色標註(semantic role labeling) @Hao-Wei Her

• 20:30-20:50 閃電秀: AIDS 年會分享 @PeiLee

• 20:50-21:10 閃電秀: Azure ML 與 Excel 搭配術 @Felaray

• 21:10 - 自由交流時間

Talk Information

• 語意角色標註(semantic role labeling)
去年曾經在R ladies介紹過自然語言的語法套件、實作。今年要跟大家分享的主題是語意角色標註(semantic role labeling)的基礎概念、常用用來預測語意角色的數據格式介紹、語意與語法的不同之處等等。研究語意角色已經有一年多，希望能和大家分享這一年的心得。

• AIDS 年會分享
分享 2017 年人工智慧年會及資料科學年會中個人覺得有趣的部分，分別為：資料視覺化、爬蟲以及聊天機器人，共會提及八場演講的部分內容。只會簡單介紹每場演講在做的東西，點到為止，不會涉及技術部分，希望大家也會覺得有趣 ❤️

• Azure ML 與 Excel 搭配術
資料處理向來就不是新鮮的議題。不論是以往的資料探勘、或是大數據至機器學習，資料所呈現的智慧往往被視為人們處理各種事物的瑰寶。
Excel作為一款老牌的數據處理工具，如何透過Azure Machine Learning在現今潮流下站穩一席之地呢?

Speaker Information

• Hao-Wei Her
大家好，我是Hao-Wei，在語意理解的實驗室工作，研發工程師一枚。

• PeiLee
資料分析師，大學主修日文跟廣告。比平日上班再早起一小時，連去了四天的年會，回來後在 Medium 寫了一萬多字的筆記加心得，把功德做好做滿，成為老闆心中最柔軟的那一塊。

• Felaray
微軟2017 Office MVP,遊走於Azure/SharePoint等領域,喜歡嘗試使用非典型方法接觸各種新鮮技術.近年來較熱衷於ChatBot與Cortana的開發.

[Code of Conduct]
基本上這是一個女性學習社群，因此若你不是女性，但出現在我們的實體聚會的話，你很可能被要求以下行為：

• 發言的機會請優先留給女生

• 座位請優先保留給女生

• 必須對 R-Ladies Taipei 有貢獻，例如：提供高品質的 3分鐘技術閃電秀

[Note]
這次其中一位講師會介紹一個已經包好的github來給大家玩，歡迎大家帶電腦一起來玩喔！

title: Book Club
description:
• What we'll do
Join us as we work through the third section of R for Data Science (http://r4ds.had.co.nz/program-intro.html) in small groups. This is a great way for both new and experienced users to become more familiar with R.

We'll take a couple weeks off for the holidays and continue with Book Club in early 2018!

All events are intended for women as leaders, mentors, members, and attendees. We are emphatically queer and trans friendly. Men are welcomed to attend as guests. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. If you would like to attend and feel excluded, please introduce yourself to an organizer.

Please bring your own laptop.

title: Aralık Etkinliği: ggplot2 ile Veri Görselleştirme + Yeni Yıla Erken Merhaba
description:
Herkese Merhaba,

(Lütfen NOT'ları dikkatli okuyunuz)

Bu ay Berk Orbay (https://twitter.com/berkorbay)'ın harika anlatımıyla ggplot2 ile Veri Görselleştirme etkinliğimizi gerçekleştiriyoruz. Öncesinde dplyr ile basit manipülasyon işlemlerinin anlatılacağı etkinliğimizin sonunda yeni yıla sizlerle erkenden merhaba demek istiyoruz.

Ocak ayında yapacağımız UI + Shiny etkinliği öncesi hazırlık tadında olacak bu etkinliğe katılanlara öncelik sağlanacaktır.

Can Holyavkin (https://twitter.com/CanHolyavkin)'in "rvest ile web scraping ve ggmap ile görselleştirme" , Türkan Sevgili'nin "ggplot2" kullanımlardan bahsedeceği, dönemin ilk Lightning Talk'larını gerçekleştireceğimiz bol bilgilendirmeli, eğlenmeli eğitime sizleri bekliyoruz!

Katılımcıların laptop ve şarj aletleri ile gelmeleri, bilgisayarlarında R ve R Studio'nun kurulu olması, tidyverse paketinin yüklü olması beklenmektedir.

NOT: Kısıtlı bir eğitim alanımız olduğu için eğitimlere KADIN ve LGBTI katılımcılar haricindekilerin gelmek istedikleri takdirde mail atmalarını ve durumu sormalarını rica ediyoruz. Geleceklerini belirtip sonradan gelemeyecek olan arkadaşlar da RSVP seçeneklerini değiştirirlerse, katılmak isteyenlere yer açılmış olur. Listede ismi yazılı olmayanlar etkinlik alanına alınmayacaklardır. Etkinlik alanına belirtilen saatten önce gelmemeniz önemle rica olunur.

R indirmek için: https://cran.r-project.org (https://cran.r-project.org/)

R Studio indirmek için: https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/

tidyverse indirmek için: install.packages("tidyverse), library(tidyverse)

Etkinliğe gelmeden bu anketi doldurmanızı rica ediyoruz: anket linki (https://goo.gl/forms/FNmqh4u6ZlQ7gTAB3)

title: ¡Segunda reunión R-Ladies CDMX!
description:
¡Ya llegó por fin! Nuestro segundo encuentro de RLadiesCDMX será el jueves 14 de diciembre a partir de las 19:30 en el generoso espacio que nos prestó Cardumen Co-Working (http://www.cardumen.mx/) (http://www.cardumen.mx)!

En esta reunión podrás escuchar sobre pronósticos probabilísticos con R, convivir con otrxs interesadxs en R mientras con pizzas y chelas ¡y aprender herramientas novedosas de visualización en R!

IMPORTANTE: La asistencia es gratuita; pero el espacio limitado a 50 participantes. Asegura tu lugar inscribiéndote al meetup y si sabes que no podrás ir, desinscríbete para que otrxs puedan ocupar tu lugar.

Orden del día

• 19:30 - 19:50: Plática por Diana Lucatero: Cómo un reverendo del siglo XVIII te está ayudando hoy a decidir si debes cargar tu sombrilla: Sobre el uso del Teorema de Bayes en meteorología, pronósticos probabilísticos, verificación y R!

• 19:50-20:10 Networking con pizza-chelas patrocinadas por el R Consortium.

• 20:10-21:00 Taller de visualización. Cómo contar una historia con datos (OJO: traigan sus laptops con R (https://cran.r-project.org/mirrors.html) y RStudio (https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/) instalados)

Y recuerda que nuestro objetivo principal es crear comunidad, así que no te preocupes si tienes muchísima o muy poca experiencia.

De nuevo, gracias a Cardumen Co-working y R Consortium por su apoyo para esta reunión.

title: Data types, indexing, cleaning and preparation - for beginners!
description:
The next meetup is on December 14. This is suitable for beginners - it is a good continuation of the beginners' workshop this fall.

During the session we solidify our knowledge of fundamental data structures in R and then learn efficient approaches of preparing data sets for analysis. First topic is very important for beginners: we must clearly understand how data are stored in R.
Here we will discuss basic data types (vectors of logical, integer, numeric, character values) and more advanced types (lists and data frames). Also we will touch element indexing in R (e.g. why there are three ways to extract elements from a list: dollar sign, square brackets and double square brackets).

Second part is useful to get more efficient and faster at data cleaning and preparation. It's a common problem for data scientists: we spend about 80% of our time moving cells, rows and columns around to get them ready for a specific analytical procedure. So to get more job done we must be efficient in data management. We will look at two modern R packages: dplyr and tidyr. They are like a Swiss Army knife for a data scientist, and we have low chances to survive in R community without them. These packages allow us to produce more elegant code that leads to faster development and reduces risk of errors. 30 minutes of Excel spreadsheet tasks can be completed with 3 lines of R code with these packages.

The meetup will be hosted by Alexander Matrunich, in English.

================================================

შემდეგი შეხვედრა გაიმართება 14 დეკემბერს. ეს შეხვედრა, რომელიც კარგი გაგრძელებაა შემოდგომის სემინარებისა, ორიენტირებული იქნება დამწყებებზე. ამ სესიაზე გავამყარებთ ჩვენს ცოდნას მონაცემთა სტრუქტურაზე და ვისწავლით სასარგებლო გზებს მონაცემების მოსამზადებლად ანალიზისთვის. პირველი თემა ძალიან მნიშვნელოვანია დამწყბეთათვის: ჩვენ კარგად უნდა გავიგოთ, თუ როგორაა მონაცემები დახარისხებული R-ში. განვიხილავთ მონაცემთა საბაზისო და უფრო რთულ ტიპებს. ასევე შევეხებით ინდექსირებას. მეორე ნაწილი შეეხება მონაცემების სწრაფ გაწმენდასა და მომზადებას. ეს მონაცემთა მეცნიერებისთვის ცნობილი პრობლემაა: ჩვენ ჩვენი დროის 80%–ს სწორედ მონაცემთა მომზადებაში ვხარჯავთ კონკრეტული ანალიზისთვის. ჩვენ გამოვიყენებთ ორ თანამედროვე პაკეტს: dplyr და tidyr. ისინი ძანიალ მნიშვნელოვანია მონაცემთა ანალიზისთვის და მათ გარეშე ძნელი იქნება R-ში მუშაობა. ეს პაკეტები საშუალებას გვაძლევს დავწეროთ დახვეწილი კოდები, რომლებიც შეამცირებს მომავალი ხარვეზების არსებობის ალბათობას. ექსელის სამუშაო, რომელსაც სჭირდება 30 წუთი, R-ში შეიძლება გაკეთდეს 3 ხაზით, ამ პაკეტების კოდების საშუალებით. შეხვედრა გაიმართება ინგლისურ ენაზე და მას უმასპინძლებს ალექსანდრე მატრუნიხი.

title: R for Data Science Workshop: Programming -- Functions, Vectors, and Iteration
description:
This is the fourth meetup in a series of six workshops to work through the book R for Data Science by Hadley Wickham and Garrett Grolemund. Please bring a laptop with R Studio and R loaded up. (Let us know if you have questions or need help getting that set up.)

We'll be covering these chapters:
+ Pipes with magrittr
+ Functions
+ Vectors
+ Iteration with purrr

Agenda
+ 6:30 - 7pm : Dinner and Networking
+ 7 - 8:30pm : Workshop

title: Intro to R Markdown + Collaborative Coding Activity w/Kaylene McClanahan
description:
At this meetup, Kaylene McClanahan will lead us through our first collaborative coding activity! Kaylene will briefly introduce us to R Markdown (a great tool for easily annotating your code, sharing it with others, and turning your results into reports), and then we will work together in small groups to address a highly important and socially relevant question--where can you find NYC's most raging parties?

We know the idea of coding with others can be daunting, but this is a safe space and everyone is welcome (even if you do not know how to use R yet). In fact, each group will be assigned a more experienced R user so this will be a great opportunity for beginners to see how other people deal with data in R! This will be a relaxed environment and a good chance to meet some of your fellow R Ladies, so please do not feel like you do not know enough to join in.

If you can, bring your computer!

Schedule:
6:00-6:10--Food and introductions
6:10-6:30--Brief explanation of R Markdown and introduction to the NYC party dataset
6:30-7:20--Groups will explore the data and use R Markdown to document their process/results
7:20-7:45--Groups will share what they did with the rest of the group (if they want to!)

title: End of the Year Potluck with PyLadies RDU
description:
The end of the year is a great time to relax, reflect and reequip. Please join R-Ladies RTP and PyLadies RDU for a potluck social including:

1) Career Advice: Led by a member of PyLadies RDU.
2) Speed Mentoring: We will use the format for PyLadies Boston
3) Plenty of time to eat, drink and get to know each other.

All events are intended for women as leaders, mentors, members, and attendees. We are emphatically queer and trans friendly. Men are welcomed to attend as guests. This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. If you would like to attend and feel excluded, please introduce yourself to an organizer.

title: Maps with ggplot2
description:
• What we'll do
Amy Szczepanski will teach us about making maps with ggplot2!

We can take advantage of ggplot2's ability to plot points, lines, and polygons to draw maps without relying on specialized GIS tools. We will combine data from several sources to make a map showing major geographical features in San Diego, median property values per census tract, and the flight paths of planes departing San Diego International airport. The presentation will start by plotting points in the (x, y) plane with ggplot2 and will review the key features of this package. Next, we will use ggmap to easily put those points in context on a map. Finally, we will use shapefiles to color in regions in our maps.

All materials for the tutorial can be found here (https://github.com/rladies-san-diego/2017-08-16_ggplot2maps).

• What to bring
laptop

• Important to know

title: R in the world of Education
description:
We are very excited to announce our last meetup of the year with Erin Grand.

Her Talk: Many schools across the country are starting to use data to help improve student outcomes. In this talk, Erin will discuss what kind of data she gets to dive into and some of the challenges each project faces. She'll talk about ways to clean messy data, how using R has helped speed up everything, and the amazing janitor package.

Her Bio: Erin joined Uncommon Schools as an Associate Director of Data Analytics in the summer of 2016. Prior to Uncommon, she worked as a Data Scientist at Crisis Text Line and a software programmer at NASA. She recently completed her masters in Data Science at Columbia University. In the past, Erin researched star formation and taught introductory courses in astronomy and physics. In her free time, Erin enjoys reading, dancing and singing loudly to musical theatre.

Agenda:

6:30-6:45pm Light networking

6:45-7:00pm R-Ladies New York Announcements

7:00-7:45pm R in the world of Education by Erin Grand with Q&A

7:45-8:30pm End of year celebration/networking for R-ladies NewYork.

We want to thank our very generous host, AT&T NYC Data Science Research Center(stats.research.att.com (http://stats.research.att.com/)) for having us in their space.

title: Communicating Your Data Science Results and Wrangling Data
description:
WHAT WE'RE DOING:

You’ll learn to use R Markdown to communicate your data science results easily. Your end product will be a website (html), Word doc, or a pdf. You’ll also learn to use R package dplyr to wrangle your data; this includes making and/or transforming variables. After the demos, we'll have some time to chat and try out our new skills.

WHAT TO BRING:

Bring your laptop. Your laptop cord and a notebook might be a good idea, too. If you can, try to install R, R Studio, and the dplyr package before coming.

VOLUNTEERS:

Amanda Doan will demonstrate how to use R Markdown and Katie Jolly will teach us how to use dplyr.

CONSUMING THINGS:

Just down the hall is a mini coffee shop. (Bring your own mug to get 25 cents off!) Feel free to bring snackies or beverages from home.

LOCATION:

Meet us in room 226 of O'Shaughnessy Science (OSS). This is connected to Owens and is part of the Frey Science Center (big cement sign out front). OSS is on the west side of Cretin between Grand and Summit. The east side of the building has an elevator and the building is ADA accessible.

PARKING:

You can park on Summit for free. The parking ramp (on Grand and Cretin) is very close to OSS and is decently priced ($1.00 or $1.50 per hour).

title: Rise & Shiny - Interactive Maps (Leaflet)
description:
December Rise & Shiny will cover topics in Interactive Maps and how to use the Leaflet package/framework in Shiny apps. We're going to try a slightly different format this month: less "lecture" tutorial, and more "choose your own adventure" tutorial. Our goal will be to publish tutorial material on Friday night, before the workshop, so that you can get a sense for what part or sections you might like to try working through on Saturday morning.

Topics of Interest:
- The leaflet package
- R packages for extending leaflet
- GeoJSON (what is it / how to create it)
- Alternatives to leaflet
- Github and shinyapps.io
- Coffee and Muffins!

Thanks as always to our sponsor, B23 - platform.b23.io

This event is open to all members of the RStats community who support our mission of increasing gender diversity in tech. If this is your first meetup with us, please take a moment to read our code of conduct (https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct) before committing to attend.

description:
Shiny is an R package to build interactive web apps. Here a simple example of what you can do with Shiny: https://shiny.rstudio.com/gallery/tabsets.html

Refer to RStudio's gallery for more examples.

In this Shiny workshop you will learn how to build a Shiny app. We will cover Shiny app architecture, reactivity and how to share your app.

What do you need?

Bring your laptop with R, RStudio and Shiny package installed.

We look forward to see you !

title: R-Ladies Launch with Hadley Wickham
description:
Hi Everyone!

We are thrilled to announce our meetup launch with Hadley Wickham. This meetup will aimed at all R abilities. For those very new to R or those who have using the tidyverse for a while, you'll still pick up some new tricks.

Please arrive at 6:00 for a 6:30 start.

# Data science in the tidyverse

The talk will begin with a broad overview of the data science process, motivated by a simple, but compelling, example. The bulk of the talk will cover the details of the process, focussing on challenges around data import, tidying, transformation, and visualisation. Along the way you'll learn some of the key principles of the tidyverse, centered around an explicit acknowledgement of the human in the loop.

While I'll be showing and talking about lots of code, no programming experience is required. This talk contains no formulas.

# Bio

Hadley is Chief Scientist at RStudio, a member of the R Foundation, and Adjunct Professor at Stanford University and the University of Auckland. He builds tools (both computational and cognitive) to make data science easier, faster, and more fun. His work includes packages for data science (the tidyverse: including ggplot2, dplyr, tidyr, purrr, and readr) and principled software development (roxygen2,
testthat, devtools). He is also a writer, educator, and speaker promoting the use of R for data science. Learn more on his website, http://hadley.nz (http://hadley.nz/) .

This meetup is being run in conjunction with the Data Science Discussion group https://www.meetup.com/Data-Science-Discussion-Auckland/

We look forward to meeting you.

R-Ladies Auckland.

title: Pubquiz navideño R-Ladies + PyLadies + OSWeekends + HaskellMAD
description:
¡Buenas, R-Ladies!

Se acerca el último mes del año y con él, lo queramos o no, la Navidad, las compras, los viajes, las cenas de empresa y el poco tiempo libre... Así que hemos pensado en hacer del meetup de diciembre un evento más festivo.

Como han hecho en comunidades R-Ladies de otras ciudades, os proponemos un pubquiz (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pub_quiz), que es un concurso en un pub (sí, el nombre es muy descriptivo!).

##### Comunidades participantes #####

• R-Ladies (https://www.meetup.com/es-ES/rladies-madrid/)

• PyLadies (https://www.meetup.com/es-ES/PyLadiesMadrid/)

• Open Source Weekends (https://www.meetup.com/es-ES/Open-Source-Weekends/)

• Madrid Haskell Users Group (https://www.meetup.com/es-ES/Haskell-MAD/)

##### Funcionamiento #####

##### Equipos #####

Se harán equipos (lo más igualados posible en cuestión de comunidades y tecnologías, que al menos haya un integrante de cada comunidad).

Cada equipo tiene que tener un nombre (que eligen sus integrantes) y lo ponen en su papel de respuestas.

##### Preguntas y respuestas #####

Las preguntas se dirán por megafonía y se contestarán en un papel. Los organizadores de cada comunidad llevarán preparadas un mínimo de 10 preguntas. Cada pregunta tendrá una respuesta única. El tema de las preguntas es tecnología (lenguajes, etc.) o preguntas sobre la comunidad.

##### Ganador #####

El equipo con más respuestas correctas es el ganador.

##### Normas #####

No se puede consultar la respuesta por internet. Seamos legales, ¡vamos a pasarlo bien!

##### Entradas #####

Cada comunidad contará con 10 entradas, para que estén equilibrados entre los participantes los conocimientos técnicos.

##### Asistencia #####

Por favor, si no te apuntas y luego ves que no vas a poder venir, ¡libera tu plaza! Por muy poco tiempo que quede para el evento. En este meetup es especialmente importante para que los equipos puedan estar equilibrados. ¡Gracias!

** Disclaimer: ¡sintiéndolo mucho no contamos con ayuda económica así que cada uno se tendrá que pagar las consumiciones que tome! ¡Gracias!

title: Intro to dplyr & ggplot2 with Marieke Jones
description:
* Updated Location * Please note that we will be meeting at Hemoshear, not VividCortex. Hemoshear is located near the other end of the Downtown Mall at 501 Locust Avenue, Suite 301. There is free parking in the parking lot.

Pipes, plots, and more!

Join us for a two-part workshop led by UVA's Marieke Jones on two core packages in the tidyverse: dplyr and ggplot2. This session is geared towards all proficiency levels in R. Whether you've just started learning and you want to know what piping is or how to make a plot, or if you're a pro and you want a refresher on writing cleaner code, this workshop will be beneficial to you. Also, there will be pizza :)

Schedule:

• 6:00-6:45 Intro to R

• 6:45-7:30 Intro to dplyr

Come to one or both!

Please bring a laptop with R, RStudio, and the tidyverse package installed before coming to the MeetUp. If you need a short tutorial on getting oriented in R and on installing a package in R, please see this YouTube video (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lTTJPRwnONE). We will be available 30min before the session starts to assist anyone with troubles installing R, RStudio, or packages.

Please download the nhanes.csv (https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ipUu6PPQJcX_QwMNWVwG2KJBWju5smrHMd9jcJwb64U/edit?usp=sharing) dataset we will be using during the sessions. Save this file to your Desktop so you can easily find it.

Follow us on twitter for more updates! @RLadiesCville

See you then!

title: Linear, Logistic, and Cox Regression: When and How to Run in RStudio
description:
Join us to learn about regression in RStudio. This month's meet up will be led by Jacqueline Kueper, PhD candidate in Epidemiology and Biostatistics at Western.

No previous experience with regression or RStudio is required; all abilities are welcome. The main portion of the session will involve step-by-step instructions on how to set up, run, and interpret results from regression models that include one and more than one independent variable. We will also cover some background on three types of regression—linear, logistic, and Cox—including when and why you might want to run each of these models. Sample code and data will be made available so that you can follow along on a personal laptop; sitting back to absorb the conversation in a more hands-off way is also an option.

Get excited! See you in December!

description:
Beginner Statistic workshop in R

Speaker: Navid Nobani

In this workshop you will learn what is statistics, how it can be useful for data analysis and why as a data scientist you need to learn it. The topics are fundamental concepts, and are focused on:

- What are variable types in data and how to deal with them

- How to measure variability and central tendency of data

- How to choose graphical presentation types based on types of variables

- Linear & regression modeling

Language: Examples & exercises will be in R

Prerequisites: Having laptop is not mandatory

Target Audience: Beginners level

Bio: Navid is a data scientist at Prometeon Tyre Group. He has a background in Industrial Engineering and is working in the data science field since 2015. He uses R and Python in his daily activities to solve business problems in the marketing area.

If you are interested, don’t hesitate to join us & spread the event to your friends too. We are looking forward to meet up with you!

title: Building Interactive Plots with Shiny
description:
WHAT WE'RE DOING:

This event will be a mix of socializing and trying out Shiny. Shiny is an R package that makes it easy to build interactive web apps straight from R. You can host standalone apps on a webpage or embed them in R Markdown (http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com/) documents or build dashboards (http://rstudio.github.io/shinydashboard/). Here's an example of a Shiny app (https://dgrtwo.shinyapps.io/cranview/) from David Robinson (the stats guy, not the basketball player).

WHAT TO BRING:

Bring your laptop. Your laptop cord and a notebook might be a good idea, too. If you can, try to install R and the Shiny package before coming.

CONSUMING THINGS:

Just down the hall is a mini coffee shop (open til 8PM). Feel free to bring snackies or beverages.

LOCATION:

We have a classroom for this meetup! Meet us in room 226 of O'Shaughnessy Science. This is the building connected to Owens science. You can park on Summit for free. The parking ramp is also convenient and decently priced ($1.00 or $1.50 per hour). The east side of the building has an elevator and the building is generally accessible.

VOLUNTEERS:

Kim Ky and Becca will be creating some basic examples to teach us how Shiny works.

title: R for Data Science Workshop: Data Wrangling in the Tidyverse
description:

We'll be covering these chapters:
+ Tibbles with tibble
+ Data Import with readr
+ Tidy data with tidyr
+ Relational data with dplyr
+ Strings with stringr
+ Factors with forcats
+ Dates and Times with lubridate

title: Retour d'expérience : compétition Kaggle avec R
description:
https://secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/4/7/f/9/600_466038425.jpeg

Mercedes Sgobba, une de nos membres, nous a gentiment proposé de nous présenter son expérience d'utilisation de R dans le cadre d'une compétition Kaggle.

Il y a environ un an, le Groupe Bimbo a lancé une compétition Kaggle pour améliorer son activité.

Le Groupe Bimbo est la plus grande boulangerie au monde.

Description de la compétition :

Le Groupe Bimbo voudrait comprendre la consommation journalière de pain/produits de boulangerie au Mexique où les produits sont vendus dans les rayons de plus d’1 million de points de ventes.

A date, les commandes quotidiennes sont calculées à la main par le personnel de livraison. Certains de ces produits ont une ‘shelf life’ d’une semaine au max. Il s’agira développer un modèle de prévision de la demande.

Points clés : 74 millions d’observations, long travail de traitement de la donnée et jonction de plusieurs fichiers, élimination de duplicata, transformation en facteurs, ACP & Corrélation de variables, plusieurs exemples de visualisations avec R, découverte de fraude et construction d’un modèle de prévisions de la demande via un algorithme, comparaison de modèles (régression linaire, random forest..).

https://www.kaggle.com/c/grupo-bimbo-inventory-demand

title: R Markdown y cierre del año!
description:
Se viene el último evento del año! Y tenemos el taller de R Markdown para cerrar con broche de oro!!!

R Markdown permite escribir informes reproducibles y dinámicos con R. Podés usarlo para incluir código R y resultados en presentaciones, documentos pdf, html, Word y mas. Este taller está pensado desde un nivel básico-intermedio, así que no te preocupes si recién empiezas a codear en R. Para aprovecharlo traé tu laptop con R y RStudio instalados (para más info de cómo hacer esto: https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B0X9hdtcUykTdy1ZaVM3S3hxQ0k .

Si creés que te vendría bien una intro a R o un repaso antes de venir, hacé click aquí (https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_buenosaires/blob/master/README.md) para ir al repositorio donde encontrarás todos los materiales de nuestros encuentros anteriores.

Después del taller tendremos un espacio reservado para hacer sociales, así nos conocemos entre todxs y podemos compartir ideas para el próximo año. Este se realizará en el restaurant del Museo Evita, el consumo aprox. es de 150 pesos y además habrá torta especial de R-Ladies para todxs!

Se vienen más detalles en unos días, por lo pronto revisá tu agenda y reservá tu lugar en el taller! Si confirmás asistencia pero luego no podés asistir, te pedimos por favor que dejes tu lugar disponible para otra persona ya que el espacio es limitado. Y si no podés asistir, el día de la reunión anunciaremos el acceso al streaming del evento.

Cualquier consulta no dudes en escribirnos por meetup, slack o fb.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

****El evento se realizará en el auditorio del Museo Evita, para llegar se toma la entrada del restaurant, el auditorio está subiendo al escalera que está a la derecha en el patio del restaurant****

*** Para asegurarte que tu notebook está lista para trabajar en el taller, si es posible, por favor, actualizá tu versión de R y RStudio. También para instalar los paquetes necesarios para el taller, desde RStudio seguí estos pasos:

1) File -> New file -> R Markdown...

2) Se abrirá un cuadro de diálogo, hacé clic en "Ok"

3) Se abrirá un script de R "Untitled 1", apretá Ctrl+Shift+K

4) Pedirá grabar el archivo, ponéle un nombre y hacé clic en "Ok"

5) Si necesitás instalar paquetes, RStudio te avisará y lo hará. Si todo va bien, al final se abrirá una ventana mostrando un documento que comienza con la palabra "Untitled". Cerrá todo, ya estás lista para el taller.

Si surge algún problema durante este proceso, avisános por meetup, Slack o llegá un ratito antes al taller así tratamos de solucionarlo entre todas****

Saludos!

title: Kasım Etkinliği: Araştırma Yöntemleri ve R ile Uygulamalar
description:

title: 3º Meetup R-Ladies Rio
description:
Damos sequência aos nossos meetups sobre R e suas aplicações!

Somente participantes com fotos, que informem documento de identificação ( RG ou CPF ) poderão acessar o evento.

Teremos palestras sobre uso de R na Física e no Direito. Porque R é para todos os domínios de conhecimento. ;)

R na Fisica

Contaremos com a Dra Clemencia Mora, que irá palestrar sobre o R em aplicações na Física.

Clemencia Mora Herrera é doutora em ciências com menção em Física pela Universidade de Genebra, Suíça, na área de Física Experimental de Altas Energias. Sua tese foi sobre a produção de életrons provenientes de decaimentos de hádrons de sabor pesado nas primeiras colisões de prótons no LHC, medidas pelo experimento ATLAS. Possui Bacharelado em Astronomia e Mestrado em ciências com menção em Física pela PUC-Chile, e pós-doutorado no CBPF para formar parte do grupo do experimento CMS no LHC. Atualmente é professora adjunta do Departamento de Física Nuclear e Altas Energias da UERJ onde desenvolve sua pesquisa a procura de física além do modelo padrão em eventos de produção exclusiva com o experimento CMS.

E com o expertise da economista Helena Riveiro Fernandes,que irá nos falar sobre:

Análise Envoltória de Dados com o pacote Benchmarking
A Eficiência dos Juizados Especiais

Helena Riveiro Fernandes é mestre em ciências econômicas pela Universidade do Estado do Rio de Janeiro. Sua dissertação foi sobre o nível de eficiência nos juizados especiais. Possui Bacharelado em ciências econômicas pela PUC-Rio e pós-graduação em Administração pública pela FGV-rio.

Atualmente trabalha como Assistente de pesquisa ll no IPEA onde auxilia em projetos de pesquisa de interesse nacional relacionados à produtividade setorial.

title: Introduction to R Shiny
description:
https://secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/4/5/0/9/600_465857673.jpeg

Hi Everyone!

This month R-Ladies Melbourne is thrilled to announce that two of our members, Marie Trussart and Soroor Hediyeh-zadeh, will be presenting an introductory R Shiny workshop!

As massive high-dimensional data are being produced, fully interactive visualisation of these large data sets becomes critical to unravel the patterns from large complexities. It also permits the user to play with the data and make the information more understandable. In addition, interactive data manipulation enables to study the behaviour of a mathematical model, as the parameters of the model are being modified which can be helpful for example in developing interactive education materials.It is even used by newspapers like the New York Times and scientific papers like Science.

R shiny is an excellent framework to turn an R analysis into an interactive web application and we will be presenting a two-hour introductory workshop to build interactive apps with R Shiny.

In this workshop, we will cover the structure of R Shiny Apps, and the concept of reactivity, where an 'event' such as changing the value of the input or selecting a row in a table, triggers a set of reactions and results in updating the output value. We will also briefly talk about ways to publish and distribute an app publicly.

A little about Marie and Soroor:

Marie graduated from the Institut National des Sciences Appliquées de Toulouse in France in the major of engineering and mathematics, and got her PhD degree on System Biology and Structural Biology Modeling from the Centre for Genomic Regulation in Barcelona. Marie has joined Terry Speed lab’s as a Postdoctoral research fellow about a year ago, in the Bioinformatics Division at the Walter and Eliza Hall Institute of Medical Research.

Soroor is a Research Assistant in Davis laboratory, also in the Bioinformatics Division at the Walter and Eliza Hall Institute of Medical Research. She joined Davis laboratory in 2014 as a UROP student, and was promoted to a RA in 2016. She is currently doing a part-time masters degree in Statistics at the University of Melbourne.

This will be a fantastic workshop and we can't wait to see you all there!

Pizza and drinks will be provided!

R-Ladies Melbourne

title: Creating an R package
description:
The possibility of organizing code in packages is one of the main advantages of R. Packages can also be made publicly available so that everybody can benefit from them. This talk will show step-by-step how to create an R package from scratch, using a hands-on example.

Read about R packages here: https://www.statmethods.net/interface/packages.html

Vincenzo Lagani is hosting this meetup, in English.

===========================
R-ს ერთ-ერთი მთავარი უპირატესობა არის კოდების ორგანიზება პაკეტებში. ეს პაკეტები შესაძლოა ასევე გახდეს საჯარო, რაც მათ ყველასთვის ხელმისაწვდომსა და სარგებლის მომტანს გახდის. ამ შეხვედრაზე გავიგებთ თუ როგორ შევქმნათ პაკეტები R-ში საწყისი დონიდან, პრაქტიკული მაგალითების საშუალებით.

დამატებით ინფორმაციას R-ს პაკეტებზე გაეცანით შემდეგ ბმულზე: https://www.statmethods.net/interface/packages.html

title: Fouille de textes avec R: expression régulier.
description:
Dans ce meetup le theme est la fouille de textes. Une presentation sur comme manipuler de textes avec le function basic de R (grep, grepl, etc...) et avec le package stringr (https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/stringr/vignettes/stringr.html) serait fait. Nous verrons comment extraire de valeur numérique et des tables dans un text. La presentation serait fait par Rita Giordano.

For this meetup will be presented a talk on how to manipulate string with R using the basic function as grep and the packages stringr (https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/stringr/vignettes/stringr.html). We will see how to extract numerical value and tables from a text file. The presentation will be performed by Rita Giordano.

title: Tercera reunión de RLadies Santiago
description:
¡Ya tenemos fecha para nuestra reunión de noviembre! En este tercer meetup nos introduciremos en el “tidyverse”, una colección de paquetes de R que hacen el trabajo con datos mucho más amigable :) Nos concentraremos principalmente en la importación, transformación y exploración de datos. No es necesario tener conocimientos previos, solo tener descargado R (https://cran.r-project.org/) , RStudio (https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/) y los paquetes que conforman el tidyverse. Para esto último, debes correr el siguiente código: install.packages("tidyverse”). También utilizaremos el paquete 'gapminder' -> install.packages("gapminder"). Si tienes dudas sobre descargar estos paquetes, ¡escríbenos!

En esta ocasión nos reuniremos en IBM, que se encuentra a pasos del metro Salvador.

Además, participará Pablo Reinoso de IBM, con una charla sobre Data Science Experience - DSX.

Trae tu computador, ya que es una sesión práctica :)

¡Te esperamos!

title: introduction <- function(machine_learning){}
description:
Szervezési részletek

A KSH-s biztonsági előírásokat nekünk is teljesítenünk kell, így most arra kérnénk Benneteket:

• a teljes és pontos nevetekkel iratkozzatok fel

• legfeljebb kedd délig

• legyen Nálatok fényképes igazolvány, hogy a bejáratnál esetleg tudjátok igazolni Magatokat.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Menetrend:

18:00 -- 19:00 Machine learning bevezető (Windhager-Pokol Eszter)

19:00 -- 19:20 Szünet (jól megérdemelt pizzázás, hogy bírjuk szusszal a végéig)

19:20 -- 20:20 Building a recommender system in R (Krisztina Shinkovych)

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Machine learning bevezető

Az első előadásban a machine learning fontosabb típusaival, algoritmusaival ismerkedünk meg alapszinten. Bemutatom az egyes típusokhoz tartozó legjellemzőbb üzleti problémákat.
Ez az előadás kivételesen nem workshop jellegű lesz, azaz nem fogunk kódolni. Az előadás célja, hogy mindenkinek legyen egy alapvető képe a különböző machine learning módszerekről és azok használatáról, hogy a későbbi meetupok során alaposabban megismerkedhssünk az egyes algoritmusokkal (akkor már R kódok futtatása mellett).

Az előadás második része angol nyelven lesz megtartva. Ha igény lesz rá, megpróbálunk a fordításban segítséget nyújtani.

Building a recommender system in R
Recommender systems are something we encounter every day from e-commerce websites, booking platforms to streaming services and this is a short introduction to what is happening behind the scenes. Using R's "recommenderlab" package we are going to build simple models that make recommendations on Amazon product dataset. This presentation offers insights into:

- what are the types of recommender systems and how do we use them
- how do we put together a simple recommender system in R using collaborative filtering technique
preparing the data,
building the model using recommenderlab,
evaluating recommender's performance and choosing the best model

title: Data Visualization
description:
WHAT WE'RE DOING:

This event will be a mix of socializing and data visualization. If you don't have a lot of experience with R, data viz is a fun way to get going. I think we will cover plotting in base R and get into ggplot a bit. I'm happy to add another topic if you have any ideas! This is a safe, non-competitive environment to try new things.

WHAT TO BRING:

Bring your laptop. Your laptop cord and a notebook might be a good idea, too. If you have any cool data sets, bring 'em!

CONSUMING THINGS:

Just down the hall is a mini coffee shop. You can get your espresso, drip coffee, tea, and other snacks there for cheap. (Bring your own mug and you get $0.25 off!)

LOCATION:

We have a classroom for this meetup! Meet us in room 226 of O'Shaughnessy Science. This is the building connected to Owens science. You can park on Summit for free. The parking ramp is also convenient and decently priced ($1.00 or $1.50 per hour). The east side of the building has an elevator and the building is generally accessible.

VOLUNTEERS:

Who wants to volunteer to help out with the content for this meetup? Remember, this is a safe environment for pushing yourself. I'm visualizing (ha.) you finding a data set, creating code that produces a few important types of plots, and coming up with a list of challenges (e.g. "create a plot that demonstrates the difference in bitterness between different types of beer."). Someone (maybe YOU?) can prepare materials for plotting in base R (e.g. plot, boxplot) and another person (Katie Jolly) will prepare some materials for ggplot.

title: Tidy Data Workflows with Emily Riederer (& Conference Recap)
description:
Emily Riederer and Angela Li went to the Enterprise Applications of the R Language (EARL) conference in Boston last week, and are excited to share knowledge from the event with R-Ladies Chicago!

Angela will give a brief recap of the conference, and Emily will give a short talk she presented at the conference about tidy data workflows with a package she developed for business analysts at CapitalOne.

Emily's talk will cover best practices and lessons learned from her package development and user-onboarding experience, and demonstrate ways that R and tidy tools can be used across industries to increase analytical quality while contributing to associate development. For the full abstract, check out this link: https://earlconf.com/boston/

Schedule:

6:00-6:30pm - Food, intros/icebreakers, go over Code of Conduct

6:15-6:45pm - Announcements and brief conference recap by Angela

6:45-7:15pm - Talk by Emily

7:15-8pm - Time for questions & networking

title: Machine Learning with R
description:
UPDATES: Materials are now up on my git repo https://github.com/ksasso/MLmodels_inR_GDG2017

git clone to make a copy OR download a zip of all the files by navigating to the green "Clone or Download" button in the right hand corner and selecting "Download Zip"

THERE WILL BE PIZZA thanks to the Columbus Collaboratory!

At this meet up Katie Sasso will provide a crash course on implementing some of the most popular machine learning algorithms and techniques. Specific topics may include Decision Trees, ensemble methods (gradient boosting vs. bagging/bootstrapping), Random Forests, and Neural Networks. Attendees can expect a very high-level overview of techniques, a review of the circumstances under which they are and aren't appropriate for use, and a brief crash course on how to implement each using R!

Please note:

This meetup is not appropriate for very beginner level R users, we expect you to be familiar with fundamental R objects and functions.

Parking: Park in any spot marked "Reserved for the Columbus Collaboratory". There should be more than enough available- all are free. If you find that these spots are filled - park anywhere in surrounding lots and Katie will give you a day pass for your dashboard.

Call Katie if any issues finding it (440-452-6423).
Directions and map also available here:
http://columbuscollaboratory.com/Contact

title: R Beginners - Second Session
description:
UPDATED SPACE - please make sure to send your full name to me by COB night before so that I can add you to the list of attendees. The security officer in the building lobby will go by the list! Here we'll begin to learn about data sets in R and take a deeper dive into learning how to make graphs!
Note: this date and location is still tentative.

title: Visualización de datos con ggplot2
description:
Hola a tod@s!

Estamos muy contentas de anunciar nuestro segundo evento en Montevideo!

Natalia da Silva una de nuestras organizadoras presentará "Visualización de datos con ggplot2"

Traé tu computadora porque parte de aprender junt@s es trabaj@ar junt@as!!

Agradecemos nuevamente a Sophilabs que proactivamente ofreció recibirnos y brindarnos su apoyo.

Sophilabs (https://sophilabs.co) es una agencia de desarrollo y diseño de software con más de 5 años de experiencia ayudando a startups y corporaciones a construir soluciones innovadoras para usuarios exigentes. Desarrolla software de alta calidad utilizando tecnologías tales como python & django, elixir & phoenix, react,y angular, apoyándose en principios Lean y prácticas ágiles

title: Real usecase of applying data science on real problem-Special guest: HeartInData
description:
https://secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/d/a/5/8/600_465715896.jpeg

Ready to jump into the real world with the skills of data science? Then, this is the right event for you. We are pleased to introduce our special guest HeartInData ( https://www.heartindata.it/about-us/english-version/ ) for our next event. HeartInData is a group of data professionals based on Milan which is founded in 2016. They do data science for social good, also work with people and organizations to accomplish high social impact projects in unprofitable ways using cutting-edge technologies and data models.

They are going to share with us their experience of applying data science on a real business project. The goal of their projects was to help the company to understand its data better and find answers to specific problems. To achieve this they used various methods such as data integration, cleaning, handling missing values, data exploration, clustering, and churn analysis. So you will have the chance to see the complete journey of dealing with a real problem from the data till result delivery.

So hurry up, join us and don’t forget to spread the invitation to your friends too!

title: Writing reports with knitr
description:
I just taught a workshop at Penn that ended with knitr and all the feedback was "we want more knitr!" so I'm expanding it for the Boston crowd. The target audience for the seminar section is more toward beginners who have not experimented with knitr, but I hope folks who already use it might learn a trick or a better way to do something, either from me or another attendee.

We'll go over the anatomy of a knitr report (YAML header, Markdown, chunks, output options) and I'll demo a few reports - a very simple one and an envelope-pushing one.

I intend to leave time at the end for folks to work on a knitr project in a friendly & knowledgeable environment. SERIOUSLY: Bring your data!

Pizza and drinks will be provided by our awesome hosts!

Again I'm requesting that you share a full name through the RSVP (only goes to organizers) so we can accommodate our host's security practices.

title: Introducción a R y R Studio
description:
Curso gratuito organizado por R-ladies San José

Requisitos:

1. Inscribirse en la actividad creada en nuestro meetup https://www.meetup.com/rladies-san-jose/ ​ (cupo límitado por razones de espacio).​

2. Traer laptop con la versión de R y R Studio instalada y actualizada (instrucciones a continuación)

​3. ¡Ganas de aprender!

Otros detalles: El café del lugar está cerrado a las 6PM, pero me han dicho que podemos escoger entre ordenar café o té en grupo o llevar nuestras cosas. Por fa, cuando se inscriban, posteen sus preferencias en el evento de meetup.

Versión de R actualizada: Vamos a trabajar con la version 3.4.1. Para verificar la versión que tiene instalada puede correr en la consola:
R.Version()$version.string
La respuesta debería ser:
[1] "R version 3.4.1 (2017-06-30)"
Si necesita actualizar por favor visite la página correspondiente de r-project.org
Version de RStudio Actualizada: En RStudio busque la opción en el menu Help >About RStudio. Busque si tiene Versión 1.0.153 o mayor. Si es menor instale una versión nueva ya sea con Help > Check for Updates o visitando las páginas de RStudio para bajar una nueva versión compatible con su sistema: ​ ​ https://www.rstudio.com (https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/#download)
Si no sabe cómo hacer esto, por favor escríbanos un correo a sanjoseCR@rladies.org para instrucciones más detalladas o en Slack:

description: Come socialize and network with R-Ladies (and others) at the RTP Happy Hour. More info at https://www.rtp.org/event/happy-hour-1/.

title: Come say hello!
description:
Let's get to know one another!

We hope to learn how you use R, what you already know, what you'd like to learn, where you'd like to meet, when you'd like to meet, and what you'd like to do during meetings.

Urban Growler is woman owned (yay!) and has good food (so you can definitely participate without drinking). There's no cost for the meetup itself, but you do need to cover your own tab. Urban Growler is located in St Paul, but it's very close to Minneapolis.

We're excited to meet you!

title: Enron data series: Get your data into shape
description: The first in a series of working with the Enron data, we will download the data, understand the structure of it and get it into a format that we can use for analysis.

title: Book Club: Dear Data
description:
Hello R-Ladies!

We would like to start a book club series and we are starting with Dear Data (http://www.dear-data.com/theproject), a book about how two women (Giorgia Lupi & Stefanie Posavec) shared data visualization and collection ideas over one year through post cards.The book is largely images of their post cards back and forth with some text interludes.

The book is beautiful and would be a great addition to your library! You can also check it out from the local Austin library or you can view it as an e-book through the library, both free with your library card!

Search for "Dear Data" here on the library website: https://austin.bibliocommons.com/search

Also available at BookPeople : http://www.bookpeople.com/

For the meetup we will:

1) Start with chatting over coffee and/or beer

2) Briefly summarise the book

3) Go through discussion questions

4) Hear your thoughts on the book!

We will follow up as the date approaches with potential discussion questions.

Hope to see you there!

title: #4 - Hands-on Shiny - Lets make your analysis interactive!
description:
Dear Ladies,

unbelievable R-Ladies Berlin turned 1! Thank you for all coming to our events and contributing to the great atmosphere and exciting discussions!

R's Shiny package allows you to conveniently build your own dashboards directly in your R scripts without any knowledge of web development. Have a look at the colourful online at http://shiny.rstudio.com .

Our guest speaker this week is Jakob Graff, a Data Scientist at Babbel and an R enthusiast. Based on examples, we will first cover the basics of Shiny. You will learn how dashboards with Shiny work, and get to know common building blocks.

In the second part of the session, we will go through a hands-on tutorial based on a simple example to get you started with Shiny.

In order to get all the output bring your laptop. Please, take care that you have working and updated version of the packages shiny and rmarkdown.

We recommend checking out R-Studio (https://www.rstudio.com)'s website, as they recently published a new version of R-Studio containing a number of nice features.

Drop us a message in case you have further questions. We are looking forward to meet up with you next week!

Cheers,

Hanna, Noa, Ulrike and Christin

Organizer of R-Ladies Berlin

title: Intro to writing scripts in R and RStudio
description:
At the next R-Ladies #LdnOnt session we'll be delving into the basics of analyses and scripting in R and RStudio. Make sure to have R (https://www.r-project.org/) and RStudio (https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/) downloaded on your computer!

This event is appropriate for both individuals with and without R experience. Rachael Smyth will be walking us through basic considerations when writing a script to analyze data in R, and demonstrating best practices and techniques.

Come with R and RStudio installed if you'd like to follow along interactively, or just come to watch and listen.

As usual, we will head to Milo's afterwards for food and drinks. All are invited to join!

title: Take your R scripts to a new planet: Jupyter notebooks with R!
description:
T'agradaria aprendre a combinar els teus scripts de R amb text enriquit, explicacions de cada pas i les gràfiques corresponents? En aquesta trobada utilitzarem R mitjançant l’aplicació de Jupyter Notebook.

https://avatars3.githubusercontent.com/u/7388996?s=400&v=4

La sessió serà una introducció a aquesta útil eina de treball, començant des dels passos de instal·lació, exemples bàsics fins a casos més sofisticats d’anàlisi utilitzant dades científiques.

Tot i que donarem instruccions a l’aula, recomanem que us instal·leu anaconda prèviament. Necessitareu:

• Go to https://www.anaconda.com/download and download the appropriate version of anaconda. Then execute the downloaded sh script to install. 

• Create a new, specific R environment and install the essential r packages and the IRKernel by typing at the terminal: conda create -n my_r_env_name -c r r-essentials r-irkernel 

• Activate the environment by typing at the terminal: source activate my_r_env_name 

• Install the nb_conda package by typing at the terminal: conda install nb_conda 

• Install the plotting libraries required for our examples: conda install r-gplots r-ggplot2

Ens veiem ben aviat!

____ English version ______________________

Would you like to learn how to combine your R scripts with enriched text explanations and graphs? In this meetup, we will run R code through the Jupyter Notebook app.

https://avatars3.githubusercontent.com/u/7388996?s=400&v=4

This will be an introduction to this tool, starting from installation and setup and basic examples, and building up to more sophisticated examples with using scientific data.

Although we will give setup instructions there, it is recommended that you install anaconda in advance to the meetup. You will need to:

• Go to https://www.anaconda.com/download and download the appropriate version of anaconda. Then execute the downloaded sh script to install. 

• Create a new, specific R environment and install the essential r packages and the IRKernel by typing at the terminal: conda create -n my_r_env_name -c r r-essentials r-irkernel 

• Activate the environment by typing at the terminal: source activate my_r_env_name 

• Install the nb_conda package by typing at the terminal: conda install nb_conda 

• Install the plotting libraries required for our example: r-gplots and r-ggplot2

See you all there!

R4DS free online copy: http://r4ds.had.co.nz/

We'll be covering these topics:

+ Workflow: Basics, Scripts, and Projects

This includes chapters 4 and 6-8 of R4DS. We expect that you have at least skimmed these chapters before the workshop. We will go over the content of the chapters and then work through some exercises. Hope to see you there!

title: 如何打場黑客松
description:
1. Agenda

19:15~19:30 R basic: 遺漏值填補(Michelle)，資料型態轉換(Pepper)

19:30-20:15 如何打場黑客松@Luffy

20:15~20:30 閃電秀: 透明足跡介紹-環保相關OpenData@虹文

20:30~20:45 閃電秀: 用人話寫程式的活文件@Joey

2. Talk Information

• 如何打場黑客松-跨國OpenData的取得及使用

分享參加黑客松比賽的經驗，如何從題目發想到做出prototype可以demo，以及分享自己跨領域學程式的經驗。

• 透明足跡介紹-環保相關OpenData

「透明足跡」是一個追蹤企業污染數據與環境表現的專案，這個網站是專案中的一個工具，透過視覺化系統，使艱澀的數據更好理解，讓全民都有機會掌握環境問題，並參與監督、檢舉，找出真正的環境兇手。

https://www.zeczec.com/projects/thaubing

• 用人話寫程式的活文件

現代軟體開發講究從需求、測試、開發、文件一氣呵成，其中包含：
該怎麼將需求實例化的過程，用人話的方式描述出來該怎麼從人話來設計驗收測試該怎麼從測試來驅動開發該怎麼將人話變成活文件

四件事就是同一件事
確保沒有浪費絲毫力氣在跟需求不相干的事物上確保開發前對驗收方式的理解有共識確保隨著軟體產品功能越來越多，花費在測試的時間與成本能趨於固定

3. Speaker Information

• Luffy
背景是台大經濟所，學習程式一年，主要使用Ｒ語言，參加過三次黑客松，今年七月參加的台大黑客松，團隊獲得第三名。

• Joey
Joey，大家都叫我 91，是 TDD 的狂熱者，將敏捷精神融入到自己的生活與人生。目前在 Odd-e 擔任敏捷教練，也是台灣團隊的負責人。參加過我 TDD 培訓課程的學員已超過 500 位，也有成功協助許多開發團隊引入敏捷開發的經驗，將自己定位在催化劑的角色，擅長讓團隊無痛有感的改善痛點，優化軟體設計及各角色之間協同合作的流程。

4.Code of Conduct
基本上這是一個女性學習社群，因此若你不是女性，但出現在我們的實體聚會的話，你很可能被要求以下行為：

• 發言的機會請優先留給女生

• 座位請優先保留給女生

• 必須對 R-Ladies Taipei 有貢獻，例如：提供高品質的 3分鐘技術閃電秀

title: test_and_connect_th­e_dots()
description:
Menetrend:

18:00 -- 19:15 Test and learn -- Bevezetés a statisztikai tesztelésbe R használatával (Salánki Ági)

19:15 -- 19:45 Szünet (jól megérdemelt pizzázás, hogy bírjuk szusszal a végéig)

19:45 -- 21:00 Gráfok! (Tajti András)

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Bevezetés a statisztikai tesztelésbe R használatával

A kezdeti adattranszformációs és felderítő lépések után sok esetben szükség van statisztikai tesztek (próbák, hipotézistesztek) végrehajtására, az alkalom első része ebbe nyújt betekintést:

• szó lesz például arról, mi is az a statisztikai teszt és miért hajtjuk őket egyáltalán végre?

• mik a tipikusan tesztelt problémakörök?

• megnézünk egy-két konkrét példát szimulációval és beépített függvényekkel.

Ajánlott előismeret: a ggplot2 és dplyr csomagokat biztosan fogjuk használni, ezek bevezető szintű ismerete sokat segíthet a hatékony munkában. Ha lemaradtatok volna róla tavaly, itt (https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_budapest/blob/master/Meetup_2017_04_19/solution.R)és itt (https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_budapest/blob/master/Meetup_2017_05_17/solutions.R)találtok a felkészüléshez anyagot.

Telepítési előkészület: ggplot2, dplyr, tidyr csomag.

Az adatsorok amivel dolgozunk majd: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_budapest/master/Meetup_2017_04_19/pisa_hun_small.csv és https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_budapest/master/Meetup_2017_10_30/teszteles/data/hotels_email.csv

Kérünk Benneteket, telepítsétek a környezetet és letöltött adatsorral és szkript vázlattal ( https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_budapest/master/Meetup_2017_10_30/teszteles/R/exercises.R ) érkezzetek.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Hálózatok az igraph csomagon keresztül

Egy konferencián egy résztvevő azt mondta nekem: "Magyarországról jöttél, úgyhogy biztos értesz a hálózatokhoz." Az előadás során elmondom, hogy miért mondta, hogy mi is a hálózatelmélet, mire jó, hogyan lehet és miért hasznos hálózatokat elemezni.

A hálózatok létrehozásához, vizsgálásához az igraph csomagot fogjuk használni, azzal fogunk

• csúcsokat és éleket létrehozni és a hálózathoz adni

• éllistából hálózatot betölteni

• alapstatisztikákat számolni a gráfról és az egyes csúcsokról

• Egyes csúcsok fontosságát megállapítani

• közösségeket keresni

• valós hálózatok kialakulását modellezni.

Ne felejtsétek el telepíteni az igraph és igraphdata csomagokat!

Ajánlott előismeret: nincs.

Telepítési előkészület: igraph és igraphdata csomagok.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Természetesen minden segédanyagot megtaláltok majd utólag a weben, mégis nagyon jó lenne, ha minél többen hoznátok notebookokat, hogy ott helyben ki is tudjátok próbálni a kódrészleteket.

Hogyan készüljetek a meetupra?

Három dologra lesz szükségetek a gépeteken:

• Magára az R interpreterre ( http://cran.rapporter.net/ )

• Egy okos-ügyes fejlesztőkörnyezetre, ami segíti a hatékony munkát, ez a mi esetünkben az RStudio lesz ( https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/ )

Katılımcıların laptop ve şarj aletleri ile gelmeleri, bilgisayarlarında R ve R Studio'nun kurulu olması beklenmektedir.

NOT 2: Kısıtlı bir eğitim alanımız olduğu için eğitimlere KADIN ve LGBTI katılımcılar haricindekilerin gelmek istedikleri takdirde mail atmalarını ve durumu sormalarını rica ediyoruz. description:

Nina Jensen (https://www.linkedin.com/in/ninacjensen/) is a physicist turned quantitative analyst and currently works at AA Ireland. title: Random Forest, Climate Change and Food Production!
description:
https://secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/e/8/7/6/600_465239510.jpeg

Hi Everyone!

We are excited to announce our October event! This month join us to hear from Elisabeth Vogel, a PhD student at the Australian-German Climate & Energy College at the University of Melbourne. Her research interests are centered on climate change impacts on ecological and human systems, with a particular focus on climate extreme events and agriculture. Within her PhD, Elisabeth investigates the impact of extreme weather events on global crop yields using a range of statistical methods. Before her PhD, Elisabeth completed a degree in Environmental Engineering at the Technical University of Berlin.

Title: Using random forests to better understand the impacts of climate extreme events on food production

Abstract: Climate extreme events, such as droughts or heatwaves – have a severe impact on agricultural productivity worldwide. It is important to understand how such extreme events have affected global food production in the past in order to increase the resilience of the global food system to such events in the future. In this presentation, I will talk about how random forests - a machine learning algorithm - can help to detangle the complex interactions between climate and agricultural variables. In the first part of this presentation, I will introduce the concept of random forests, how they are used for regression and classification problems and how to build random forests in R using the randomForest package. In the second part I will talk about how I applied random forests to global climate and agricultural datasets to look at how climate extreme events affected agricultural production.

This month is also R-Ladies Melbourne first anniversary! So be sure to come at 5:30pm for cake and bubbles to celebrate with us!

Location:
This month our event is taking place at the Walter and Eliza Hall Institute of Medical Research (WEHI) at 1G Royal Parade Parkville. To access WEHI please take note of the map and directions below.

https://secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/b/2/b/e/600_465585758.jpeg

An R-Ladies member will be waiting at the Gene Technology Access Centre entry to point you in the right direction.

Looking forward to see you all there!

R-Ladies Melbourne

title: Data Dive Night with Data for Democracy
description:
We are having a very special data dive night in collaboration with Data for Democracy ( https://www.meetup.com/New-York-City-Data-For-Democracy-Meetup/ ). We are going to get together and code to continue to explore medicare spending data. Please bring your laptops to making coding and collaborating easier.

Project Description

At its heart, this project seeks to gain a deeper understanding of where and how Medicare tax dollars are being spent. Healthcare is an increasingly important issue for many Americans; the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services estimate over 41 million Americans were enrolled in Medicare prescription drug coverage programs as of October 2016.

Because healthcare spending is a very real concern, we want to make it real -- not just for people who like reading graphs and looking at statistics, but for everybody. We're harnessing the power of data and modern computing to find answers to the questions people keep asking, and to make those answers easily understandable for anyone who wants to know more; questions like:

Which conditions are we spending the most to treat?

How much are people paying out of their own pockets for prescription drugs?

What could Medicare and the American people do to save money, while also ensuring the same quality of care?

We are continuing the work of Jennifer Thompson (fellow R-Lady) as described here

https://rviews.rstudio.com/2017/05/26/civic-data-wrangling-in-r-and-on-data.world/

We also want to say thank you to Quartet Health for hosting us!

About our host:Quartet is a technology company transforming the way mental healthcare is delivered, by making it more accessible and integrated into primary care. For more information, visit www.quartethealth.com (http://www.quartethealth.com/).

title: Basics of machine learning with R
description:
The meetup is hosted by Vincenzo Lagani, post-doc researcher at the University of Crete and co-founder of Gnosis Data Analysis. His main research interest is devising machine learning and statistical algorithms, and their applications on a variety of fields, including biology, clinical and business data.
The meetup will focus on predictive analytics (classification), decision tree learners and neural networks (deep learning).
The talk will last ~90 minutes, during which Vincenzo will also show how to analyze a dataset in R.
After that the attendees should have ~30 minutes to repeat the analysis on a second dataset.
Approximate outline of the meetup:
1) Data mining, machine learning and statistics: putting concepts into context
2) Overview of machine learning tasks: classification, clustering, feature selection, association rules, etc.
3) Focus on classification: decision trees and neural networks
4) The importance of being honest: avoid overfitting at all costs!
5) Analyzing the MNIST dataset with decision trees and neural networks in R
6) Hands-on: analyzing the Iris dataset

================================

შეხვედრას უმასპინძლებს ვინჩენცო ლაგანი, რომელიც ისაუბრებს Machine learning-ზე. შეხვედრა ჩატარდება ინგლისურ ენაზე.

title: R-Ladies + Lingẅars: Taller de minería de textos con R
description:
¡Hola, R-Ladies! ¡Hola, lingwarriors!

Esta vez nos mezclamos con la comunidad de Lingẅars (http://lingwars.github.io/blog/), entusiasta del procesamiento del lenguaje natural (PLN), para hablar de minería de textos en R.

Programa:

19:30-20:00: charla a cargo de Lorena Giusio (Lingwars): ontologías desde el punto de vista lingüístico y su aplicación en PLN.

20:00-21:30: taller a cargo de Claudia Guirao y Verónica García (R-Ladies Madrid): paquetes para minería de textos en R: tm, qdap y tidytext. Como caso práctico, se hará un análisis de los subtítulos de Los Simpson. Se recomienda que los asistentes vengan con los paquetes ya instalados.

Se estima que más del 70 % de la información de negocio que puede llegar a ser útil está no estructurada, datos normalmente en forma de texto. La minería de textos provee de una serie de técnicas que permiten extraer información útil para poner medidas en marcha a partir de estos datos. En este taller, se explorarán las técnicas básicas de la minería de textos, usando el método "bolsa de palabras" (bag of words).

https://secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/6/c/8/f/600_465207791.jpeg

Sobre las ponentes:

Lorena Giusio (https://twitter.com/acetoarcobaleno) es lingüista computacional en Bitext. Es licenciada en Letras modernas y contemporáneas por la Universidad de Torino y doctora en Lingüística por la Universidad de Florencia. Ha trabajado en análisis semántico, anotación de textos, creación de corpus, NER, etiquetado POS, estudio y creación de ontologías. Actualmente trabaja construyendo gramáticas funcionales para sistemas de diálogo.

Claudia Guirao (https://twitter.com/claudiaguirao) es Data Scientist en Kernel Analytics. Es licenciada en Derecho y ADE por la Universidad de Murcia y máster en Visual Analytics y Big Data por Universidad Internacional de La Rioja. Ha impartido charlas en PyConEs, PyDay Madrid, Europython, PyDataMadrid y SpaceApps NASA Space Challenge.

Verónica García (https://twitter.com/yryaa) es Junior Data Scientist en Kernel Analytics. Es ingeniera técnica de Telecomunicaciones por la Universidad de Extremadura y máster en Visual Analytics y Big Data por la Universidad Internacional de La Rioja.

¡No olvidéis traeros vuestro portátil para aprovechar la sesión al máximo! Además, recomendamos que vengáis con los paquetes tm, qdap y tidytext ya instalados. Si tenéis algún problema en este aspecto, no dudéis en escribir a las organizadoras.

title: Collaborative Data Science with Kaggle Kernels and Datasets
description:
RLadies Los Angeles and LA Women Who Code are excited to present

Collaborative Data Science with Kaggle Kernels and Datasets

by Megan Risdal

Code and data sharing in collaboration with others is integral to open data science. On Kaggle, the world’s largest online data science community, users use Kernels as a platform to share and execute reproducible code and Datasets to access, analyze, and maintain public data projects. Since the introduction of Kernels in 2015, users have written tens of thousand of kernels in R, Python, and Julia. And in the past year, users and organizations have published over 2,000 public datasets. Over this time, Kernels and Datasets have transformed how the data science community tackles machine learning problems, collaborates, and learns. In this talk, Megan Risdal uses community metrics and insights to share what Kernels and Datasets have taught Kaggle about collaborative data science.

Megan (https://twitter.com/MeganRisdal) is a Community Advocate and Data Scientist at Kaggle. She holds master’s degrees in linguistics from UCLA and North Carolina State University.

Where: Google Venice (https://www.google.com/maps/place/400+Hampton+Dr,+Venice,+CA+90291/@33.9954407,-118.4757689,20z/data=!4m5!3m4!1s0x80c2bacf14e5fcb9:0x325955854edc3b52!8m2!3d33.9955779!4d-118.4760707), 400 Hampton Drive, Venice 90291

(Note: Enter through the gate on Sunset here: https://goo.gl/QwgtQf ).

When: Tuesday October 17th, 2017

6.00: Doors open, food and drinks served.

7.00: Talk start.

8.00: Talk end.

Unfortunately parking will not be provided, but there are public parking lots close by.

Food and drinks will be provided.

title: Text Mining with Tidy Data Principles with Julia Silge
description:
Co-hosted event with Portland Data Science (https://www.meetup.com/Portland-Data-Science-Group/) and Portland R Users (https://www.meetup.com/portland-r-user-group/) Meetups!

Julia Silge is gracing PDX with her presence and has offered to share her knowledge on Tidy Text Mining Principles! Julia is based out of Salt Lake City, Utah and currently works for Stack Overflow as a Data Scientist. She is also co-author of the book "Text Mining with R" available here - http://tidytextmining.com/

Abstract:

Unstructured, text-heavy data sets are increasingly important in many domains, and tidy data principles and tidy tools can make text mining easier and more effective. In this talk, I will demonstrate how we can manipulate, summarize, and visualize the characteristics of text using R packages from the tidy tool ecosystem; these tools extend naturally to many text analyses and allow analysts to integrate natural language processing into effective workflows already in wide use. We will explore how to implement approaches such as sentiment analysis of texts and measuring tf-idf to quantify what a document is about.

IBM is sponsoring food + drinks! We will have hearty appetizers from Elephant's Delicatessen (w/ vegetarian and GF options) and a small selection of beer, wine, and non-alcoholic beverages.

title: October R-Ladies Meetup: Tidyverse
description:
Hi everyone,

We'll be having our October meetup on the 16th of October in the afternoon. Theoni will be giving a tutorial on how to use functions from some of Hadley Wickham's tidyverse packages to handle and manipulate data. There will be something for beginners and intermediate users alike.

Best,

Megan, Wiebke and Theoni

title: R-Ladies თბილისის ახალი სეზონი (2)
description:
გაცნობითი ხასიათის შესავალი სემინარები სექტემბერსა და ოქტომბერში, შაბათ–კვირას ჩატარდება. ამ შეხვედრებზე გავეცნობით R-ს საფუძვლებს (პროგრამის ინსტალაცია, მონაცემთა ობიექტები და სტრუქტურა, სტატისტიკა, ვიზუალიზაცია). პრაქტიკული ნაწილისთვის თან იქონიეთ თქვენი ან საზიარო ლეპტოპი მეგობართან ერთად. გთხოვთ, მიუთითოთ, რომელ შაბათ–კვირას შეძლებთ სემინარზე დასწრებას (ორივე შეხვედრა იგივე პროგრამას მოიცავს, ასე რომ, გთხოვთ, მხოლოდ ერთისთვის გაიაროთ რეგისტრაცია).

რეგისტრაცია: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSd6jZBQDdt35Hg2MgsanSjgBUFxrY4ZOxwULKuWMIgXOGhMJQ/viewform

===================================
Introductory workshops for real beginners will be organised on two weekends in September and October. These meetups will introduce the basics of R (installing, data objects and structures, statistics, visualisation). Please bring a laptop or share one with a friend for practical sessions. Please choose which weekend you will be able to participate (both contain the same information so you should sign up only for one).

Information and registration: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSd6jZBQDdt35Hg2MgsanSjgBUFxrY4ZOxwULKuWMIgXOGhMJQ/viewform

title: Boo! Making GitHub Less Scary
description:
R-Ladies Austin is co-hosting this event with Women in Data Science ATX.

GitHub is used by many teams for version control, collaboration on code, documentation, and so much else. But what happens when your files won't merge? How do pull requests work? There's no need to burn it to the ground and start again!

https://secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/b/8/8/d/600_464867245.jpeg

This workshop with give you a chance to get a little more comfortable with many of the thing Git and GitHub can do and make the whole process less scary.
