title: rmarkdown for beginners
description:
ჩვენი მომდევნო შეხვედრა გაიმართება 4 ოქტომბერს, 2017. შეხვედრის მთავარი თემა არის rmarkdown-ის გამოყენება. შევქმნით ახალ პროექტს. მარტივი მაგალითების გამოყენებით ავაგებთ rmarkdown-ის ფაილებს Rstudio-ს პროგრამაში. შევქმნით ახალ notebook-ს და ვისწავლით მის გამოყენებას. knit ბრძანებით ვნახავთ როგორ უნდა შევქმნათ ახალი ვორდის დოკუმენტი და ახალი პრეზენტაცია, რომლებშიც მოსახერხებელი გზით იქნება წარმოჩენილი ჩვენს მიერ ჩატარებული მარტივი ანალიზის სრული სურათი. შედეგების PDFფორმატში გამოსატანად შესაძლოა დაგვჭირდეს Latex-ის პროგრამა. (Latex-ის საინსტალაციო ლინკი: http://latex-project.org/ftp.html ).

===================================

Our next meet-up will take place on October 4, 2017. The topic will be rmarkdown. We will begin by creating a new project, then using simple examples we will see how to build rmarkdown files in Rstudio. We will create a new notebook and see how it works. By using knit order we will produce a new word document and we will create a new presentation, showing conducted analysis in a convenient way. Also we will be able to have our output in PDF format, for this purpose you may need a Latex program (LaTeX installation link: http://latex-project.org/ftp.html ).

The meetup will be hosted by Nino Melitauri in Georgian.

title: R & R Studio Basics
description:
Welcome back, R-Ladies and allies! We will be kicking off the fall session of R-Ladies #LdnOnt with an Introduction to R & R Studio Basics.

We are thrilled to have local R-Lady and developmental psychologist, Pierina Cheung (https://twitter.com/pierinaski) leading us through a tutorial on navigating R and R Studio interfaces, loading datasets into R, and what your next steps should be.

This meet up will be held at the London Public Library (central location, right downtown) from 5 - 7 pm. Stay tuned for room location.

If you'd like to follow along during the tutorial, bring a laptop with R (https://www.r-project.org/) and R Studio (https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/) installed.

As before, following the meet up we will head to Milos' for snacks and drinks - anyone is welcome to join!

Hurrah! Welcome back everyone, and welcome to those who are just starting out with us!

title: R-Ladies Ames Welcome (Back) Potluck!
description:
Welcome back R-Ladies Ames!

We hope you are having a good start to your semester! We will be having a potluck as our first event this year to catch up and to meet new R-Ladies in the Ames area! We will provide the meat and everyone will bring a dish to pass or beverages according to how long they've been using R:

• 1 year or less? Bring crunchy snacks like trail mix or pretzels

• 1-2 years? Bring desserts like cookies or brownies

• 3-4 years? Bring salad of any variety: pasta, fruit, jello (we're in the Midwest, after all), actual salad, etc.

• 5+ years? Bring beverages like soda/pop, water, juice, etc.

Please RSVP at this link no later than September 25th: http://bit.ly/RLadiesAmesFall17

See you then!

Sam, Jacqueline, Tesia, and Jing

title: Taller de Shiny + Clínica de Proyectos
description:
L@s invitamos a nuestro quinto encuentro!

Este evento es gratuito.

La primera parte estará a cargo de Florencia D'Andrea del Instituto Nacional de Tecnología Agropecuaria que coordinará el taller "Distintas aplicaciones web con Shiny, explorando códigos" (nivel inicial/intermedio).

Es muy importante que traigan sus laptops con R y RStudio instalados (para más info de cómo hacer esto: https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B0X9hdtcUykTdy1ZaVM3S3hxQ0k .

También es muy importante que traigan las siguientes instalaciones de paquetes hechas:

install.packages(c("tidyverse", "shiny", "ggplot2", "shinythemes"))

Si creés que te vendría bien una intro a R o un repaso antes de venir, hacé click aquí (https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_buenosaires/blob/master/README.md) para ir al repositorio donde encontrarás todos los materiales de nuestros encuentros anteriores. La presentación y código para el Taller de R para Ciencia de Datos Parte I son ideales para iniciarse o repasar.

Luego del Taller de Shiny haremos un break social para descansar, conocernos un poco más y juntar energías para seguir con la inauguración de la serie de charlas Clínica de Proyectos.

Clínica de Proyectos incluirá charlas que presentarán una idea a desarrollar con R y para la cual se busca la opinión y discusión de los asistentes sobre la factibilidad del desarrollo, posibles mejoras y colaboración para llevarlo a cabo. En esta ocasión Emma Ábalos del Instituto Superior de Enfermería Artémidez Zatti presentará su proyecto "Creación de una app Shiny para la atención de enferemería".

Es muy importante que des RSVP únicamente si podés asistir porque los lugares son limitados. Si confirmás asistencia pero luego no podés asistir, te pedimos por favor que dejes tu lugar disponible para otra persona.

Si no podés asistir, el día de la reunión anunciaremos el acceso al streaming del evento.

Cualquier consulta que tengas, la vemos por acá, por el Slack (si sos mujer y aún no tenés acceso al Slack, enviános un mail a buenosaires@rladies.org), o desde las 15:30 hs el sábado 30/9.

Queremos agradecerle a EANT (http://eant.tech/home) por recibirnos nuevamente en sus aulas.

EANT (http://eant.tech/home) es una organización de escuelas especializadas en técnicas y tecnología digital reunidas para formar, entrenar y sinergizar a una nueva generación de desarrolladores digitales especialmente preparada para llevar la fuerza de la innovación a todos los ámbitos de la sociedad.

Nos vemos pronto, arrancamos puntual!

title: Eylül Etkinliği - 2.Sezon Açılışı: R Başlangıç Eğitimi (R for Beginners)
description:
Herkese Merhaba,

Eylül ayı itibariyle 9 ay sürecek 2.sezon etkinliklerimize başlıyoruz! Daha önce R kodları ile uğraşmadıysanız ve bir giriş yapmak istiyorsanız bu ayki etkinlik tam size göre!

Ek olarak "Temel Istatistik" başlığı altında bir giriş yapacağımızı da belirtmek isteriz.

Katılımcıların laptop ve şarj aletleri ile gelmeleri, bilgisayarlarında R ve R Studio'nun kurulu olması beklenmektedir.

Etkinliğe gelmeden bu anketi doldurmanızı da rica ediyoruz: anket linki (https://goo.gl/forms/FNmqh4u6ZlQ7gTAB3)

NOT: Kısıtlı bir eğitim alanımız olduğu için eğitimlere KADIN ve LGBTI katılımcılar haricindekilerin gelmek istedikleri takdirde mail atmalarını ve durumu sormalarını rica ediyoruz. Geleceklerini belirtip sonradan gelemeyecek olan arkadaşlar da RSVP seçeneklerini değiştirirlerse, katılmak isteyenlere yer açılmış olur. Listede ismi yazılı olmayanlar etkinlik alanına alınmayacaklardır. Etkinlik alanına belirtilen saatten önce gelmemeniz önemle rica olunur.

R indirmek için: https://cran.r-project.org

R Studio indirmek için: https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/

Kahve ve kurabiyeler bu ayki sponsorumuz Brokoli Labs (http://brokoli.io) ekibinden! Aşağıdaki yollardan ofise ulaşabilirsiniz!

https://secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/e/a/2/7/600_464219943.jpeg

description:
Hey Community!

Are you enjoying your summer? We are ready to announce our second meetup event which will be a practical session on R and it’s your turn to make your hands dirty in coding!

The level of this session is for beginners. You will have a guided session to work through selection of some R functionalities, data visualization and classification methods.

title: R-Ladies PDX First Meetup
description:
We're finally kicking off our first R-Ladies PDX Meetup!

Apologies for the short notice on this but rest assured there will be more meetups in the near future if you can't make this one. The goal of this Meetup is really just to start the momentum and get the group going!

Our meeting space is a conference room located in the WeWork office that has restricted public access. We have the space reserved starting at 6pm, so feel free to come a little early!

UPDATE: We will have food: Tacos from Uno Mas (http://unomastaquiza.com/ - vegetarian + GF options) and non-alcoholic beverages!

Here is the suggested agenda, times may shift depending on how many folks show up and what people are interested in sharing.

6:30 - Introductions

• What is R-Ladies?

• What would we all like to get out of R-Ladies PDX?

• Any other R-Ladies items folks want to discuss, feel free to add to the doc (R-Ladies Agenda Items (https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1fIYHe1zEoXuu7dupvh2NNqdpUJU-Ls6IQQc9DZRbcWU/edit?usp=sharing)) or contact Augustina or Deeksha.

You can also use comments in this event for your suggestions. If we run short of time, we can continue the discussion online and at a future meetup!

7:00 - Lightning talks

Around 5-10 minutes each - topic: "Something I currently do or want to do with R"

This is a very informal opportunity for anyone who wants to share something they are excited about or just wants to get more comfortable talking in front of others in a friendly space. You don't have to have slides or anything fancy! Sign up here (Lightning Talks Sign Up (https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1QlkvslwBA0HQCgv6rcsLCRQUChzNhU7EiUqUCKlxrfU/edit?usp=sharing)) or message Augustina or Deeksha!

7:30 - Wrap up!

Many thanks to Chester Ismay and WeWork for hosting our first Meetup!

Also thanks to IBM for sponsoring the food!

title: Unravelling census data
description:
We are delighted to announce our next meet up. Marian Keane will demystify Census data for us.

Census Small Area Population Statistics provide hugely useful data for each of the 18,600 small areas in Ireland. We can combine this small area data with national two-way tables, using structure preserving estimation techniques, to estimate even more interesting patterns at small area level. In this talk we will look at the estimation of “highest level of education completed” for parents of children aged 0-14, by small area. This type of analysis might support decisions on where to locate homework clubs or other educational supports.

Marian Keane is an actuary whose work is mostly in the health sector. Marian has been using R for the past 3-4 years and has learnt much from meetups of DublinR and, more recently, RLadies.

title: Plots with ggplot2 are better plots
description:
Per fi torna la temporada de Meetups!

Aquesta vegada és el torn de ggplot2 (http://ggplot2.org/), un paquet de R molt popular que permet a l'usuari fer tota mena de gràfics molt estètics i modificables. Al tutorial explicarem la forma bàsica de treballar amb ggplot2, però també presentarem altres paquets que amplifiquen les seves funcionalitats.

https://d21ii91i3y6o6h.cloudfront.net/gallery_images/from_proof/9296/medium/1447173871/rstudio-hex-ggplot2-dot-psd.png

Tampoc en volem presumir gaire però tindrem stickers molt guays per regalar! :P

Tips per assistir al Meetup:

• Recomanem tenir un coneixement bàsic de R per a seguir bé el tutorial. Si no el tens tampoc et preocupis molt, segur que aprendràs alguna cosa!

• Si vols anar seguint el tutorial pots portar el teu portàtil. Només recorda de carregar la bateria abans de venir! També disposarem de xarxa WiFi gratuïta en cas que necessiteu descarregar algun arxiu.

• Si ets un home, hauràs de convèncer alguna companya perquè et porti com el seu +1.

Requeriments:

• R i RStudio instalats.

• Instalar ggplot2, ggrepel, cowplot i reshape2.

Esperem veure-us allà!

____ English version ______________________

Meetup season is back! Yay!

This time is the turn of ggplot2 (http://ggplot2.org)! ggplot2 is a popular R package that allows user to create very nice plots that are highly tuneable. We will talk about the basic usage of ggplot2 but we will also learn about other packages that even amplify the functionalities of the base ggplot2.

https://d21ii91i3y6o6h.cloudfront.net/gallery_images/from_proof/9296/medium/1447173871/rstudio-hex-ggplot2-dot-psd.png

We don't want to brag too much but we'll have some very nice stickers to share with you. :P

Tips for attending the Meetup:

• For the purposes of this tutorial we recommend that you have a basic knowledge of R. If you don't, do not worry too much -- You'll learn anyway!

• If you want to follow the tutorial you can bring your laptop (remember to charge your battery before the event!). We'll also have free WiFi access in case you need to download anything.

• If you are a man you'll have to convince some female friend to bring you as your +1.

Requirement:

• R and RStudio.

• Install the following packages: ggplot2, cowplot, ggrepel and reshape2.

Hope to see you there!

title: R for Data Science Workshop: Exploring Data with ggplot2 + dplyr
description:
This is the first meetup in a series of six workshops to work through the book R for Data Science by Hadley Wickham and Garrett Grolemund. Please bring a laptop with R Studio and R loaded up. (Let us know if you have questions or need help getting that set up.)

We'll be covering these chapters:
+ Data Visualization with gpplot2
+ Data Transformation with dplyr

Agenda
+ 6:30 - 7pm : Dinner and Networking
+ 7 - 8:30pm : Workshop

title: developing free and open-source software for disease outbreak response
description:
Dirk is an R developer working in public health. He has previously worked for the German Robert Koch Institue on outbreak detection systems and the World Health Organisation during the Ebola Outbreak. He is an active volunteer at the R Epidemics Consortium to develop free and open-source R packages for disease outbreak response. He will talk to us about developing free and open-source software for disease outbreak response.

#RLadies

title: R-Ladies: Networking and Social
description:
Agenda:

• 6:00pm -- Doors open and refreshments

• 6:30pm -- Welcome to all R-Ladies Manchester: Introduction, Announcements

• 6:45pm -- Presentation and Discussion: Why R? An illustration through the use of ggplot and magick by Tatjana Kecojevic

• 7:30pm -- Hang around: drinks and a chance to chat

• 8:00pm -- End

We will talk about what makes R uniquely suitable for doing data science.

We’ll discuss the tools needed in a typical data science project, which will be illustrated in a small case study. We’ll exchange ideas on how we think about exploring data science and the best ways of communicating the results with the target audience.

We would love you to come and join us, bring a friend or two and share your thoughts and experiences when working on your every-day DS projects.

You don’t have to be an R user to come and join our discussion, as long as you have interest in learning, doing and getting to know more about data science and R.

All welcome!

Thanks to SpacePortX (https://spaceportx.com/) for providing the venue and making this event possible.

title: Project Night!
description:
Bring a project and help others or get the help you need! Projects can be anything - work assignment, hobby project, homework, or tutorial (or anything else - or nothing if you'd like to help others or just hang out). Pizza and beverages will be generously provided by Klaviyo.

Feel free to use the comments to coordinate with others or share ideas!

title: [Crawler] 如何用數據打造最貼心的旅遊搜尋引擎
description:
1. Agenda

• 19:10 -19:30 R basic: [敘述統計] 相關性/相關係數、時間變數的資料型態、時間序列簡單看 @Ricci/旻均/舒瑜

• 19:30-20:30 主議程: 如何用數據打造最貼心的旅遊搜尋引擎 @Mars

• 20:30-20:50 閃電秀: Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services @姿君

• 20:50-21:10 閃電秀: 用 power BI 探索資料 @Claire

• 21:10 - 自由交流時間

2. Talk Information

• 如何用數據打造最貼心的旅遊搜尋引擎
旅行是一個非常有趣的議題，背後是由極為複雜資訊所組成的無實體商品， Mars 將分享平常在工作中，會搜集哪些數據，以及如何進行推薦， 讓用戶跳脫只能比價的框架，能在Tripresso 團體旅遊搜尋引擎找到最適合他們的旅程～

• Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services
Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services 是一套集結合微軟研究成果的辨識 API，涵蓋內容十分廣泛，包含了表情與情緒偵測、視覺與語音辨識、語言理解、知識與搜尋等等，即使不懂 Machine Learning 也可以藉由輸入短短幾行程式碼，就建置出強大演算法的應用程式。 本次將介紹情緒偵測、視覺的部分，15 分鐘讓大家可以快速學會如何使用 Cognitive Service！

• 用 power BI 探索資料
懶得看密密麻麻的資料分布統計表格嗎？畫圖就對了！圖表可是速速看懂資料分布的超棒工具呢，要知道，畫圖治百病！（才怪）這次一起用 Power BI 來探索手上的資料吧！

3. Speaker Information

• Mars Weng
現任職於 Tripresso，擔任資料工程師，工作內容是旅行資料的爬蟲抓取與資料清理，以及規劃各種可能的資料整合應用。解決問題是 Mars 的核心精神，不只寫程式可以達到這個目的，培養夥伴學習程式也是一個很好的解答，目前擔任 PyLadies Hosts 之一，負責帶領初探 Python 或是對網路爬蟲有興趣的人。

• 姿君
Beseye工程師，PyLadies 負責人之一，在公司負責影像處理與 Android 開發的部分，熱愛電腦科學，期待能夠跟大家一起追求神乎其技！

• Claire
知了新聞共同創辦人，〈互動地圖：雙北所得大解密〉作者。曾任 MIT Media Lab Changing Places Group 研究助理。沒有女朋友的少女心大叔魂死肥宅。意外的（？）pH值極低。最近喜歡乃木坂 46 的生田繪梨花跟 D3.js。夢想是減少這個世界上的資訊不對稱。

4. Host information

• Host
Mia

title: R Visualization Bonanza
description:
Join us as we explore the visual world of R. One of the most powerful ways to utilize the R language is through plotting and visualization of data. At this meeting we will have a hands on tutorial on one of the most popular R package, ggplot2 (http://ggplot2.org/), led by Maureen Berg. Further we will provide time to discuss more advanced optimization of your ggplots, so come with your favorite tips and tricks to share. In addition, Rebecca Barter will tell us about her recently released Superheat package (https://github.com/rlbarter/superheat)for creating beautiful Heatmaps.

Bring your laptop with RStudio installed.

CODE OF CONDUCT

Anyone who violates or has previously violated this community's Code of Conduct will be refused entry, expelled, and/or any other action deemed appropriate by the Organizer, regardless of event registration, meetup membership or other condition.

We are emphatically queer and trans friendly.

This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. If you would like to attend and feel excluded, please introduce yourself to an organizer.

title: R-Ladies თბილისის ახალი სეზონი
description:
გაცნობითი ხასიათის შესავალი სემინარები სექტემბერსა და ოქტომბერში, შაბათ–კვირას ჩატარდება. ამ შეხვედრებზე გავეცნობით R-ს საფუძვლებს (პროგრამის ინსტალაცია, მონაცემთა ობიექტები და სტრუქტურა, სტატისტიკა, ვიზუალიზაცია). პრაქტიკული ნაწილისთვის თან იქონიეთ თქვენი ან საზიარო ლეპტოპი მეგობართან ერთად. გთხოვთ, მიუთითოთ, რომელ შაბათ–კვირას შეძლებთ სემინარზე დასწრებას (ორივე შეხვედრა იგივე პროგრამას მოიცავს, ასე რომ, გთხოვთ, მხოლოდ ერთისთვის გაიაროთ რეგისტრაცია).

რეგისტრაცია: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSd6jZBQDdt35Hg2MgsanSjgBUFxrY4ZOxwULKuWMIgXOGhMJQ/viewform

===================================
Introductory workshops for real beginners will be organised on two weekends in September and October. These meetups will introduce the basics of R (installing, data objects and structures, statistics, visualisation). Please bring a laptop or share one with a friend for practical sessions. Please choose which weekend you will be able to participate (both contain the same information so you should sign up only for one).

Information and registration: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSd6jZBQDdt35Hg2MgsanSjgBUFxrY4ZOxwULKuWMIgXOGhMJQ/viewform

title: LunchinatoRs
description:
Hosted by the Department of Ecology, Evolution, and Organismal Biology.

This is a weekly meeting hosted by R-Lady Audrey McCombs and Haldre Rogers in EEOB for folks interested in learning R and eating lunch together. Thanks to Audrey for extending this invitation to all of R-Ladies Ames! They meet from 12-1pm every Friday in Bessey Hall, room 334.

Email Audrey at amccombs@iastate.edu for more information. If you're looking to present some cool R packages, how to wrestle with analysis issues, good coding practices, data management techniques, or anything else that you find interesting and helpful when working in R, let Audrey know! They'd love to host your presentation!

title: Data Visualization with ggplot2
description:
Data Visualization with ggplot2

R-Ladies Orlando will be running few sessions for Absolute R Beginners!!

This is the 2nd part of the R for Beginners series ,it's an opportunity for anyone completely new to R to get started. If you missed the first workshop, you can still follow along as this session doesn't rely on the previous one, but make sure you have R and R studio ready to go!!

title: Primera reunión de R-Ladies Santiago
description:
¡Ya tenemos fecha de inicio!
Las invitamos a la reunión de lanzamiento de R-Ladies Santiago.
El objetivo de este primer meetup es conocernos y contarles en qué consiste esta iniciativa. Además, haremos una breve introducción a R para aquellas que están recién conociéndolo y tres usuaRias nos contarán sobre los usos de R en sus áreas: análisis de datos geográficos, análisis de textos y Data Science.
Si aún no utilizas R o recién estás empezando, esta es una muy buena ocasión para conocer más sobre este lenguaje de programación. Si eres una usuaRia avanzada, esta puede ser una oportunidad para contar tu experiencia y compartir con otras tu conocimiento.

Las presentaciones estarán a cargo de Gabriela Sandoval, Inés Varas, Roxana Trujillo, Stefanni Cavaletto y Riva Quiroga.

RSVP
¡Las esperamos!

title: repeat(intro)
description:
Szervezési részletek

A KSH-s biztonsági előírásokat nekünk is teljesítenünk kell, így most arra kérnénk Benneteket:

• a teljes és ponto nevetekkel iratkozzatok fel

• legfeljebb csütörtök délig

• legyen Nálatok fényképes igazolvány, hogy a bejáratnál esetleg tudjátok igazolni Magatokat.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Menetrend:

18:00 -- 19:15 Bevezetés az R használatába (kezdőknek)

19:15 -- 19:45 Szünet (jól megérdemelt pizzázás, hogy bírjuk szusszal a végéig)

19:45 -- 21:00 Interaktív vizualizációk készítése shiny-val

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Bevezetés az R használatába (kezdőknek) - újratöltve (Windhager-Pokol Eszter)

Mivel sok új tag regisztrált a meetup oldalra azzal a reménnyel, hogy be tudnak kapcsolódni R előismeret nélkül is az előadásokba, ez az alkalom egy új bevezetővel kezdődik. Tehát, jó hír, nem maradtatok le semmiről, nincs semmiféle programozási, adatelemzési előismeret követelmény a meetup első részén való részvételhez. Csupán elhatározásra és egy laptopra lesz szükségetek.

A következő területeken vesszük fel a lépést a régebbi tagokkal:

• mi az RStudio és hogyan használjuk segítségével az R-t,

• mi az R csomag, hogyan töltsük be és használjuk,

• hogyan olvassunk be adatokat,

• milyen R objektumok és alap adatípusok vannak,

• bevezetés az adatrendezés és -ábrázolás lehetőségeibe (főképp dplyr és ggplot2 csomagok).

Ajánlott előismeret: nincs.

Telepítési előkészület nagyvonalakban:

• A meetup előtt telepítsétek az R-t ( http://cran.rapporter.net/ )

• és az RStudio-t ( https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/ ) a gépetekre.

• Nyissátok meg az RStudio-t,

• a felső menüsorban keressétek ki a „Tools”-t, azon belül az „Install Packages” lehetőséget és egyesével telepítsétek a dplyr és ggplot2 csomagokat.

Részletesen lásd lent a "Hogyan készüljek a meetupra?" részt

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Interaktív vizualizációk készítése shiny-val - második rész (Czeller Ildi)

A shiny R csomag lehetővé teszi egyszerűen interaktív weboldalak készítését kizárólag R-ben, bármi html vagy javascript tudás nélkül. Egy interaktív alkalmazás rengeteget segíthet egy adatelemzési folyamat során neked, az elemzőnek is, de kiválóan alkalmas az eredmények kommunikálására nem technikai emberek felé is.

Ajánlott előismeret: építünk a júniusi meetupon elhangzottakra, ahol az alábbi linken a negyedik lépésig jutottunk el (https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_budapest/blob/master/Meetup_2017_06_21/shiny_steps.md), de a legfontosabbak felelevenítésével fogjuk kezdeni, így azokat is szeretettel várjuk, akik júniusban nem voltak.

Telepítési előkészület: a shiny csomag.

Github használatához segítséget Ildi tutorialjában találtok: https://gist.github.com/czeildi/0cb47aa0378c18c363bb4458caef25c3

A kiinduló könyvtárat itt találjátok: https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_budapest/tree/master/Meetup_2017_09_21

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Természetesen minden segédanyagot megtaláltok majd utólag a weben, mégis nagyon jó lenne, ha minél többen hoznátok notebookokat, hogy ott helyben ki is tudjátok próbálni a kódrészleteket.

Hogyan készüljetek a meetupra?

Három dologra lesz szükségetek a gépeteken:

• Magára az R interpreterre ( http://cran.rapporter.net/ )

• Egy okos-ügyes fejlesztőkörnyezetre, ami segíti a hatékony munkát, ez a mi esetünkben az RStudio lesz ( https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/ )

• Azokra a speciális csomagokra, amit az adott alkalmon részletesebben megismerünk: a júniusi meetup esetén a dplyr, a ggplot2 és a shiny lesz.

A részletes telepítési lépéseket Windows operációs rendszer fölött itt találjátok (https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_budapest/blob/9dc7f8e35f0467e31a814be5fc1ec033bf593630/Meetup_2017_03_23/03_23_install_guide.pdf). Ebben a data.table telepítését mutatjuk be, de a többi csomagé ugyanúgy működik.

Ha bármi gond adódna a telepítéssel/letöltéssel, kezdés előtt még nyugodtan kérdezzetek.

title: Introduction to Shiny Apps
description:
For our September meeting Katie Heineman will give us an introductory walk through of Shiny apps:

Shiny is a web development platform developed through R Studio that allows R users to make interactive interfaces for datasets manipulation and visualization. For the tutorial, I will walk the group through the creation of a simple shiny app using the R ladies dataset, and then demo several shiny apps I have created through my work in plant ecology.

Before coming please do the following:

1) Install R Studio ( https://www.rstudio.com/ ).
2) Install the 'shiny' package
3) Optional: Sign up for a *free* Shiny.io account so you can practice deploying a shareable webapp: http://www.shinyapps.io/

All scripts can be found on our GitHub account (https://github.com/rladies-san-diego/2017-09-20_shiny).

Come for R, Shiny, and snacks!

title: Presentación del nuevo curso + Contribuir a un proyecto Open Source
description:
============

¿Estáis preparadas?

Arremangáos que este año vamos a hacer mucho código en muy buena compañía, y todo esto junto a charlas de primerísima calidad.

============

Para empezar el curso con buen pie os vamos a contar como hemos preparado los meetups de este año para aprovechar nuestro preciado tiempo juntas. Hemos tenido en cuenta todo lo que se aportó en el último meetup más todo lo que hemos ido recogiendo de vuestro feedback, como siempre es lo que más importa porque la comunidad somos todas.

No os olvidéis de aportar los temas que os interesaría escuchar en el foro (https://www.meetup.com/es-ES/rladies-madrid/messages/boards/thread/51030209).

Por otro lado, el resto de la tarde lo dedicaremos a un taller de GIT y aportar a la comunidad Open Source, impartido por el genial Ulises Gascón (https://github.com/UlisesGascon), uno de los organizadores de Open Source Weekends (http://osweekends.com/), una comunidad cuyo objetivo es crear proyectos Open Source.

Traed vuestro ordenador con GIT (https://git-scm.com/) instalado, R (https://cran.r-project.org/) y RStudio (https://www.rstudio.com/) instalado y una cuenta de GitHub (https://github.com/). ¡El resto lo haremos allí! Los temas a cubrir son:

• Los básicos de GIT

• GIT + RStudio

• Open Source

• Contribuir a Open Source

• Organizar un proyecto Open Source

¡Si tenéis alguna duda no dudéis en escribirnos!

============

Recordad que nos podéis escribir para uniros al Slack de R-Ladies Madrid.

title: Jenny Bryan: How to find the business end of an R package and improve it
description:
https://secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/3/e/a/7/600_463996039.jpeg

NOTE: Places are limited, to register please get a free ticket on Eventbrite (https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/jenny-bryan-how-to-find-the-business-end-of-an-r-package-and-improve-it-tickets-37354605631). Meetup RSVP do not count as registration.

It can be hard to make your first contribution to open source software. Both for technical and social reasons. This will be a very hands-on session where we learn a bit about the moving parts in an R package and how the R community conducts itself on GitHub. We'll poke around some popular R packages on GitHub and go over how to create a high quality issue, e.g. a feature request or bug report. We'll walk through the process of bringing a package into your local environment, making a small change, and sending a pull request. You're encouraged to bring a laptop that's ready for work with R, RStudio, Git, and GitHub (basically this:

http://happygitwithr.com/workshops.html#pre-workshop-set-up

). If that's too daunting, don't be discouraged. Come as you are and you can watch me and a friendly neighbor walk through the steps.

Speaker: Jenny Bryan

Bio: Jenny is a recovering biostatistician who takes special delight in eliminating the small agonies of data analysis. Specific tools and mental models can make it easier for a data analyst to settle into a productive, alpha-to-omega workflow. She's been using R/S for over 20 years and is an Ordinary Member of the R Foundation. Jenny is working as a developer for RStudio and is Associate Professor of Statistics (on leave) at the University of British Columbia. She serves in the leadership of rOpenSci and Forwards.

Venue: Room TBC

Sponsor: TBD (want to sponsor this meetup? Contact us!)

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

Code of Conduct

: We expect all attendees to abide & be governed by our community CoC (

https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct

).

title: LunchinatoRs
description:

title: Primer Meetup de RLadiesCDMX
description:
Estamos muy emocionadas de anunciar nuestro primer encuentro de chicas interesadas en el lenguaje de programación R (#rstats). Nuestro objetivo principal es crear comunidad, así que no te preocupes si tienes muchísima o muy poca experiencia, la onda es conocernos y buscar formas de apoyarnos mutuamente para aprender más.

Gracias a Google México (y el contacto vía TheDataPub), la cita será en Centraal, el jueves 31 de agosto a partir de las 19:00.

• 9:20 - ... : Networking con chelas y pizzas (¡tal vez consigamos sponsors!)

title: Primer Meetup de RLadies Montevideo!
description:
Hola a tod@s!

Estamos muy contentas de anunciar nuestro primer evento en Montevideo!

Nuestras speakers:

Carolina Crisci es bióloga de formación. Fue Ayudante por algunos años en el Laboratorio de Probabilidad y Estadística del Instituto de Matemática en la Facultad de Ingeniería donde comenzó a trabajar en la aplicación de modelización estadística a problemas biológicos. Siempre con la perspectiva de combinar la Biología y la Estadística, se formó como Doctora en Oceanografía en la Université de la Méditerranée (Francia) y al volver a Uruguay realizó un postdoc en el área de Ecología Acuática. Actualmente es Profesora Adjunta en el Centro Universitario Regional del Este (Rocha), donde forma parte del grupo Modelización y Análisis de Recursos Naturales.

María Eugenia Riaño es docente del Departamento de Métodos Cuantitativos de la Facultad de Ciencias Económicas. Trabaja en el área de Muestreo, y ha participado de varios proyectos vinculados al área. También trabajó en el Instituto Nacional de Estadística, encargándose del muestra de la Encuesta Continua de Hogares. Sus intereses son muestreo y estadística espacial.

Natalia Berberian y Alejandra Borges. Natalia es Licenciada en Estadística y Magíster en Ciencias Agrarias, Opción Bioestadística. Trabaja en el Departamento de Biometría, Estadística y Computación de la Facultad de Agronomía desde 2010. Se involucró en el uso de modelos espaciales en el contexto de diseño de experimentos en su tesis de Maestría. Alejandra es Ingeniera Agrónoma y Magíster en Ciencias Agrarias, Opción Ciencias Vegetales. Actualmente está realizando un Doctorado en Ciencias Agrarias. Trabaja en el Departamento de Biometría, Estadística y Computación de la Facultad de Agronomía desde 2006. Se involucró en el uso de modelos espaciales en el contexto de diseño de experimentos en su tesis de Doctorado y en diversos proyectos de investigación. Actualmente dictan un curso de posgrado en la Maestría en Ciencias Agrarias de Introducción a la Geoestadística que se ofrece cada dos años en Facultad de Agronomía.

Agenda:

19:00 - 19:20 networking

19:20 – 19:40 Natalia y Daniela (organizadoras) presentan “Qué es R-Ladies y por qué existe?”

19:45 – 20:00 Carolina presenta “Modelando en Ecología: aplicaciones usando R”

20:05 – 20:20 María Eugenia presenta "Análisis de Muestras complejas en R"

20:25 – 20:40 Natalia y Alejandra presentan “Modelos espaciales en el contexto de diseño de experimentos”

20:40 en Adelante, networking

Agradecemos a Sophilabs que proactivamente ofreció recibirnos y brindarnos su apoyo.

Sophilabs (https://sophilabs.co) es una agencia de desarrollo y diseño de software con más de 5 años de experiencia ayudando a startups y corporaciones a construir soluciones innovadoras para usuarios exigentes. Desarrolla software de alta calidad utilizando tecnologías tales como python & django, elixir & phoenix, react,y angular, apoyándose en principios Lean y prácticas ágiles

title: Introduction to R ( Part of Beginners R Workshops)
description:
Introduction to R and RStudio

R-Ladies Orlando will be running few sessions for Absolute R Beginners!! There will be a short intro to RStudio and R basics at 7:00, followed by Q&A time. This is an opportunity for anyone completely new to R to get started.

Bring your (charged) laptop and we'll help you get up and running with the software, walk you through the R programming basics, help with FAQs, point you to relevant learning resources, and any other fundamental R questions you may have!

Please make sure you have R and RStudio downloaded ready to go.

To download R, go to https://cloud.r-project.org (https://cloud.r-project.org/)

To download RStudio http://www.rstudio.com/download

Follow the instructions to download and install.

Also please create an account with Kaggle, as we are going to be using a lot of their datasets. I think you can loggin with your gmail, yahoo and even facebook account.

After we get comfortable playing with R and RStudio will start a series of workshops that will be based on Garrett Grolemund and Hadley Wickham book, "R for Data Science" http://r4ds.had.co.nz/

* Visualization: Base R + ggplot

* Introduction to tidyverse

* Data Science with R

-Import

-Tidy

Transform

-Model and Visualize

-Communicate

Everyone is welcome!

Parking at Code School:

Parking at GAI garage (accessible from South St and Summerlin St.)

After 6:00PM the street entrance on the first floor is locked,and the building can only be accessed through the garage entrances and elevetaors on levels P2-P4.

After 6:00PM you can park anywhere in the garage.

title: [Text mining] R與中文分詞
description:
1. Agenda

• 19:15-19:30 R Basic: 給初心者的統計概念與小故事

• 19:30-20:30 主議程: Word cloud in R @莊舒媛

• 20:30-20:50 閃電秀: 從外國語言到程式語言 @Pei Lee

• 20:50 - 自由交流時間

2. Talk Information

• Word cloud in R

在R軟體裡先做分詞處理，最後將結果儲存到資料庫中。在分詞處理上我們使用Rwordseg、jiebaR做分詞，依據分詞後的結果計算出頻率即可繪製文字雲。

• 從外國語言到程式語言

先分享一個免費的資料來源：全世界最大的社會事件開放資料庫 GDELT，以及實際應用。再來談談用外國語言工作一陣子後，改以程式語言安身立命的歷程：怎麼會從日文系跑去當數據分析師？

3. Speaker Information

• 莊舒媛

目前是國立臺北商業大學 研究生，在學生時期透過R軟體進行購物籃分析、關聯規則分析、網路爬蟲、LDA分析與類神經網路預測等研究。

• Pei Lee

大學主修日文跟廣告企劃，指考數學不及格，沒修過統計學，在傳產做過兩年日韓線採購，現在在當自己說出來都會心虛的數據分析師。剛過試用期不久，過著每天寫程式的生活，目前比較熟悉的語言是中文、日文、英文跟Python。

4. Host information

• Kristen Chan

title: R Absolute Beginners Workshop (Again!)
description:
****please register via Eventbrite link below****

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/r-absolute-beginners-workshop-again-tickets-36673157401?aff=es2

Our first Absolute Beginners Workshop sold out, so R-Ladies will run a second August session for Absolute R Beginners!

Want to learn R? You have come to the right place because this time R-Ladies Adelaide offer you an opportunity to get yourself involved into R - the language of data! Come and spend Thursday evening with R-Ladies at Microsoft Innovation Centre on the 24th of August.

If you have never worked with R before and want to start, this event is for you! It is expected that all attendees will arrive with a laptop (and chargers), and R and RStudio installed on their computers (please follow the instructions here: http://www.ics.uci.edu/~jutts/110/InstallingRandRStudio.pdf). We will walk you through the R programming basics, help with FAQs, point you to relevant learning resources, and any other fundamental R questions you may have!

PROGRAM:

Timings: 5.30 doors open, lightning talk starts 5.40, the workshop starts 6 pm.

WHAT IS COVERED:

Getting around R

Types of data and basic manipulations

Graphics in R

P.S. RLadies Adelaide is part of the international organization RLadies Global and aims to encourage more women to get involved in their local programming communities. We encourage all genders to attend our events, and aim always to create a welcoming environment. All talks and workshops at RLadies will be presented by women, in order to strengthen the presence of women in the coding community. We hope to see you at our next event!

title: How to analyze and combine multiple high-dimensional datasets?
description:
https://secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/e/6/6/8/600_463498984.jpeg

Hi Everyone,

R-Ladies Melbourne is now announcing its August event! In this months event we will be hosting Dr Kim-Anh Lê Cao, who very recently joined the University of Melbourne as a Senior Lecturer at the School of Mathematics and Statistics, and the Centre for Systems Genomics. She will be giving the main presentation of the evening.

Title: How to analyse and combine multiple high-dimensional datasets?

Abstract:

The advent of high throughput technologies has led to a wealth of publicly available biological data coming from different sources. Combining such large-scale data sets can lead to the discovery of important insights, provided that relevant information can be extracted in a holistic manner.

During this talk, I will introduce mixOmics, an R package dedicated to the multivariate analysis of biological data sets with a specific focus on data exploration, dimension reduction and visualisation. The toolkit provides a wide range of methods to statistically integrate several data sets at once and probe relationships between heterogeneous data sets. mixOmics has been developed for ‘omics biological data (hence the name!) but the methods are applicable for other analytical problems where dimension reduction and data integration are required. I will relate my R journey through the development of the package and share tips and pitfalls to avoid when developing large R packages.

Feel free to bring a laptop to have a go at mixOmics (don’t forget to download the latest version on the CRA: mixOmics 6.2.0 ) and download the tutorial material: http://mixomics.org/wp-content/... (http://mixomics.org/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/Tutorial-Rladies.zip)­

Kim-Anh Lê Cao was awarded her PhD in 2008 at the Université de Toulouse, France. Soon after she moved to Australia and was appointed as a postdoctoral research fellow at the Institute for Molecular Bioscience, University of Queensland. From 2009 to 2013 she was appointed as a Research Biostatistician at QFAB Bioinformatics where she developed a multidisciplinary approach to her research. In 2014 Dr Lê Cao was hired at the biomedical research UQ Diamantina Institute and in 2015 was awarded an NHMRC Career Development Fellowship. She very recently joined the University of Melbourne as a Senior Lecturer at the School of Mathematics and Statistics, and the Centre for Systems Genomics. Dr Kim-Anh Lê Cao is an expert in multivariate statistical methods and novel developments. Since 2009, her team has been working on developing mixOmics dedicated to the integrative analysis of `omics' data to help researchers mine and make sense of biological data (http://www.mixOmics.org (http://www.mixomics.org/)).

Hope to see you all there!

R-Ladies Melbourne

title: Data Visualization Workshop in R
description:
Data Visualization Workshop

Ever wondered about how to really think about data in R and make amazing heatmaps? Well, this workshop is for you. Joyce Robbins, Data Visualization Expert, will be working through a sample set of data and sharing her wisdom on how to build amazing visualizations. Knowledge of ggplot2 is helpful but not required. Please bring your laptops to code along with Joyce!

About the Speaker: Joyce Robbins, Ph.D., is Lecturer in Discipline in the Statistics Department at Columbia University, where she specializes in data visualization. She is a member of the R Forwards (https://forwards.github.io/) (R Foundation taskforce on women and other under-represented groups) teaching team, and elected to serve as publications officer of the Statistical Graphics Section of the American Statistical Association Section beginning in 2018. Robbins received her doctorate in sociology from Columbia University, her M.A. in sociology and anthropology from Tel Aviv University and her B.S.E. in civil engineering and operations research from Princeton University.

We want to thank our event sponsor Byte Academy for graciously hosting us!

About Byte Academy (http://www.byteacademy.co/): Byte Academy offers industry-oriented technology education with full and part-time (http://byteacademy.co/index.php/component/content/article/our-program/part-time-classes?id=44#part-time-classes) programs in Full Stack Python development, FinTech (financial technology),Data Sciences (http://www.byteacademy.co/index.php/component/content/article?layout=edit&id=80) and MedTech (medical technology). Byte Academy’s original full-time bootcamp was the first to teach Python programming in New York City. We offer comprehensive financial aid and all women receive $2,000 scholarships to Byte Academy. With our tuition deferral program, qualified individuals pay zero tuition until hired.

Byte Academy (http://www.byteacademy.co/) accepts Applications (https://byteacademy.fluidreview.com/) on a rolling basis. Sign Up for our Part and Full-Time FinTech, Data Science and Full Stack Python Coding bootcamps

title: dplyr 0.7.0 - tidyeval / programming with dplyr
description:
Dplyr is a super popular R package that is great for exploration and transformation of tabular data (think data frames), is awesomely readable, and is perfect for beginners to get productive fast. Unfortunately, some of the things that make it great for productivity and interactivity make it less great for programming - i.e. using variables to make code more flexible and reusable. This major release of dplyr has some updates that begin to address these issues.

I will give a speedy intro to dplyr then we'll go through some of the new goodies! There will be pizza!

NOTE: This venue requires full names for visitors a few days in advance. Contact me through the link on the left if this poses an issue.

title: CANCELED - Maps with ggplot2
description:
**THIS MEETING WILL BE RESCHEDULED FOR A FUTURE DATE.**

Amy Szczepanski will teach us about making maps with ggplot2!

We can take advantage of ggplot2's ability to plot points, lines, and polygons to draw maps without relying on specialized GIS tools. We will combine data from several sources to make a map showing major geographical features in San Diego, median property values per census tract, and the flight paths of planes departing San Diego International airport. The presentation will start by plotting points in the (x, y) plane with ggplot2 and will review the key features of this package. Next, we will use ggmap to easily put those points in context on a map. Finally, we will use shapefiles to color in regions in our maps.

All materials for the tutorial can be found here (https://github.com/rladies-san-diego/2017-08-16_ggplot2maps).

description:

# 本活動由台灣微軟贊助場地

# 本活動報名截止於 8/6, 上限 70 人，免費~
# R-Ladies/ PyLadies/ Girls in Tech 擇一報名就可以囉
# 只限女生報名喔

這是 R-Ladies, Girls in Tech, PyLadies 首次合辦的講座活動，議程將環繞著我們的主題「女力 x 資料科學 x 數據應用」！延續過去每個月的技術講座，除了一樣著重在資料應用案例分享外，這次跨社群的橫向交流也是一大重點。讓我們期待 3 個性質各異的女性社群可以激盪出什麼火花，也期待更多未來的合作！

Agenda

13:30 [社群介紹]
Girls in Tech、R-Ladies、PyLadies

13:45 [女力講座]
女性社群力量@Angie & Yi-chu (Girls in Tech)

14:15 [社群交流時間]

15:15 [下午茶茶歇]

15:30 [資料科學講座]
用 R 玩 Kaggle – 臉書打卡點預測 @Mia (R-Ladies)

16:00 [數據應用講座]
如何用數據打造最貼心的旅遊搜尋引擎@Mars (PyLadies)

16:30
Open Mic/擺攤

Abstract

• 女性社群力量
Angie將分享她如何從商管跨入數據分析領域，在男女比1:5的團隊遇到哪些困難，又從社群看到什麼學到什麼~

• 用Ｒ玩 Kaggle: 預測臉書打卡點
Kaggle是資料科學們最常出沒的線上資料競賽平台，在上面除了有open data 可以使用，也可以透過參加競賽練習自己的能力。這場分享將會快速帶大家用 R 玩Kaggle，挑戰2016年Facebook在網站上公開的資料，預測下一個熱門的打卡點會是在哪裡～學習如何思考問題跟解決問題！

• 如何用數據打造最貼心的旅遊搜尋引擎
旅行是一個非常有趣的議題，背後是由極為複雜資訊所組成的無實體商品，Mars 將分享平常在工作中，會搜集哪些數據，以及如何進行推薦，讓用戶跳脫只能比價的框架，能在Tripresso團體旅遊搜尋引擎找到最適合他們的旅程～

Speaker Information

• Angie
企業策略部門的商業數據分析師，經濟及企管背景出身，在公司內部以資料分析挖掘問題，並推行如流程改善等解決方案。喜歡參與社群活動與各領域朋友們交流經驗，學習從不同的角度看世界。

• Yi-Chu Chen
現職是鹿羊科技的專案經理，算是一個什麼都需要做一點的工程師，在大學唸電子工程，研究所唸影像處理和機器學習，不過畢業當時，還沒有相關需求的職缺，就進入網路業，開始不斷學習的過程（不斷轉換語言跟框架），最喜歡網路將大家連在一起的特性，平常除了學習新技術外，也喜歡和來自不同背景的人溝通，希望能讓大家使用科技的門檻降低。

• Mia
現於Linker Networks擔任資料科學家，過去擔任過資料分析顧問，透過演算法以及機器學習去解決生活中/商業中會遇到的問題。曾於R-Ladies 柏林、里斯本跟台北做社群分享，現在也是R-Ladies Taipei以及Azure Taiwan Community的核心成員。

• Mars Weng
現任職於 Tripresso，擔任資料工程師，工作內容是旅行資料的爬蟲抓取與資料清理，以及規劃各種可能的資料整合應用。解決問題是 Mars 的核心精神，不只寫程式可以達到這個目的，培養夥伴學習程式也是一個很好的解答，目前擔任 PyLadies Hosts之一，負責帶領初探Python或是對網路爬蟲有興趣的人。

title: Hurry up! E-mail us for free tickets to attend to DDD Melbourne!
description:
Good morning R-Ladies of Melbourne,

We would like to announce a fantastic conference for developers coming soon in Melbourne. It is called DDD Melbourne (https://www.dddmelbourne.com/) which is a non-profit community event run by developers for developers!

They offer a couple of free tickets for our members. Please e-mail us if you are interested in and please do spread the word out!

Here is more detail about DDD Melbourne.

In it’s eighth year it is being crafted to be an accessible, inclusive and community conference that delivers value to all Developers!

DDD are really keen to highlight the amazing female talent that we have in tech so I encourage our members to Submit a Session (https://www.dddmelbourne.com/submit-a-session/) for speaking! First time speakers are very welcome! We will be running a Presenting Workshop for speakers prior to the event and there is an option to speak on the specialised Junior Developer track or general track. Submissions will be closing on June 29th.

General admission tickets are currently sold out but we are delighted to offer our members the option of purchasing tickets from a diversity pool until June 30th. Tickets are very reasonable at $49 for a full day event. There are a limited number of tickets in this allocation though, so DDD advise that you get on it sooner rather than later!

https://www.eventbrite.com.au/e/ddd-melbourne-8-tickets-34774084222?discount=DIVERSITY-DDD-MEL

Along with all the informative and cool sessions that will be hosted on the day, there’s also.An opt-in Ladies Breakfast (catered) on the first morning for women to meet and network with each other, and then to head to the venue together.A Relaxation Room; a dedicated room with a chill out space, volunteer staff on hand the entire day, with some “relaxing features”. A Junior Developer track, with sessions specific to Junior Developers.

For any information about submitting a topic or to chat about anything DDD, please get in touch with Ceola at ceola.flannery@gmail.com

Looking forward to seeing you there!

R-Ladies Melbourne Team

title: Launch Meetup
description:
Hello Everyone,

Thanks for joining R-Ladies! We're excited to have you aboard.

Our Launch Meetup will be August 8th, 2017 , 7:00-8:30 PM at the Iron Yard.

This is an opportunity for us to get to know each other, interact and mingle. Every R level is welcome. If you don't know anything about R programming, but have been hearing about data analysis and data science , this is a great way to start. In this meeting we will help you install R, Rstudio and Github, so that you can be ready to tackle the projects and tutorials coming the next meetups.

If you are an R expert, please join our chapter and the launch meeting, as you can help better serve our community by setting goals and priorities for our chapter. All of us, at any level of expertise will help shape the goals and direction of this chapter; so please join us!

We hope this will be a collaborative, supportive space to get to know other folks doing work in R, hear about interesting projects, and find your community and collaborators.

Check out our website (http://rladies.org/) to learn more about R-Ladies and here is our code of conduct (https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct)

The tentative agenda includes:

7:00 PM - 7:30 PM - Arrive & Enjoy snacks and drinks

7:30 PM - 8:00 PM - Short presentation & discussion

• Intro to R-Ladies

• What is R? why do I need it?

• Open discussion for future Meetup ideas!

8:00 PM - 8:30 PM - Install R, R Studio and Github.

Please RSVP so that I can plan seating, food and raffle prizes.

Again, thank you for your support and looking forward to meeting you all.

And special thank you to the Iron Yard for giving us a space to use.

Kathy

R-Ladies Orlando

title: Taller de Datos Geográficos con R + Intro a Shiny
description:
L@s invitamos a nuestro cuarto encuentro!

Este evento es gratuito.

La primera parte estará a cargo de Priscilla Minotti de la Universidad de San Martín que coordinará un taller para analizar datos geográficos con R (nivel incial).

Priscilla nos guiará para resolver cuatro problemas cortos: 1. Importar y visualizar datos de polígonos, 2. Asociar datos de otra tabla a los polígonos, 3. Importar y visualizar rasters y 4. Transformar datos raster en matriz de datos por píxeles para analizar con metodos tradicionales.

Es muy importante que traigan sus laptops con R y RStudio instalados (para más info de cómo hacer esto: https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B0X9hdtcUykTdy1ZaVM3S3hxQ0k ).

También es muy importante que traigan las siguientes instalaciones de paquetes hechas:

install.packages(c("tidyverse", "rgdal", "sp", "raster", "tmap"))

Si creés que te vendría bien una intro a R o un repasito antes de venir, hacé click aquí (https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_buenosaires/blob/master/README.md) para ir al repositorio donde encontrarás todos los materiales de nuestros encuentros anteriores. La presentación y código para el Taller de R para Ciencia de Datos Parte I son ideales para iniciarse o repasar.

Luego del Taller de Datos Geográficos haremos un pequeño break social para descansar, conocernos un poco más y juntar energías para seguir con una charla a cargo de Florencia D'Andrea del Instituto Nacional de Tecnología Agropecuaria.

Flor presentará "Haciendo Brillar tus Datos", una introducción al paquete Shiny (o cómo desarrollar aplicaciones web a partir de tus bases de datos y scripts). La charla será para nivel intermedio/avanzado.

Nuestros últimos encuentros fueron un éxito a sala llena. Es muy importante que des RSVP únicamente si podés asistir porque los lugares son limitados. Si confirmás asistencia pero luego no podés asistir, te pedimos por favor que dejes tu lugar disponible para otra persona.

Cualquier consulta que tengas, la vemos por acá, por el Slack (si sos mujer y aún no tenés acceso al Slack, enviános un mail a buenosaires@rladies.org), o desde las 14:30 hs el sábado 5/8.

Queremos agradecerle a EANT (http://eant.tech/home) por recibirnos nuevamente en sus aulas.

EANT (http://eant.tech/home) es una organización de escuelas especializadas en técnicas y tecnología digital reunidas para formar, entrenar y sinergizar a una nueva generación de desarrolladores digitales especialmente preparada para llevar la fuerza de la innovación a todos los ámbitos de la sociedad.

Nos vemos pronto, arrancamos puntual!

title: R Absolute Beginners Workshop
description:

R-Ladies will run an August session for Absolute R Beginners!

Want to learn R? You have come to the right place because this time R-Ladies Adelaide offer you an opportunity to get yourself involved into R - the language of data! Come and spend Thursday evening with R-Ladies at Microsoft Innovation Centre on 3rd of August.

Getting around R

title: Introduction to Shiny App
description:
Jim Hughes, a visiting PhD student from University of South Australia offered to give a Shiny App workshop. Join us to learn more about Shiny apps!

Get materials here:

https://www.dropbox.com/sh/o5zgygc5aoor36z/AABI0oDi8ObIa18cziV5-Q4sa?dl=0

With the use of the Shiny package for the R programming language, users are able to make interactive web applications that can be a powerful tool for sharing and communication of research. The package provides tools for shaping a user-interface and providing reactive elements dependent on user input. This is all achieved while maintaining the functionality and flexibility of R. This 2 hour workshop will serve as an introduction to the Shiny framework, demonstrating some of its uses. It will include hands-on coding, so feel free to bring a charged laptop with R and RStudio installed.

title: 4-Week Introduction to R Workshop
description:
Hi all!

I'm leading a 4-session Introduction to R workshop!

This workshop is designed for the absolute beginners and does not require any programming experience!

Program

I will start with R basics in the first two sessions and move on to data visualization with ggplot2 for the last two. However, the content of the last session can be changed depending on the class preference.

Session 1 – Setting up R and R Studio (if necessary), R programming basics (R objects, data types (classes))

Session 2 – Subsetting datasets

Session 3 – Data visualization 1

Session 4 – Data visualization 2 (subject to change)

Where & When

From July 11th to August 1st, we will meet every Tuesday from 4 PM to 7 PM in 111 Parks Hall, College of Pharmacy, OSU

See on Google Maps: goo.gl/maps/r16Z29xBjuS2

I am expecting each session to be about 2 and half hours (but it's always a good idea to be a little flexible to allow some extra time for Q & A or issue solving).

The spots in this class are limited to 90 and the registration will be closed automatically after 90 RSVPs.

Parking

For folks that don’t have normal OSU parking, there is a guest garage located directly across the street from Parks Hall that is open to all visitors: North Cannon Garage (http://osu.campusparc.com/home/garages/wexner-medical-center/north-cannon-garage - 1640 Cannon Drive). You could also extend the parking to the 12th Ave Garage (http://osu.campusparc.com/home/garages/wexner-medical-center/12th-avenue-garage - 340 W 12th Ave). title: [Security Series] 資安與 R
description:
[Agenda]

• 19:15-19:30 R Basic @Vivian, Dana, 謝包妹

• 19:30-20:30 主議程: 如何以R做為事件蒐集及分析的利器 @方丈

• 20:30-20:50 閃電秀: dplyr 介紹 @王斯霈

• 20:50-21:00 閃電秀: R-Ladies Taipei Kaggle大賽小小心得分享 @Kristen

• 21:00 - 自由交流時間

[Talk Information]

• 如何以R做為事件蒐集及分析的利器

資訊安全事件層出不窮，在第一線的LOG蒐集即是一件需要大量投入資源的工作，而往後的事件分析及事件追縱是另一個管理問題。單就事件分析及關聯性，R是一個非常好的工具及平台。接承前一次閃電秀中說明的事件發生的始末，本次議程深入的探討如何以R來挖掘入侵事件，進而建置一個屬於自已的事件偵測機制。

• dplyr 介紹

如何迅速將資料調處到理想的樣子在資料進到模型進行分析之前有好長一段路要走，那就是-資料調處。我們將在20分鐘內體驗資料整理的辛酸，體驗資料分析90%的時間所做的事情吧!

• R-Ladies Taipei Kaggle大賽小小心得分享

你有玩過Kaggle嗎？你想玩Kaggle但來不及參加R-Ladies Taipei 2017 Kaggle 大賽？沒關係！你可以來聽聽這次 R-Ladies Taipei 2017 Kaggle 大賽選定的題目、助教攤常見問題、以及為何參賽者們都需要 Azure 的幫助 ?! 或許聽完後你也會開始挑戰你的第一場Kaggle比賽。

[Speaker Information]

• 方丈
登豐數位科技技術總監，專長為windows安全、web安全及資訊安全事件鑑識，具有CISSP-ISSMP, CEH, CHFI, ECSA, ISO27001LA,BS10012LA等資訊安全相關認證，我就是因為懶所以懂得如何讓工作自動化，也因為懶所以常用各種新的方法來讓工作更有效率，在入侵事件中最重要的一環是log分析，透過各種不同的方法快速的找出有問題的記錄，減少目前的工作負載，讓更多的時間可以用在維護世界和平上。

• 王斯霈
王斯霈勤業眾信聯合會計師事務所風險管理部門數據分析，腦袋想不開從統計系轉到資訊管理所就讀，從此踏上STAT+IT的生活。是個剛出社會的新鮮人，期望能持續朝資料科學家邁進。

• Kristen Chan
目前在Wave-In擔任資料科學家，專長是電子商務數據挖掘和電信數據分析。她樂於與 R-Ladies Taipei 的夥伴分享經驗和知識，並希望透過 R-Ladies Taipei 讓更多女性朋友不再害怕 Coding，並了解數據分析其中的奧妙。現在也是 R-Ladies Taipei Officer 之一。現任微軟 MVP 最有價值專家。

[Host information]

• Yen

title: RShiny -  How to get started  + tricks and tips
description:
Shiny is a web framework that makes it relatively simple to get input values from a web page that are readily available for use in R. Then the results of your R code can be written as output values back to the web page. All of this without having to know any HTML, CSS, or Javascript!

Given that Shiny does so much for you, it can be a little tricky starting out with the package. Together we will explore the basics to making interactive web applications.

We will go over the key Shiny functions that govern:

- Application layout

- Collecting user input

- Reactive expressions

- Outputs

Bring your laptop with RStudio installed.

CODE OF CONDUCT

Anyone who violates or has previously violated this community's Code of Conduct will be refused entry, expelled, and/or any other action deemed appropriate by the Organizer, regardless of event registration, meetup membership or other condition.

We are emphatically queer and trans friendly.

This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. If you would like to attend and feel excluded, please introduce yourself to an organizer.

title: 2º Meetup R-Ladies Rio
description:
[ATUALIZAÇÃO]
Devido à grande procura, conseguimos um novo espaço com maior capacidade! Agora estamos no coração de Ipanema - Salão Rio de Janeiro no Hotel Everest Rio, com nova data 27/07/2017 (quinta-feira), às 18:00 horas.

As inscrições estão reabertas e vão até 25/07 !
Somente participantes com fotos, que informem documento de identificação
( RG ou CPF ) poderão acessar o evento.

------------

Depois de começarmos com a Gabriela de Queiroz, damos sequência aos nossos meetups sobre R e suas aplicações!

Teremos palestras sobre ETL, Visualização de Dados e Sistemas de Recomendação.

ETL

Contaremos com Keyla Caroline Peixoto, que irá palestrar sobre ETL e seus processos.

Keyla Peixoto é Analista Business Intelligence em Nas11, onde trabalha extraindo dados, métricas e indicadores de acordo com a necessidade dos clientes.
Formada em Análise e Desenvolvimento de Sistemas pela Universidade Estácio de Sá; Pós Graduada em Banco de Dados com ênfase em Data Warehouse, Data Mining e Gestão de Conhecimento nas Empresas pela PUC-RJ; Mestranda pela Universidade do Porto.

Visualização de Dados

Contaremos com os talentos e expertises de Ingrid Luz e Natália Medina. Uma apresentação além de técnica, vai ser uma das mais bonitas que vocês já viram, podemos garantir.

Ingrid Luz trabalha com UX Design na globo.com, lidando com arquitetura da informação e experiência do usuário em uma cultura data driven.Graduanda em Desenho Industrial na Escola Superior de Desenho Industrial (Esdi/Uerj).

Natália Medina trabalha com UX Design na globo.com, onde integrou o time de Big Data. Foi bolsista no Laboratório da Visualidade e Visualização (Labvis/UFRJ), onde trabalhou com visualização de dados, e bolsista no Laboratório Nacional de Computação Científica (ACiMA), onde trabalhou com computação gráfica e simulação 3D. Graduanda em Comunicação Visual - Design na Escola de Belas Artes da UFRJ.

Sistemas de Recomendação

Contaremos também com a organizadora do R-Ladies Rio Celina Rebello falando sobre sistemas de recomendação.

Celina Rebello é mestre em Administração pelo Instituto COPPEAD/UFRJ, com ênfase em Estratégia, Organizações e Sistemas de Informação; especialista em Gestão de Projetos pela FGV e bacharel em Ciência da Computação pela UFRJ.
Possui 14 anos de experiência profissional nos setores de Computação e de Telecomunicações Móveis, em Desenvolvimento e Gestão de Projetos de Software, com atuação internacional, especialmente na América Latina. Foi professora dos cursos de extensão no NCE-UFRJ em Desenvolvimento de Software e atualmente é doutoranda em Administração pelo COPPEAD/UFRJ na linha pesquisa em Big Data.

title: Hadley Wickham: What's new in the dplyr 0.7.0
description:
In this talk, I'll introduce you to some of the new features in dplyr 0.7.0. To warm up, we'll start of with some of the smaller stuff: new verbs (like pull() and the scoped variants), new data sets, and improved support for case_when(). Next, we'll talk about dplyr and databases and the new dbplyr package. Finally, we'll finish off with the mind-bending tidy evaluation and show how you can write your own
functions that work in the same way as dplyr functions.

To get the most of this talk, you should be familiar with the basics of dplyr (e.g. the six key verbs)

Bio:
Hadley is Chief Scientist at RStudio, a member of the R Foundation, and Adjunct Professor at Stanford University and the University of Auckland. He builds tools (both computational and cognitive) to make data science easier, faster, and more fun. His work includes packages for data science (the tidyverse: including ggplot2, dplyr, tidyr, purrr, and readr) and principled software development (roxygen2,
testthat, devtools). He is also a writer, educator, and speaker promoting the use of R for data science. Learn more on his website, http://hadley.nz .

Other events of interest:
Hadley will talk about the tidyverse at the London School of Economics on the 24th July, we highly recommend to attend both events!
More info here: https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/expressing-yourself-using-r-with-hadley-wickham-tickets-35968638165?aff=es2

Sponsor:
This event is kindly sponsored by Mango Solutions.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

NOTE: Places are limited, to register please get a free ticket on Eventbrite: https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/hadley-wickham-whats-new-in-the-dplyr-070-tickets-35877882713 . Meetup RSVP do not count as registration.

Code of Conduct: We expect all attendees to abide & be governed by our community CoC ( https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct ).

title: 4-Week Introduction to R Workshop
description:
Hi all!

I'm leading a 4-session Introduction to R workshop!

This workshop is designed for the absolute beginners and does not require any programming experience!

Program

I will start with R basics in the first two sessions and move on to data visualization with ggplot2 for the last two. However, the content of the last session can be changed depending on the class preference.

Session 1 – Setting up R and R Studio (if necessary), R programming basics (R objects, data types (classes))

Session 2 – Subsetting datasets

Session 3 – Data visualization 1

Session 4 – Data visualization 2 (subject to change)

Where & When

From July 11th to August 1st, we will meet every Tuesday from 4 PM to 7 PM in 111 Parks Hall, College of Pharmacy, OSU

See on Google Maps: goo.gl/maps/r16Z29xBjuS2

I am expecting each session to be about 2 and half hours (but it's always a good idea to be a little flexible to allow some extra time for Q & A or issue solving).

The spots in this class are limited to 90 and the registration will be closed automatically after 90 RSVPs.

Parking

For folks that don’t have normal OSU parking, there is a guest garage located directly across the street from Parks Hall that is open to all visitors: North Cannon Garage (http://osu.campusparc.com/home/garages/wexner-medical-center/north-cannon-garage - 1640 Cannon Drive). You could also extend the parking to the 12th Ave Garage (http://osu.campusparc.com/home/garages/wexner-medical-center/12th-avenue-garage - 340 W 12th Ave). For those who have OSU parking, there's a parking lot for A, B and C class permits at the intersection of Cannon Dr and John H Herrick Dr.

I would like to collect information on prospective students in terms of level programming experience. Don't worry if you have no experience with coding. The course is designed for absolute beginners, however I might potentially have different suggestions for you if you are experienced with other programming languages. So please fill out this form (https://goo.gl/forms/fFD8c8HWPN7aiMY32) to give some information about yourself.

See you all in class!

title: Highlights from the useR! 2017 conference
description:

Előadók: Salánki Ágnes, Dean Attali (http://deanattali.com) (Shiny szakértő), Pafka Szilárd, Tajti András és Daróczi Gergely. A találkozót a BURN (https://www.meetup.com/Budapest-Users-of-R-Network/events/241089389/) tagokkal együtt szervezzük, tehát akármelyik csatornán jelentkezhtek, az jó. Be prepared to recall some slides of the most inspiring talks of the useR! 2017 conference (https://user2017.brussels/) (Brussels), see featured photos taken at the networking events, hear some backstage stories of the R gurus shared with us in person after the conference hours but not on Twitter yet. title: An evening with an R Lady from HaRvard: how to build your first neural network
description:
https://secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/3/3/a/9/600_462493225.jpeg

Hi Everyone,

R-Ladies Melbourne is now announcing its July event! In this months event we will be hosting an R lady coming from Harvard, Kristen Hunter who will be giving the main presentation of the evening.

Title: An evening with an R Lady from Harvard: how to build your first neural network.

Abstract: I will be giving two lightning talks. The first is on understanding the basic concepts of a neural network, and how to build a neural network in R. Next, I will discuss some underutilized R tools: the debug and profile functions. These built-in tools in Rstudio help you debug your code more easily and show you the bottlenecks in R scripts. I love interacting with the audience and answering questions, and I am also happy to discuss my experiences working in academia, data science, and software engineering.

Kristen is excited to be joining R ladies Melbourne this month! She is currently a visiting PhD student at the Walter and Eliza Hall Institute of Medical Research. Normally you can find her in Boston working on her PhD in statistics at Harvard University. Her research focuses on experimental design and causality. Before starting her PhD, she worked as a data scientist and later a software engineer for an education analytics startup. She built machine learning models to predict student performance and data pipeline and processing tools. She loves learning about new technology and bringing together different tools to optimize her work, from GitHub to the Hadleyverse to SQL.

Hope to see you all there!

R-Ladies Melbourne

title: Come and meet the R-Ladies community in Cape Town
description:
Dear All,

Please join us for the very first meetup of the R-Ladies Cape Town chapter. R-Ladies is a worldwide organisation whose mission is to promote gender diversity in the R community. There are many other R-Ladies chapters in cities all around the world. As an organization R-Ladies is fully inclusive of trans women, genderqueer women and non-binary people who are significantly female-identified, and the same stands for R-Ladies Cape Town. Please have a look at the R-Ladies rules and guidelines. (https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/blob/master/R-Ladies_RulesGuidelines.pdf)

The idea for the Cape Town chapter of R-Ladies Global is to bring together women who work with R to get to know, support and learn from each other. The R community suffers from an underrepresentation of women in every role and area of participation. You absolutely do not need to be good at R to be a part of this community.

Here is a map link (http://tinyurl.com/y8csajg2) to the venue for the meetup. We are very happy that it is so close to public transport for people who rely on it. I know we will be meeting outside peak hours. If you have any safety concerns regarding getting to the station or getting home, please get in touch and we will find out if anyone with a car is going your way and can lift you.

There will be some drinks and snacks to fuel the conversation. We will say a few words to kick off but otherwise please just come along, be brave and chat to people :)

We really hope to see you there. Please feel free to get in touch if you have any questions.

All the best,

Theoni, Megan and Wiebke

title: R-Ladies Women in Computing Seminar Series: Bioinformatics
description:
You are cordially invited to the first seminar of our Women in Computing seminar series. R-Ladies London Researchers & Students are delighted to have Dr Simone Ecker speaking about her research on "Unraveling DNA Methylation and Gene Expression Variability in Human Blood".

This event is open to everyone with an interest, especially gender minorities in academia and industry.

Please sign up on eventbrite: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/women-in-computing-seminar-series-bioinformatics-tickets-35711318515

About Dr Simone Ecker:

Simone Ecker worked as a programmer and team leader in IT industry before she studied Biomedical Informatics at UMIT University, where she received a prize for the best Master’s thesis from the Austrian Society for Biomedical Technology for her work on Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia. She went on to pursue a PhD under the supervision of Alfonso Valencia at the Spanish National Cancer Research Centre which she finished with highest honours. After completing her doctorate, she joined Stephan Beck’s Medical Genomics group at UCL. Simone Ecker’s research focuses on the analysis of biological variability in health and disease. In particular, she works on epigenetic and transcriptional variability of blood cells in the framework of large consortia like the International Cancer Genome Consortium (ICGC) and the International Human Epigenome Consortium (IHEC) to better understand phenotypic plasticity in the human immune system.

title: Tutorial: Solving iteration problems with purrr
description:
The biggest R conference, useR! (https://user2017.brussels/), is coming up! 4 days packed with tutorials and talks - but don't despair if you can't make it:

Charlotte Wickham is visiting us! She will be giving a condensed version of her useR! tutorial (https://user2017.brussels/tutorials) on the purrr package for solving iteration problems.

Charlotte is a part-time Assistant Professor of Statistics at Oregon State University, specialist in R training and course developer for Data Camp. Her DataCamp courses are Writing functions in R (https://www.datacamp.com/courses/writing-functions-in-r) - with her brother, Hadley Wickham - and Working with Geospatial Data in R. (https://www.datacamp.com/courses/working-with-geospatial-data-in-r)

Please see below for more details on the (standard) purrr tutorial including pre-requisites (hint: beginner/intermediate level and please install some packages beforehand as there is no public wifi):

Note: This a place holder- registration is only through Eventbrite: https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/tutorial-solving-iteration-problems-with-purrr-tickets-35443224639

Outline

Code with a lot of duplication is harder to understand, troubleshoot and maintain. The goal of this tutorial is help you remove duplication in your code by using functions that write `for` loops for you.

You'll learn to use the functions in the `purrr` package to perform iterative tasks: tasks that look like "for each _____ do _____".

By the end of the tutorial you'll be writing code that is more readable and easier to update and you'll be ready to solve new iteration problems faster and with fewer mistakes.

Learning Objectives

By the end of the tutorial, you'll be able to:

• Move from solving a problem on a single element, to iterating that solution over many elements with `map()`.

• Identify when to use the typed variants of `map()`: `map_lgl()`, `map_int()`, `walk()` etc.

• Iterate over two arguments with `map2()`.

• Leverage `purrr` to get list data into tibbles.

• Use `purrr` to work with list columns in tibbles.

Pre-requisites

Don't worry if you have never written a `for` loop, used `lapply()`, written your own function or heard of a `tibble`, this tutorial is designed to be accessible to beginners.

That said, you should be familiar with exploring and subsetting the basic data structures in R including lists and data frames.

This is a hands-on tutorial, you'll need your laptop with R installed, as well as a few packages:

```

install.packages("tidyverse")

# install.packages("devtools")

devtools::install_github("jennybc/repurrrsive")

```

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

Code of Conduct: We expect all attendees to abide & be governed by our community CoC (https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct).

title: SPSS to R
description:
Do you want an open source route to statistical methodology? Are you wanting to make the switch from SPSS to R? Join R-ladies #LdnOnt on Friday July 7 from 1-3!!

We are super excited to feature R-lady, Daryn Cushnie-Sparrow as she walks us through the SPSS ---> R switch. Daryn has made the switch for her own research in the Speech and Language field.

For this meet up, make sure to have the following installed if you don't already:

• R

• RStudio (https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/)

• RMarkdown (http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com) by entering the following into your console: install.packages("rmarkdown")

Head upstairs to 121 Studios of UnLondon for the tutorial and afterwards we'll try to find a patio!

See you then!

Para ello queremos contar con todas vosotras, con la comunidad, con los amigos de la comunidad, con todos los que nos han ayudado y acompañado estos 9 meses y como no, con todas aquellas que vayan a venir por primera vez, no solo para conocernos mejor, si no para tener una conversación sobre lo que ha venido y lo que llegará.

17:45 Hang around: drinks and a chance to chat

18:15 End

We are looking forward to seeing you all…

Follow us on twitter @RladiesManchest (https://twitter.com/RLadiesManchest) and @RLadiesGlobal (http://twitter.com/RLadiesGlobal), and on Github at github.com/RLadiesManchester

title: Aplicaciones intermedias y avanzadas de R
description:
Te invitamos a la 2da parte de nuestro tercer encuentro!

Respondiendo a este meetup, reservás tu lugar en la segunda parte que incluirá charlas sobre aplicaciones intermedias y avanzadas de R con la idea de compartir conocimiento y promover el trabajo colaborativo en el grupo. Arrancaremos con quince minutos para tomarnos un café/té/mate y hacer sociales para seguir conociéndonos.

Las charlas del evento serán:

• R y radares, muchos datos y algunos resultados. Presentado por Paola Corrales, estudiante de Ciencias de la Atmósfera con tesis en proceso

• Entender haciendo: Arriesgando código para descomponer papers de trabajo o estudio. Presentado por Gabriela Plantie, Data Mining Analyst de Riesgo de Crédito y Financiero

Nuestro último meetup fue un gran éxito a sala llena. Es muy importante que des RSVP únicamente si podés asistir porque los lugares son limitados. Si confirmás asistencia pero luego no podés asistir, te pedimos por favor que dejes tu lugar disponible para otra persona. Tenés tiempo de confirmar tu asistencia hasta dos horas antes del comienzo del meetup.

Queremos agradecerle a EANT (http://eant.tech/)por recibirnos en sus aulas. EANT (http://eant.tech/)es una organización de escuelas especializadas en técnicas y tecnología digital reunidas para formar, entrenar y sinergizar a una nueva generación de desarrolladores digitales especialmente preparada para llevar la fuerza de la innovación a todos los ámbitos de la sociedad.

Nos vemos pronto, arrancamos puntual!

title: Taller de R para Ciencia de Datos (Parte II) - Niveles inicial e intermedio
description:
Te invitamos a la primera parte de nuestro tercer encuentro!

Tendrá dos partes (hay que RSVP por separado!): la primera parte será para participantes con nivel de R inicial/intermedio y la segunda será para participantes con nivel intermedio/avanzado (si tu nivel es inicial también sos bienvenid@ a la segunda parte).

Respondiendo a este meetup, reservás tu lugar en la primera parte que será "Taller de R para Ciencia de Datos - Parte II". Continuaremos con el Taller que comenzamos en el meetup pasado (si no pudiste venir, hacé click aquí (https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_buenosaires/blob/master/README.md)para ir al git de las presentaciones). El tema principal será el uso de ggplot2 para visualizaciones. La principal fuente del Taller seguirá siendo el libro R for Data Science (http://r4ds.had.co.nz/) (Grolemund & Wickham, 2017).

Luego del Taller haremos un pequeño break social para descansar, conocernos un poco más y despedirnos o prepararnos para la segunda parte. Más detalles sobre el encuentro intermedio/avanzadado: Segunda Parte del 3er Meetup de R-Ladies Buenos Aires (https://www.meetup.com/rladies-buenos-aires/events/240524143/).

Nuestro último meetup fue un gran éxito a sala llena. Es muy importante que des RSVP únicamente si podés asistir porque los lugares son limitados. Si confirmás asistencia pero luego no podés asistir, te pedimos por favor que dejes tu lugar disponible para otra persona. Tenés tiempo de confirmar tu asistencia hasta dos horas antes del comienzo del meetup.

Para esta parte vas a necesitar tu laptop con R y RStudio instalados (para más info de cómo hacer esto: Tutorial para instalar R y RStudio (https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B0X9hdtcUykTdy1ZaVM3S3hxQ0k)).

También es muy importante traer las siguientes instalaciones de paquetes hechas:

install.packages("tidyverse")
install.packages(c("nycflights13", "gapminder", "Lahman"))

Cualquier consulta que tengas con lo anterior, la vemos por acá, por el Slack (si sos mujer y aún no tenés acceso al Slack, enviános un mail a buenosaires@rladies.org), o unos minutos antes de las 16:00 hs el sábado.

Queremos agradecerle a EANT (http://eant.tech/home) por recibirnos en sus aulas.

EANT (http://eant.tech/home) es una organización de escuelas especializadas en técnicas y tecnología digital reunidas para formar, entrenar y sinergizar a una nueva generación de desarrolladores digitales especialmente preparada para llevar la fuerza de la innovación a todos los ámbitos de la sociedad.

Nos vemos pronto, arrancamos puntual!

title: NASA, R-Ladies, and Austin R User Group!
description:
Presenter: David Meza, Chief Knowledge Architect at NASA (and R-Ladies Supporter)

David has been a great supporter of R-Ladies and reached out to us before we officially launched the group to see how he could help us grow R-Ladies in Texas. We are thrilled that David is going to be making the trip from Houston to speak with us, and have invited the larger Austin R User Group to join as well.

**

Schedule

10:30 - 11am -- coffee and networking

11am - 11:15am -- presentation from R-Ladies

11:15am - 12:45pm -- David Meza on Knowledge Architecture

**

Knowledge Architecture: Framework to extract and share knowledge.

In this presentation, I will introduce a framework for organizations to extract knowledge from their data and effectively present to their end user. Examples, with code, will be demonstrated to the audience.

title: Storytelling based on Gravity Anomaly Data - Thursday 29th June
description:
Sonya Abbas, Data Scientist at AdaptiveMobile, will tell an interesting story about gravity based on NASA data. Storytelling with data is essential for communicating findings effectively. We will use R to accomplish this task. The meetup will not be coding heavy, we will focus more on the process of getting from raw data to findings.

Big thanks to AIB - Grafton Street branch for hosting our meetup.

title: R Beginners - Second Session
description: UPDATED SPACE - please make sure to send your full name to yak.anna@gmail.com so that I can add you to the list of attendees. The security officer in the building lobby will go by the list! Here we'll begin to learn about data sets in R and take a deeper dive into learning how to make graphs!
