Hosted by the Department of Ecology, Evolution, and Organismal Biology.

This is a weekly meeting hosted by R-Lady Audrey McCombs and Haldre Rogers in EEOB for folks interested in learning R and eating lunch together. Thanks to Audrey for extending this invitation to all of R-Ladies Ames! They meet from 12-1pm every Thursday in Bessey Hall, room 205.

They'd love to host your presentation!

title: Time-series in R
description:
შეხვედრა შეეხება დროით მწკრივეს. დავიწყებთ საბაზო ოპერაციების გაკეთებით პროგრამაში. შემდეგ როგორც ტექნიკური ისე თეორიული განხილვებით უფრო ღრმად შევეხებით სტაციონარული მწკრივების ორ ძირითად ტიპს: ავტორეგრესიულ (AR) და მცურავი საშუალოს (MA) პროცესებს. ასევე, განვიხილავთ ჰოდრიკ-პრესკოტის ფილტრს, რომლის მეშვეობით ერთმანეთისგან გამოვყობთ დროითი მწკრივის ციკლურ და ტრენდულ კომპონენტებს. ვიმუშავებთ R-სტუდიო-ს პროგრამაში. შეხვედრის პრაქტიკული ნაწილისთვის ძირითადად გამოვიყენებთ სიმულაციურ მონაცემებს. შეხვედრა საინტერესო იქნება დამწყებთათვისაც. დაგვჭირდება “mFilter”-ის დაინსტალირება R-სტუდიო-ში.

შეხვედრას წარმართავს ნინო მელითაური, სამუშაო ენა იქნება ქართული.

==============================================

The meet-up will be about time series. We will begin by basic operations on time series in R-studio. Then by technical as well as by theoretical discussion we will go further and (1) we will analyze the basic types of stationary time series: autoregressive (AR) and moving average (MA) processes and (2) we will discuss Hodrick-prescott filter, by which we will show how we can separate trend and cyclical components of the time series. We will use R-studio. As practical side, mainly we will work on simulated data. The meet-up will be suitable also for beginners.

We will need “mFilter” package to install.

This meetup is hosted by Nino Melitauri and it will be held in Georgian.

title: [Special Case Series] Digital Humanities in R
description:
[Agenda]

• 19:15-19:30 RBasic by RLadies

• 19:30-20:30 主議程: Digital Humanities in R by Pecu

• 20:30-20:50 閃電秀1 : PHP 也有Day by Shengyou

• 20:50-21:10 閃電秀2 : 如何快速尋出有問題的入侵記錄 by 黃建笙

• 21:10 - 自由交流時間

[Talk Information]

• RBasic

RLadies RBasic 小組的 RBasic 系列

• Digital Humanities in R

甚麼是數位人文？我在德國的做的研究是甚麼？如何使用 R 於數位人文的領域上

• 媽，我交了個大象朋友

在這一場分享裡，聖佑試著回顧當初接觸 PHP 程式語言的過程，並透過擬人化的方式將 PHP 的吉祥物「大象」比擬成自己在小時候交的一位朋友。以介紹朋友的方式，期望能在 15 分鐘超短的時間內，讓完全不認識 PHP 這個程式語言的朋友能對它有初步的認識，並能試著開始撰寫自己的第一個 PHP 網頁

• 如何快速尋出有問題的入侵記錄
網站攻防已然是目前資訊安全領域的顯學，但對於一個服務提供者而言，最重要的是忠實的呈現客戶發生了什麼事情，因此在LOG的分析上是一個相當重要的工作，透過各種不同的方法快速的顯示出有問題的記錄，免除了過多的人為主觀，透過分析的過程找出切入點，及真的的根本原因才是最終的目標

[Speaker Information]

• 蔡芸琤(Pecu)
目前在大學擔任菜鳥老師，負責 CS+X 推廣與教學工作，兩年前有機會到德國某研究中心工作，接觸到了數位人文的研究議題，深深喜歡上文理一家融合的思考方式，大大推翻台灣在高中就將文理組分家的教育方式，因此，想在台灣進行跨領域教育推廣工作，希望能聚集喜歡實踐想法的人們，一起改變世界

• 范聖佑 (Shengyou Fan)

現職為得寬科技研究員、Laravel 傳教士。2013 年在 Facebook 上成立 Laravel 台灣 社團及成立 Laravel 道場 教學站，並與多間學校、企業單位合作舉辦教育訓練工作坊，從此踏上 Laravel 傳教與導入之路。除此之外也在 Github 上發佈數項與 Laravel 開發相關的懶人包與外掛，每個月固定舉辦三場 PHP/Laravel 活動，以實現簡潔優雅開發為夢想。持續關注創新應用、網路技術、印刷出版及甜點烘焙等領域。目前抱著甜點書持續 Full Stack 的旅程！

• 黃建笙

登豐數位科技技術總監，專長為windows安全、web安全及資訊安全事件鑑識，具有CISSP-ISSMP, CEH, CHFI, ECSA, ISO27001LA,BS10012LA等資訊安全相關認證，我就是因為懶所以懂得如何讓工作自動化，也因為懶所以常用各種新的方法來讓工作更有效率，在入侵事件中最重要的一環是log分析，透過各種不同的方法快速的找出有問題的記錄，減少目前的工作負載，讓更多的時間可以用在維護世界和平上。

[Host information]

• Rachael

title: Presentación de R-Ladies y Aplicaciones de R en Santa Rosa
description:
El ITES nos invitó a dar una charla para los estudiantes de la Tecnicatura Superior en Desarrollo de Software y al público en general este jueves 22 de junio a partir de las 21:30 hs.

Las disertantes son la Magister en Explotación de Datos y Gestión de Conocimiento, Investigadora del INTA, Yanina Bellini Saibene y la Estudiante de Doctorado en Ciencias Agrarias de la UBA Marina Cook ambas organizadoras de RLadies Santa Rosa. En primer lugar se expondrá sobre Agro Minería de Datos: en un mundo que necesita cada vez mas alimentos, producir más y mejor, cuidando la salud y el medio ambiente, es uno de los desafíos del sector agropecuario. La minería de datos es una de las herramientas que puede ayudar en este objetivo al permitir analizar y modelar los sistemas productivos. Se informará sobre el uso de Data Mining en INTA y como R les ayuda en esa tarea.

En la segunda parte se referirán a Modelos Mixtos: los avances en informática permitieron desarrollar modelos más complejos y realistas para el análisis de datos. Nos mostrarán qué modelos usan y por qué; por qué usar R y que ventajas ofrece.

Finalmente se hablará sobre RLadies: presentaremos el capitulo Santa Rosa de esta organización mundial que busca disminuir la brecha de género en las personas que usan R.

Los espermos!!!

title: RStudio::conf screening & discussion!
description:
We're gonna get the projector going and watch some talks from this year's RStudio::conf! In between talks, we'll have a chance to discuss our experience with the methods mentioned, and even better, folks will be able to ask each other questions if they are confused or want to know more!

Link to conference site: https://www.rstudio.com/conference/

I personally want to see these:

Putting square pegs in round holes: Using list-cols in your dataframe – Jenny Bryan (https://www.rstudio.com/resources/videos/using-list-cols-in-your-dataframe/)

Text Mining the tidy Way – Julia Silge (https://www.rstudio.com/resources/videos/text-mining-the-tidy-way/)

Writing Readable Code with Pipes – Bob Rudis (https://www.rstudio.com/resources/videos/writing-readable-code-with-pipes/)

But others are invited to suggest some too! And we don't have to watch those three either! (Keep in mind that not all the talks are the same length, and the plan for this event is to just watch a few that are under half an hour.)

title: Co-work drop in session at the London Public Library!
description:
We have been striving to find a way to not only host official events, but also schedule casual co-work drop-in times. We have partnered with the London Public Library to provide regular evening workspace. Come with your work (it can be R-specific or not!) and settle in to plow through a couple hours of focused work time in the company of other R-Ladies. This is our first co-working session and will be the last for the summer, but we are looking to hold more in the fall. While we won't provide specific tutoring sessions at this point, if you do have questions this setting will also provide opportunity to ask others and brainstorm as a group.

Hope to see you there!

title: shine(x)
description:
Menetrend:

18:00 -- 19:00 Adattranszformációs bevezető a tidyverse világba, 2. rész

19:00 -- 19:15 Szünet (gyors pizzázás, hogy bírjuk szusszal a végéig)

19:15 -- 20:15 Interaktív vizualizációk készítése shiny-val

20:15-től kötetlen program, jól megérdemelt pihenés

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Adattranszformációs bevezető a tydiverse világba, 2. rész

A legutóbbi alkalommal megtanultuk a legfontosabb trükköket, hogyan lehet jobbra-balra-össze-vissza transzformálni a data frame-eket.

Nyárindítóként most megnézzük, hogyan lehet kombinálni több adatsort, például megtanuljuk

• mi az a join művelet és milyen típusai vannak

• milyen halmazműveletek értelmezettek a táblázatos adatsorokon

• hogyan tranformálunk hosszúból széles szerkezetbe?

Ajánlott előismeret: nincs.

Telepítési előkészület: a tidyverse csomaghalmaz és a maps csomag.

Figyelem: a tidyverse több, egymással kompatibilis csomag összefoglaló neve. A komplett környezet egy kattintással telepíthető a megszokott módon, mintha csak egy tetszőleges package lenne. Mindenesetre ha a szokásosnál kicsit több szöveget láttok a konzolban ne ijedjetek meg, sok mindent telepítetek a háttérben. :)

Két adatsorral dolgozunk majd:

• az egyik a már ismerős PISA adatsorunk : https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_budapest/master/Meetup_2017_04_19/pisa_hun_small.csv

• a másik egy, a többi ország hallgatóit is tartalmazó adatsor: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_budapest/master/Meetup_2017_06_21/pisa_small.csv

A kiinduló szkript vázát itt találjátok: https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_budapest/blob/master/Meetup_2017_06_21/dplyr_part2_exercises.R.

Kérünk Benneteket, telepítsétek a környezetet és letöltött adatsorral és szkript vázlattal érkezzetek.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Interaktív vizualizációk készítése shiny-val

A shiny R csomag lehetővé teszi egyszerűen interaktív weboldalak készítését kizárólag R-ben, bármi html vagy javascript tudás nélkül. Egy interaktív alkalmazás rengeteget segíthet egy adatelemzési folyamat során neked, az elemzőnek is, de kiválóan alkalmas az eredmények kommunikálására nem technikai emberek felé is. Az alkalom során egy reális példán végigmenve tekntjük át a legfontosabb építőelemeket, fogalmakat.

Ajánlott előismeret: nincs.

Telepítési előkészület: a shiny csomag.

Az adatsor amivel dolgozunk majd: https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_budapest/blob/master/Meetup_2017_06_21/births_by_mother_age_and_education_raw.csv.zip

A kiinduló szkript vázát itt találjátok: https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_budapest/tree/master/Meetup_2017_06_21/eu_births_shiny_app

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Természetesen minden segédanyagot megtaláltok majd utólag a weben, mégis nagyon jó lenne, ha minél többen hoznátok notebookokat, hogy ott helyben ki is tudjátok próbálni a kódrészleteket.

Hogyan készüljetek a meetupra?

Három dologra lesz szükségetek a gépeteken:

• Magára az R interpreterre ( http://cran.rapporter.net/ )

• Egy okos-ügyes fejlesztőkörnyezetre, ami segíti a hatékony munkát, ez a mi esetünkben az RStudio lesz ( https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/ )

• Azokra a speciális csomagokra, amit az adott alkalmon részletesebben megismerünk: a júniusi meetup esetén ez a tydiverse és a shiny lesz.

A részletes telepítési lépéseket Windows operációs rendszer fölött itt találjátok (https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_budapest/blob/9dc7f8e35f0467e31a814be5fc1ec033bf593630/Meetup_2017_03_23/03_23_install_guide.pdf). Ebben a data.table telepítését mutatjuk be, de a többi csomagé ugyanúgy működik.

Ha bármi gond adódna a telepítéssel/letöltéssel, kezdés előtt még nyugodtan kérdezzetek.

title: Extracting information from Facebook
description:
ლევან ბჟალავა ისაუბრებს თუ როგორ გადმოვწეროთ ინფორმაცია ფეისბუქის საჯარო გვერდებიდან, განვსაზღვროთ გვერდის ყველაზე პოპულარული პოსტი (მოწონებები, კომენტარები, გაზიარებები), შევამოწმოთ ვინ მოიწონა ეს პოსტი და განვსაზღვროთ ტრენდი-რომელ პოსტებს აქვს უკეთესი შედეგი. ჩვენ ასევე ვისაუბრებთ როგორ მოვძებნოთ ფეისბუქის ჯგუფები და როგორ გადმოვწეროთ ჯგუფიდან პოსტების მონაცემები.
=======================
Levan Bzhalava will talk about how to extract information from Facebook public pages, identify the most popular post of the page (likes, comments, shares), check who liked the post, and implement trend analysis - which posts are doing well. He will show how to search Facebook group page and extract group page post data.

title: #3 Hands-on Journocode meets R and R markdown
description:
Dear R-Ladies Berlin members,

we are happy to announce our 3rd Meet-up on Tuesday, 20th June. Babbel, the famous language app, supports us another time providing snacks, drinks and a great location.

Join us for an exciting session where Journocode-founder Marie-Louise Timcke introduces us to data journalism and journocode itself.

A tutorial about R markdown and the integration of journocode is going to complement our session prepared by Marie-Louise and R-Lady Chrissy.

We'll keep you updated here and looking forward to meet up with you soon.

R-Ladies Berlin organizer

Hanna, Noa & Chrissy

title: Intro to Machine Learning with Data Scientist Barbara Fusinska!
description:
https://github.com/BasiaFusinska/RMachineLearning

We've got the fantastic Barbara Fusinska of Microsoft tech fame presenting an Intro to Machine Learning with R!! Kindly hosted by Oracle Cloud as venue sponsor at their swanky new Moorgate office, part of their generous support of grassroot & diverse tech communities!!

We have capacity for 50 people, so you will need to register on the Eventbrite page (https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/intro-to-machine-learning-with-data-scientist-barbara-fusinska-tickets-35332163452) to attend - MEETUP RSVP WILL NOT GET YOU PAST SECURITY!!!!

https://secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/b/d/f/7/600_461748631.jpeg

Doors Open/Congregate in the foyer from 6pm, Talk starts at 6:30

Laptops optional: you can follow the talk on your laptop, or just watch - https://github.com/BasiaFusinska/RMachineLearning

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Machine Learning with R

Data Science and especially Machine Learning are the topics that recently have gained in popularity. R is a programming language dedicated to working with data. The platform offers numerous libraries and implementations of machine learning algorithms, which makes it a perfect (and free!) tool for exploratory data analysis, presenting the results of inquiries and data science in general.

In this 50min talk, Barbara will cover:

• An introduction to machine learning and R capabilities in the field of Data Science & R language basics

• Specific data applications built around common problems of supervised and unsupervised learning

• How to prepare data, perform learning computations, & present the results.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Code of Conduct: as always, we expect all attendees to abide by and be accountable to our community CoC (see About Us)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

title: არჩევნების შედეგების პროგნოზირება/ Predicting Election Outcomes
description:
წინამდებარე შეხვედრის მიმდინარეობისას, ჩვენ ყურადღებას დავუთმობთ სხვადასხვა მეთოდებით საქართველოს 2012 და 2016 წლის საპარლამენტო არჩევნების შედეგების პროგნოზირებას. განვიხილავთ როგორც დეტერმინისტულ (ე.წ. გამოკითხვათა საშუალოების, მოძრავი საშუალოს და შეწონილი საშუალოს), ასევე ისეთ მიდგომებს, რომლებიც საშუალებას იძლევა, შევაფასოთ გაურკვევლობა (მაგ. ინტეგრირებული ავტორეგრესიული მოძრავი საშუალოს და დინამიურ ბაიესურ მოდელებს).
სამუშაოდ იქონიეთ შემდეგი ბიბლიოთეკები: curl, dplyr, DT, ggplot2, ggrepel, knitr, lubridate, mapproj, maps, mvtnorm, purrr, reshape2, rmarkdown, rstan, shinystan, stringr, tidyr, zoo, forecast. მონაცემები და რეპლიკაციის სკრიპტი განთავსდება შეხვედრის შესაბამის github-გვერდზე: https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_tbilisi/tree/master/2017_06_05_election_polling
=============================
During this meeting, we will focus on predicting election results for 2012 and 2016 parliamentary elections. We will go through both deterministic (polling average, weighted and moving average) and those methods which take into consideration uncertainty (e.g. autoregressive integrated models and dynamic Bayesian models).
Please install following libraries on your machine: curl, dplyr, DT, ggplot2, ggrepel, knitr, lubridate, mapproj, maps, mvtnorm, purrr, reshape2, rmarkdown, rstan, shinystan, stringr, tidyr, zoo, forecast. Data and replication scripts will be uploaded to the corresponding Github page: During this meeting, we will focus on predicting election results for 2012 and 2016 parliamentary elections. We will go through both deterministic (polling average, weighted and moving average) and those methods which take into consideration uncertainty (e.g. autoregressive integrated models and dynamic Bayesian models).
Please install following libraries on your machine: curl, dplyr, DT, ggplot2, ggrepel, knitr, lubridate, mapproj, maps, mvtnorm, purrr, reshape2, rmarkdown, rstan, shinystan, stringr, tidyr, zoo, forecast. Data and replication scripts will be uploaded to the corresponding Github page: https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_tbilisi/tree/master/2017_06_05_election_polling

title: Sports Analytics with R and Community Engagement through Choose Maths
description:
https://secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/3/2/d/8/600_461413016.jpeg

Hi Everyone,

R-Ladies Melbourne is now announcing its June event! In this months event we will be hosting two fantastic speakers.

The main presentation of the evening will be given by Stephanie Kovalchik.

Title: Sports Analytics with R

Abstract: What to know what it is like to be a sports statistician? In this talk I will provide a crash course of some common tools in R for conducting data science for sports. Typical activities of sports analysis include web scraping, data wrangling, machine learning, data visualisation, and blogging. I will show tools in R that can be used to tackle each of these steps and provide examples of their application with real-world sports examples.

We will also hear from Lyndal Henden, who will tell us about the importance of engaging with young girls about continuing STEM courses though high school and beyond.

Hope to see you all there!

R-Ladies Melbourne

title: Data Science Club for Minority Genders: Job Hunting Help!
description:
UPDATE: Directions to the Structures Lab (G04), Chadwick Building

The Chadwick building is the first building on the right as soon as you come into the main entrance into the quad on Gower street. Once inside, just go straight ahead to the end of the short corridor, through the glass double doors, down a few steps to get to G04.

The map: http://www.ucl.ac.uk/maps/chadwick-building

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

For minority gender folk actively looking to move to/explore Data Science careers, we are running a practical session specifically to share recent job applying experiences, review each others' CV, do relevant interview & technical test preparation, develop strategies for kinds of job vacancies to target, as well as discuss SALARY EXPECTATIONS!!!! (P.S if you're not a grad, then £50k is a viable minimum)

We will leverage the organiser's multiple years of technical hiring experience in industry & track record successfully getting candidates into target jobs, in order to boost your chances :)

Requirements: if you're looking to update your CV, your LinkedIn profile or have other material to review (e.g. a job spec, data exercise), please bring your laptop!!

Some snacks & drinks will be provided, but feel free to bring your own food along!

P.S this is a language agnostic event!! So whether you're an R-Lady, PyLady, SQL-Lady, or any other Lady please do join us :)

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

Code of Conduct: we expect all attendees to abide & be governed by our community CoC (see About Us).

title: Make and host your own blog using R and GitHub
description:
One of the awesome R-Ladies London organizers, Claudia (https://twitter.com/clavitolo), gave a presentation (https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_london/blob/master/2017-04-26_Make_your_own_blog/Make_your_own_blog.pdf) last month on how to create & host a Blogdown website using R and GitHub. We are going to re-create Claudia's workshop in the Bay Area at our next meetup! Here is the meetup description from the R-Ladies London Blogdown meetup (https://www.meetup.com/rladies-london/events/239404233/) event.

Have you ever thought of writing a blog? Maybe to tell the world about your R projects?

Come to our session and bring your laptop, we will explore together some options and you will go back home with a new blog that integrates nicely with R/Rstudio and it's hosted live on Github.

We will look at pros and cons of WordPress, Rmarkdown + HUGO and markdown + Jekyll. To experiment with all of them, please create a GitHub account and install the following software on your machine BEFORE the session:

- R (https://www.r-project.org/)
- RStudio (https://www.rstudio.com/)
- git (https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/Getting-Started-Installing-Git)
- jekyll (https://jekyllrb.com/) (optional, here some instructions (https://scotch.io/tutorials/getting-started-with-jekyll-plus-a-free-bootstrap-3-starter-theme))

title: Personal Website Workshop: R Blogdown + Github
description:
Join us for a tutorial on R Blogdown and Github! If you've ever wanted to start your own personal website or blog, come learn how to do it (for free!) using R and Github.

We'll go over:
- How to set up a free Github account
- Git and Github basics
- The R blogdown package
- Creating and maintaining a personal blog/website with Blogdown, Hugo and Github

This workshop should hopefully be accessible to RLadies of all levels!

title: String manipulation in R
description:
ამ შეხვედრაზე ჩვენ შევეხებით R-ში ტექსტურ მონაცემებთან მუშაობის ძირითად ასპექტებს. ჩვენ ყურადღებას გავამახვილებთ stringr პაკეტზე, რომელიც გამოიყენება ტექსტის თანამიმდევრულად და ეფექტურად დასამუშავებლად კოდირების გათვალისწინებით.

საჩვენებლად განვიხილავთ babynames პაკეტს, რომელიც მოიცავს ამერიკელი ბავშვების სახელებს 1880 წლიდან 2015 წლამდე. ჩვენ დავადგენთ სახელების ყველაზე პოპულარულ პირველ ასოს და სიდიდეს წლის მიხედვით. დამხმარე პაკეტებად გამოვიყენებთ dplyr-ს მონაცემებთან სამუშაოდ და ggplot2-ს ვიზუალიზაციისთვის.

===========================================

In this session we will go through basics of string manipulation in R. We will concentrate on stringr package, which provides consistent, efficient and encoding-aware tools to work with character strings.

As a demonstration, we will deal with babynames package, which contains US children names from 1880 to 2015. We will find the most popular first letter and length of name for each year. As supportive packages we will rely on dplyr for data manipulation and on ggplot2 for visualization.

title: [Visualization Series]  新聞視覺化
description:
[Agenda]

• 19:15-19:30 R Basic

• 19:30-20:30 主議程: 新聞視覺化 @Claire

• 20:30-20:50 閃電秀: ggplot2 @盧森

• 20:50-21:10 閃電秀2: 生醫資料視覺化 ＠亮亮

• 20:50 - 自由交流時間

[Talk Information]

• 新聞視覺化

資料新聞及資料視覺化，一般是將各種數據作為新聞或者論述的作證，以表格、圖表，甚至更多元的互動方式，來達到讓讀者更快速、更深入理解議題的效果。這次會介紹國內外精彩的資料新聞案例，也簡單分享我製作中的一些思考。

• ggplot2 - 如果你願意一層一層一層～的堆疊我的圖

小時候的美術課，老師總說畫圖要能做出「拼貼」的美感才是好圖。本議題將淺談ggplot2 使用圖層層層堆疊出美術老師拼貼的奧義（雖然結果可能看不出有拼貼過。）

• 生醫資料視覺化

[Speaker Information]

• Claire
目前在電信業擔任商業智慧分析師，之前在 MIT Media Lab 做專案時，接觸並迷上了視覺化，喜歡嘗試各種的方法將資訊化繁為簡。創辦社群知了新聞 Cicadata，大概每兩個月會舉辦一次技術分享的聚會，希望能聚集喜歡資料新聞／視覺化的人們，一起探索其中的可能。

• 盧森
自詡為有志青年，初入社會不久，仍有許多要學習的地方。 R寫了近四年，還是很喜歡透過交流，在各個不同領域的運用中得到許多新知。簡單來說，我是來交朋友的啦～

• 亮亮

[Host information]

• Kristen

title: R Beginners - Orientation
description:
Hi all, We're kicking off our beginners' group with an orientation session. This session is meant to go over the very basics of R as well as to highlight our plans for the next few sessions. Please come with R, and RStudio, already installed on your machine (links at the end). We're limiting the number of attendees to ensure that we can accomplish all of our goals in the time that we have and will be happy to schedule another session if there is demand.

Information on the location will follow shortly. Excited to meet and work with you all! R can be downloaded from (https://www.r-project.org/); follow the links under "Download" to select the correct version. RStudio can be downloaded from (https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/)

title: 2D and 3D Graphics in R!
description:
Olivia Daub will be presenting some fun tricks you'll need to know in order to make awesome 3D graphics in R! The session will begin with an review/overview of more basic plots in ggplot, then get into more advanced plots.

What do I need to bring?

• Ensure you have an updated version of XQuartz (https://www.xquartz.org/) downloaded (you'll need this for the R packages used to generate the 3D plots)

• Install the following R packages by running this code in your R console:

• install.packages(c("car","psych","scatterplot3d","Rcmdr","rgl","gvlma"))

As usual, we'll make our way to a nearby pub for some beer and food after the session.

See you then!

description:
Join us for a GitHub journey, guided by Lucy D'Agostino McGowan! We’ll answer questions like:

• What is so great about GitHub?

• How can I make it work for me and my workflow?

• How can I show the world some of the cool things I’m working on?

This will be a hands-on workshop that will give you all the tools to have a delightful time incorporating version control & R (and blogdown (https://github.com/rstudio/blogdown) if you are so inclined). All levels are welcome!

Stay 15 minutes after for a tour of the Wond’ry (https://www.vanderbilt.edu/thewondry/), part of Vanderbilt's new engineering facility! Parking is available in the 25th Avenue garage directly across Highland Avenue; see the Wond'ry page for more information. The building is also a <10-minute walk from both the 2525 West End and VUMC areas.

title: Taller de R para Ciencia de Datos. Parte I
description:
L@s invitamos a la segunda reunión de R-Ladies Buenos Aires. En esta reunión haremos "Taller de R para Ciencia de Datos - Parte I", fuertemente inspirado en fragmentos del libro "R for Data Science" (http://r4ds.had.co.nz/) (Grolemund & Wickham, 2016).

En el Taller daremos los primeros pasos en Ciencia de Datos usando paquetes del tidyverse y haremos focos en la visualización inicial de nuestros datos.

Es muy importante que traigan sus laptops con R y RStudio instalados (para más info de cómo hacer esto: https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B0X9hdtcUykTdy1ZaVM3S3hxQ0k ).

También es muy importante que traigan las siguientes instalaciones de paquetes hechas:

install.packages("tidyverse")
install.packages(c("nycflights13", "gapminder", "Lahman"))

Cualquier consulta que tengan con lo anterior, la vemos por acá, por el Slack (las que aún no tienen acceso al Slack, pueden enviarnos un mail a buenosaires@rladies.org), o unos minutos antes de las 15:30 hs el sábado.

Cerraremos el meetup con broche de oro: Priscilla Minotti de la Universidad de San Martín nos contará de qué se trata su taller "Estructuras de Datos Geográficos y Espaciales en R y Paquetes para Analizarlos".

Queremos agradecerle a EANT (http://eant.tech/home)por recibirnos en sus aulas. EANT (http://eant.tech/home) es una organización de escuelas especializadas en técnicas y tecnología digital reunidas para formar, entrenar y sinergizar a una nueva generación de desarrolladores digitales especialmente preparada para llevar la fuerza de la innovación a todos los ámbitos de la sociedad.

Por favor, contesten el RSVP así calculamos bien los comestibles/bebestibles!

Nos vemos pronto, arrancamos puntual!

title: Mayıs Etkinliği-Sezon Finali: Veri Analizi Sohbetleri 2 / Data Talks 2
description:
Herkese merhaba!

Mayıs ayı ile birlikte 2 aylık bir ara verip, sizlere süper bir yeni sezon programıyla dönmeyi planlıyoruz.

Sezon finali etkinliğinde sizler için veri analizi konusunda farklı ilgi alanlarından kişilerle bir buluşma ayarlıyoruz!

1- Boğaziçi Üniversitesi Bilgisayar Mühendisliği'nden Prof.Dr.Pınar Yolum "Sosyal Medya ve Mahremiyet"

2- Haberler.com CEO'su Dr.Sümeyra Teymur Gören "Sitenizdeki Gizli Kamera: Google Analytics "

3- Invent Analytics'ten Veri Bilimci İzgi Başak Nalbant "Perakende Sektöründe Büyük Veri Analizi ve Kullanım Alanları"

5- Datawise'dan Managing Director Mutlu Doğruak "Medya ve Pazarlama Verileri ile Neler Yapıyoruz? "

Çok aydınlatıcı olacağını düşündüğümüz bu etkinliğe merak ettiğiniz tüm sorularınız ile birlikte gelebilirsiniz :)

title: Researchers & Students Community: Introduction to Next Generation Sequencing
description:
UPDATE: Directions to the Structure Lab (G04), Chadwick Building

The Chadwick building is the first building on the right as soon as you come into the main entrance into the quad on Gower street. Once inside, just go straight ahead to the end of the short corridor, through the glass double doors, down a few steps to get to G04.

The map: http://www.ucl.ac.uk/maps/chadwick-building

See you there! :)

---------------------------------------------------------

The wonderful Louise Usher will be kicking off our series of R-Ladies Researchers and Students Community talks, with her research on next-generation sequencing!

Louise is completing her PhD in Molecular Biotechnology at the University of Westminster. Her PhD project involves developing a Next Generation Sequencing assay for confirming the activity of a novel class of RNA drugs. She will be presenting on how sequencing works and how next-generation sequencing can be used to measure biological patterns.

We welcome everybody to this meet up. BUT, gender minorities will be given priority to attend, so please wait your turn! Thanks for your co-operation :)

There will be plenty of food, snacks and drink to keep us merry and mirthful.

venues.address: Chadwick Building, UCL, Gower Street, WC1E 6BT

title: R-Ladies Adelaide: May Event
description:
We are incredibly excited to now be able to host a May meetup! Come and spend an evening with R-Ladies of Adelaide at Microsoft Innovation Center on 25th of May.

We have two topics to present to you this time, led by two awesome women. If you're confused by all the industry/academia buzz around Data Science & R and just want some clarity, this event is for you! R-Ladies Adelaide will give you networking opportunities and provide you examples of career experiences involving R use.

Two topics in this session:

1) Helen Dockrell "Using R in the Development of Gut Simulations"

Helen is a PhD candidate at Centre for Neuroscience Flinders University working on software to simulate gut tissue. Her background is in Biochemistry and Genetics: after working in labs as a researcher she decided to learn to code in C++ at a university short course. She has taught herself R and a number of other languages since then, which she uses to bring complex laboratory data sets together.

2) TBA

Timings: doors open 5 pm, talk starts 5.15 pm

Format: talk only, no laptops needed

P.S: Please RSVP if you plan on attending so we have an idea of how many to expect.

See you all soon! Feel free to post on the discussion board if you have any questions or email to adelaide[at]rladies.org.

title: Data visualisation and scraping data from the web
description: Brian Kuns will introduce data visualisation and scraping techniques: 1) Rvest – scraping (html) data, 2) Dplyr and Lubridate – tidying and rearranging data, 3) ggplot2 – plotting data

title: Women in statistics and mathematics: repairing the leaky pipeline
description:
Dear R-Ladies of Melbourne,

Join us on this event for developing a better understanding of the diminishing number of girls and young women in the fields of STEM disciplines - Science, technology, engineering and mathematics.

Its main organiser is the Statistical Society of Australia. Please RSVP here (https://www.meetup.com/Statistical-Society-of-Australia-Victorian-Branch/events/239837040/?eventId=239837040&chapter_analytics_code=UA-50114709-1).

Looking forward to seeing you!

R-Ladies Melbourne

title: Looping through data
description:
Looping is automating a multi-step process by organizing sequences of actions or ‘batch’ processes and by grouping the parts that need to be repeated.

During this meetup Brian Kuns will cover looping (base-R) and "data-wrangling" using dplyr and tidyr. If there's time, we will make a graph or two using ggplot2. The data we will be using is farm yield data at a country level from FAOSTAT. We will go through the procedure of downloading CSV data, looking at this raw data to see how it should be "wrangled" or cleaned (which columns are unnecessary? do the columns need to be transposed? etc...).

title: Twitter Workshop
description:
Dear R-Ladies of Melbourne,

We have a fun and informative workshop ahead this month. The workshop will be presented by Saskia Freytag and Anna Quaglieri.

In the first of part of the workshop, you will learn how to create a Twitter API and scrape tweets from the internet. In the second part, everyone will get their hands dirty with a fun-centred analysis of tweets relating to #RuPaulsDragRace. The focus will be the creation of quick informative graphs, as well as gaining an understanding of twitteR data structures. At the end, everyone will be encouraged to create their own graphical analysis - with the best graph being awarded a small prize.

What to do/bring with you:

DO NOT forget to bring your laptop if you would like to take part in the competition.

Please also make sure to install the following packages from CRAN prior to the workshop:

# twitter setup

install.packages(c("twitteR", "ROAuth","RCurl", "RJSONIO", "RSentiment"))

install.packages(c("tm", "wordcloud", "tidyr", "dplyr", "ggplot2", "purrr", "rvest", "stringr"))

Workshop materials will be posted on our GitHub closer to the date.

Start Your Engines! and May the Best Woman Win!

Speakers' Biographies

Saskia Freytag completed her Masters in Statistical Science at University College London. After finishing she moved back to Germany, where she completed a PhD in Biostatistics in 2014. She then got the opportunity to relocate to Melbourne to work as a Post-Doctoral Fellow at the Walter and Eliza Hall Institute. Her research focus is methodological development for the analysis of high-throughput sequencing data. She is the co-founder of R-Ladies.

Anna Quaglieri completed her Master Degree in Statistics between the Universities of Bologna, Glasgow and Melbourne. After finishing uni she became involved in the Bioinformatics Division at the Walter and Eliza Hall Institute and now she doing her PhD with Professor Terry Speed. She is the co-founder of the R-Ladies in Melbourne and hopefully, in the early future, she will be able to push for the birth of an R-Ladies in Bologna!

We are looking forward to having you there!

Don't forget to RSVP!

title: Open-theme meetup
description: This is an open-theme meetup. There will be members joining this meetup that can explain data management (data arranging, reshaping, cleaning, indexing, etc), R markdown, regression models as well as what constitutes a function and a package, for example. Join this meetup to ask questions, share experiences or discuss your project.

title: Advanced R study group: Chapter 2
description:
We'll review Chapter 2 of Hadley Wickham's Advanced R on subsetting.

http://adv-r.had.co.nz/Subsetting.html

Bring questions, problems, solutions, concern and code!

title: Primeiro Meetup R-Ladies Rio
description:
Nosso objetivo é promover a linguagem R, compartilhar conhecimentos, especialmente na comunidade feminina. Toda e qualquer pessoa com interesse na linguagem R é convidada a participar. Não importa se você nunca usou R antes ou se você é especialista em R.

Teremos conosco a fundadora do R-Ladies, a Gabriela de Queiroz!

Título:

"Data Science, R e R-Ladies: um pouco da minha experiência no Vale do Silício"

Gabriela de Queiroz é Lead Data Scientist na SelfScore onde cria e mantém modelos Estatísticos e de Machine Learning usados em otimização, fraude e risco. Já trabalhou em algumas startups no Vale do Silício e nas suas horas vagas é mentora em Data Science. Ela é fundadora do grupo R-Ladies com mais de 30 capítulos ao redor do mundo.Mestre em Estatística pela CSUEB e Epidemiologia pela Fiocruz.

AVISO: Nosso meetup está chegando!
Para quem for levar convidada ou convidado, por favor informe nome por inbox. Falaremos sobre R, Big Data e Data Science, suas aplicações e a carreira.

As inscrições fecham 17/05.

Maiores detalhes do código de conduta para o grupo em:

https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki... (https://github.com/rladies/starter-kit/wiki/Code-of-Conduct)

title: mutate(x)
description:
Menetrend:

18:00 -- 19:00 Adattranszformációs bevezető a tidyverse világba (kezdőknek)

19:00 -- 19:15 Szünet (gyors pizzázás, hogy bírjuk szusszal a végéig)

19:15 -- 20:15 Szűr, szabdal, olvaszt, átalakul: a data.table csomag (haladóknak)

20:15-től kötetlen program, jól megérdemelt pihenés

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Adattranszformációs bevezető a tidyverse világba (kezdőknek)

A legutóbbi alkalommal remek ggplot2 ábrákat készítettünk, de még csak a PISA adatsor eredeti változóiból rajzoltunk. De mi történik akkor, ha némileg módosított értékekkel szeretnénk dolgozni?

A májusi alkalmunkon szintet lépünk és kipróbáljuk az alapvető adattranszformációs műveleteket, például megtanuljuk

• mit hívunk széles és hosszú adatszerkezetnek,

• hogyan transzformáljuk egyiket a másikba,

• mi is az az ún. pipe (%>%) operátor és miért szeretik annyira a fejlesztők,

• miért olyan hasznos, hogy a tidyverse csomagok adattípusai (többé-kevésbé) kompatibilisek egymással

Ajánlott előismeret: nincs.

Telepítési előkészület: a tidyverse csomaghalmaz.

Figyelem: a tidyverse több, egymással kompatibilis csomag összefoglaló neve. A komplett környezet egy kattintással telepíthető a megszokott módon, mintha csak egy tetszőleges package lenne. Mindenesetre ha a szokásosnál kicsit több szöveget láttok a konzolban ne ijedjetek meg, sok mindent telepítetek a háttérben. :)

Továbbra is a PISA adatsorral dolgozunk: : https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_budapest/master/Meetup_2017_04_19/pisa_hun_small.csv ,

a kiinduló szkript vázát itt találjátok: https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_budapest/blob/master/Meetup_2017_05_17/exercise.R .

Kérünk Benneteket, telepítsétek a környezetet és letöltött adatsorral és szkript vázlattal érkezzetek.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Szűr, szabdal, olvaszt, átalakul: a data.table csomag 3. rész (haladóknak)

A data.table mini-kuzus záróakkordjaként a következő témákat fogjuk érinteni:

• Set key, azaz kulcsok beállítása, amitől bizonyos műveletek még hatékonyabbak lesznek

• Rolling join

• Reshaping: melt és dcast

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Természetesen minden segédanyagot megtaláltok majd utólag a weben, mégis nagyon jó lenne, ha minél többen hoznátok notebookokat, hogy ott helyben ki is tudjátok próbálni a kódrészleteket.

Hogyan készüljetek a meetupra?

Három dologra lesz szükségetek a gépeteken:

• Magára az R interpreterre ( http://cran.rapporter.net/ )

• Egy okos-ügyes fejlesztőkörnyezetre, ami segíti a hatékony munkát, ez a mi esetünkben az RStudio lesz ( https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/ )

• Azokra a speciális csomagokra, amit az adott alkalmon részletesebben megismerünk: az április meetup esetén ez a ggplot2 és a data.table lesz.

A részletes telepítési lépéseket Windows operációs rendszer fölött itt találjátok (https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_budapest/blob/9dc7f8e35f0467e31a814be5fc1ec033bf593630/Meetup_2017_03_23/03_23_install_guide.pdf). Ebben a data.table telepítését mutatjuk be, de a tidyverse csomagé ugyanúgy működik.

Ha bármi gond adódna a telepítéssel/letöltéssel, kezdés előtt még nyugodtan kérdezzetek.

title: Regression models in R
description: Basic introduction to linear and logistic regression models using R and Caucasus Barometer data. Do join even if you have missed some meetups or you are a beginner (in R or regressions).

title: R-Ladies + AdaLab + OSWeekends

title: #2 Hands-on Data Manipulation with dplyr & Intro to DRY Functional Programming
description:
Welcome!

R-Ladies Berlin would like to welcome you to our second R-Ladies Berlin session, kindly hosted by Babbel, the famous language learning app.

The #2 R-Ladies Berlin tutorial is focussing on data manipulation with dplyr. But before we start coding, Noa will introduce the DRY principle and discuss why and how you can start applying it with R.

Please bring your laptop to actively participate in the hands-on tutorial. Additional material and further instructions will be sent around prior the meet-up.

IMPORTANT: Starting time: 6:30 pm. We'll start with mingling and enjoying drinks and snacks generously provided by Babbel. The actual program starts at 7:15 pm and ends around 10 pm, after another round of mingling.

We are looking forward to meeting you again!

If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to e-mail us: berlin@rladies.org

Best,
Christin, Hanna, Ulrike & NoaR-Ladies Berlin Organisers

title: Easy data cleaning and manipulation with tidyverse
description:
We will be talking about tidyr & dplyr packages, and show how these packages make data cleaning much less painful & provide easy to use functions for the first steps of data exploration. After a short presentation about "tidy data" and tidyr & dplyr, we will do practical examples and go over the vignettes provided by Hadley Wickham (the creator of the tidyverse).

Bring your laptop, extension cord (if you have battery issues), and your enthusiasm! Although tidyverse doesn't require much R experience, we expect you to be familiar with R, RStudio, loading data & packages into R and basic understanding of base R class types.

tidyr examples require certain data files so:

- Please download them via dropbox from here (https://www.dropbox.com/sh/nkhrhcgx6ogg24j/AACKLaJq5_8VDQHmlhZfluCOa?dl=0)

- Or if you're familiar with GitHub get it from the tidy repo (https://github.com/tidyverse/tidyr) under vignettes.

Since we plan to have refreshments at this meetup, we kindly ask you to RSVP only if you are sure that you will be coming.

Links to Google maps locations: College of Pharmacy, Parks Hall (https://goo.gl/maps/BXHrWseC3wq), Closest parking (https://goo.gl/maps/vp4jypHympS2)

title: Informal R-Ladies Tbilisi meetup
description:
Did you miss the previous beginners' meetups or have any questions about R? This is your chance to come and ask or to come and help others find answers before we continue with our regular meetups in May.

Let's meet at Biblusi on Chavchavadze str 7.

Please RSVP if you plan to join.

title: Shiny + Databases
description:
How are you storing data that your Shiny App generates? How are you getting data into your Shiny App? Do you suspect that there's a better way, but you're not sure what it is?

We'll go over some basics of setting up databases, connecting to them from R, using shiny to pull and store data, and most importantly, troubleshooting.

title: Project Management and Version Control with Git in RStudio
description:
Hi everyone,

We hope you all had a restful Easter break and ready to catch up again with the R-world!! We weren't able to schedule an event in April due to the Easter break, so there will be two R-Ladies meet-ups in May. Here are the details of the first one.

This talk will be presented by one our dedicated group organisers, Soroor Zadeh, on 4th of May. Soroor is a Research Assistant in the Division of Bioinformatics at the Walter and Eliza Hall Institute of Medical Research. She has a background in Statistics and currently works on gene regulation mechanisms in normal and cancer cells.

Title: Project Management and Version Control with Git in R-Studio

Abstract: As a project evolves and more results are produced, a systematic way of keeping records of the changes to the analysis becomes vital. If you are developing a software or working on scripts in your day-to-day tasks, you would have realised that you need a tool that would allow you to keep track of all the changes you make to the project throughout the development process without requiring you to duplicate files and make copies of them. Such a tool would ideally also allow you to revert any recent changes to the script to the old ones or previous versions. This is called Version Control and Git is one such a tool that provides this facility. I will be introducing basic concepts in Version Control and demonstrate how to use Git in your routine analysis.

The second event will be on 22nd of May so add it to your calendar if you are interested in hands-on Twitter Sentimental Analysis!! Details for this event are coming soon!

We are looking forward to seeing you!

Goknur Giner

On behalf of R-Ladies Melbourne

title: Working with Data in Open Source Research: hosted by The Wikimedia Foundation
description:
We are excited to announce a R-Ladies speaker event hosted at Wikimedia headquarters in San Francisco. Join us to hear from two Data Scientists, Grace Nolan and Chelsy Xie.

Grace Nolan (https://www.linkedin.com/in/grace-nolan-1a72532a/)is a recent computer science graduate of the University of Waikato in Hamilton, New Zealand and a full-time systems developer for Enable Ltd. She will talk about her journey into women in tech & open source research, showing her findings along the way including a survey she conducted on how people got into OSS.

Chelsy Xie (https://www.linkedin.com/in/xixie/) has been a data analyst at The Wikimedia Foundation since 2016. She will talk about her work in the Discovery department (https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Wikimedia_Discovery) at Wikimedia, where she utilizes data to make the wealth of knowledge and content in the Wikimedia projects easily discoverable.

Schedule

6:00-6:15 Networking & Pizza

6:15-6:30 Welcome

6:30-7:10 "My Journey into Women in Tech and Open Source Research" Grace Nolan (https://www.linkedin.com/in/grace-nolan-1a72532a/)

7:10-7:40 "Data Analysis in Discovery" Chelsy Xie (https://www.linkedin.com/in/xixie/) (https://wikimediafoundation.org/wiki/User:CXie_(WMF))

7:40-7:45 Closing

7:45-8:00 Networking

Attending

All attendees NEED a photo ID to enter Wikimedia Foundation. We have a strict limit of attendees- do not RSVP unless you know you can come.

title: Intro to R & Github
description:
Hello again!

We are incredibly excited to now be able to host our meet ups at UnLondon's (http://www.unlondon.ca/) community building downtown, which provides us a more accessible space beyond the walls of the university, as well as access to their awesome community. Our next meet up will be there on May 1st from 3:30 to 5:30 pm.

We have two topics to present to you this time, led by two awesomewomen:

1) Intro to R: Rachael Smyth will be walking us through some basic introductory material in R and best practices of writing your R scripts.

2) Intro to version control with GitHub: Pauline Barmby will then demonstrate the ins and outs of version control using GitHub (https://github.com/), which can be an incredibly useful way of keeping track of changes you make to your scripts (or other documents).

We'll head out for beers somewhere nearby after we've wrapped up (potentially Milo's? TBD!).

Please RSVP if you plan on attending so we have an idea of how many to expect.

See you all soon! Feel free to post on the discussion board if you have any questions!

title: Nisan Etkinliği: Veri Temizliği (Data Cleaning/Cleansing)
description:
Herkese selamlar!

Bu ay sizlere en çok uğraştığımız konu olan "Veri Temizliği"nin, R programlama ile nasıl yapılabildiğini anlatacağız!

İlk konuşmacımız Mehmet Ali Ekmiş, bizlere Regular Expressions (RegEx) kullanımını anlatacak.

İkinci konuşmacımız Mustafa Gökçe Baydoğan "Zaman Serilerinde Veri Temizleme ve Dönüştürme" anlatacak.

Katılımcıların laptop ve şarj aletleri ile gelmeleri, bilgisayarlarında R ve R Studio'nun kurulu olması beklenmektedir. Seanslarımız sırasında uygulamalar yapılacaktır.

NOT: Eğitimlere KADIN katılımcılar haricindekilerin gelmek istedikleri takdirde mail atmalarını ve durumu sormalarını rica ediyoruz. Geleceklerini belirtip sonradan gelemeyecek olan arkadaşlar da RSVP seçeneklerini değiştirirlerse, katılmak isteyenlere yer açılmış olur. Ayrıca sormadan RSVP seçeneğini YES olarak işaretleyen KADINlar haricindeki katılımcıların RSVP’leri iptal edilecektir. Organizasyonun amacı ve yazılan info kısımlarının dikkate alınmadığı hissiyatı oluşmakta ve bu durum hoş karşılanmamaktadır. Etkinlik alanına belirtilen saatten önce gelmemeniz önemle rica olunur. Katılımcı listesinde ismi olmayanlar alana alınmayacaklardır.

title: Make and host your own blog using R and GitHub
description:
Have you ever thought of writing a blog? Maybe to tell the world about your R projects?

Come to our session and bring your laptop, we will explore together some options and you will go back home with a new blog that integrates nicely with R/Rstudio and it's hosted live on Github.

We will look at pros and cons of WordPress, Rmarkdown + HUGO and markdown + Jekyll. To experiment with all of them, please create a GitHub account and install the following software on your machine BEFORE the session:

- R (https://www.r-project.org/)
- RStudio (https://www.rstudio.com/)
- git (https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/Getting-Started-Installing-Git)
- jekyll (https://jekyllrb.com/) (optional, here some instructions (https://scotch.io/tutorials/getting-started-with-jekyll-plus-a-free-bootstrap-3-starter-theme))

Looking forward to seeing you on Wednesday!
Claudia

title: Web scraping with R
description: Mihai Todor, Senior Software Engineer at Nitro, Inc., will give us a talk on web crawling with R. It will be a hands-on workshop, you will have a chance to crawl a website and look at the extracted data, so please bring your laptop.

title: Shiny with Wendy Chen
description:
Wendy Chen is a Manager on the Advanced Analytics and Data Science team at DigitasLBI, responsible for delivering effective data-driven marketing strategies for clients. She was formerly an analyst on the Data Science team at EnerNOC and a statistician at the International Energy Agency. She is an expert in using R for data mining, developing predictive algorithms, and visualization.

She has generously agreed to be our first speaker and will be talking about SHINY!

We'll have some thai food for dinner, courtesy of our sponsor (and makers of Shiny!) RStudio.

title: Introducció a Bokeh: Una llibreria de visualització diferent
description:
Tindrem un tutorial d'Elena, més infos aviat! // We'll have a tutorial from Elena, more info coming soon!

El big data que ara està tan extès arreu del món, ens deixa una quantitat indigent de dades que sense els data scientists no tindrien sentit. Aquests tracten les dades amb carinyo per extreure informació entenible. Per tal de mostrar el resultat d'una manera grafica, es fan servir diferents llibreries de visualització. En aquest taller en centrarem en Bokeh i en el seu potencial per convertir-se en la llibreria de referència.

description:
Desde las 20.00 horas, estaremos en El Faro - un programa de Ciencia contando de que va R-Ladies y como pueden hacer todos los que quieran para poder participar, unirse al grupo y organizar actividades.
Para los que no sepa que es R, también contaremos un poquitito porqué este tipo de herramientas son tan importantes en esta época de muchos datos disponibles.

title: Manipuler et traiter les données manquantes dans R
description:
[événement en français animé par Julie Josse - http://juliejosse.com/]

Handling missing values in R,

The aim of this meetup is to present an overview of the missing values literature and to discuss the
potential pitfalls of the popular approaches in use and to show what are the recent tools available to
handle, in a practicable way, missing values.

We will touch upon the topics of single imputation with a focus on matrix completion methods
based on iterative regularized SVD, notions of confidence intervals by giving the fundamentals of
multiple imputation strategies, as well as issues of visualization with incomplete data.

The approaches will be illustrated with data with continuous, binary and categorical variables using
some of the main R packages Amelia, mice, missForest, missMDA, norm, softimpute, VIM.

Please download the dataset here : http://juliejosse.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/06/ozoneNA.csv
and be sure to have installed the packages below :

install.packages(c("VIM", "missMDA", "FactoMineR", "Amelia", "mice"))

title: R-Ladies Researchers Community Launch!! (MINORITY GENDERS ONLY)
description:
Chiin's been promising our minority gender Academic Researchers this will happen for several months now, but we are FINALLY LAUNCHING this sub-community!!

This will be both a celebration (with food & drink), a Bioinformatics talk/workshop (see below), and networking all in one, so hopefully something for everyone :)

Remember you must be a STEM minority gender (female/other) & an Academic Researcher (current/ex) or student to participate!!

Do sign-up here on Meetup OR Eventbrite (https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/r-ladies-london-researchers-students-community-launch-tickets-33618490811?ref=estw)!

Timings: talk starts at 6pm

COMPLETE BEGINNERS WELCOME!!

Mentor Vicky has prepared a fantastic workshop to encourage early R users/enthusiasts of the benefits of coding - for our more advanced R-Ladies, we'd love if you'd help Mentor the newer/first-time coders during this workshop!! Once we've collected data (!) on the community coding experience, we can organise specific events for the appropriate technical levels :)

Workshop requirements:

-Laptop with R & RStudio installed

-Packages: dplyr, ggplot2, ggsignif

-Data to download: https://github.com/datacarpentry/R-genomics/blob/gh-pages/data/Ecoli_metadata.csv

WiFi: ONLY eduroam will be available!! If you're doing the workshop & don't have eduroam access, please ensure you've addressed the above requirements in advance.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------

For the presentation, we are delighted to have Vicky Butt giving us a bioinformatics talk and workshop aimed at R beginners/intermediates, researchers/students in life sciences, and curious individuals! She will be talking about what bioinformaticians do, and how to learn bioinformatics. This will then be followed by a workshop analysing and visualising genomic data in R.

Vicky is doing a bioinformatics PhD at King’s College London studying metabolomics of microbiota. Her first degree was in Neuroscience, but then moved into computational biology and did a Masters in Systems Biology after discovering the power of programming for research. She hopes to encourage more researchers to learn to code, especially minority groups in STEM.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------

Mandate: as a civil service organisation we believe in the Equality Act 2010's Public Sector Equality Duty of advancing equality of opportunity between people who share a protected characteristic and those who don’t, in this case complying by explicitly promoting the currently underrepresented minority genders in STEM.

title: step_forward(x, 1)
description:
Menetrend:

18:00 -- 19:00 Adatvizualizációs alapok a ggplot2 csomaggal (kezdőknek)

19:00 -- 19:15 Szünet (gyors pizzázás, hogy bírjuk szusszal a végéig)

19:15 -- 20:15 Szűr, szabdal, olvaszt, átalakul: a data.table csomag (haladóknak)

20:00-tól kötetlen program, jól megérdemelt pihenés

Adatvizualizációs alapok a ggplot2 csomaggal (kezdőknek)

Miután a legutóbbi alkalommal igazi RStudio ninják lettünk, áprilisban megpróbáljuk beleásni magunkat a ggplot2 rejtelmeibe.

A tavalyi PISA eredményeket vizualizálva megtanuljuk,

• miket is hívunk “rétegeknek” vizualizáláskor,

• hogyan gyártunk nagyon gyorsan egyszerű pont-pont diagramot és hisztogramot és

• mik az alapvető finomhangolási lehetőségeink, hogy az ábránk ne csak hasznos legyen, de jól is nézzen ki.

Ajánlott előismeret: nincs.

Telepítési előkészület: ggplot2 csomag.

Az adatsort itt találjátok: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_budapest/master/Meetup_2017_04_19/pisa_hun_small.csv

A szkript vázát, amivel dolgozni fogunk pedig itt: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_budapest/master/Meetup_2017_04_19/exercises.R

Kérünk Benneteket, telepítsétek a csomagot (telepítési útmutató lenn) és letöltött adatsorral és szkript vázlattal érkezzetek.

Szűr, szabdal, olvaszt, átalakul: a data.table csomag 2. rész (haladóknak)

A márciusi meetup-on elkezdett data.table-lel való ismerkedést folytatjuk, a következőkkel:

• Group by, azaz csoportokon definiált műveletek

• Sorbarendezés

• Műveletek megadása egyszerre több oszlopon (.SD)

• Set key, azaz kulcsok beállítása, amitől bizonyos műveletek még hatékonyabbak lesznek

• Rolling join

• Reshaping: melt és dcast

Két input adatot fogunk használni, ebből az elsőt márciusban már megismertük:
https://github.com/hyzhangsf/stat133-1/blob/master/datasets/starwars.csv ­

https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_budapest/master/Meetup_2017_04_19/sw_friends.csv

Természetesen minden segédanyagot megtaláltok majd utólag a weben, mégis nagyon jó lenne, ha minél többen hoznátok notebookokat, hogy ott helyben ki is tudjátok próbálni a kódrészleteket.

Hogyan készüljetek a meetupra?

Három dologra lesz szükségetek a gépeteken:

• Magára az R interpreterre ( http://cran.rapporter.net/ )

• Egy okos-ügyes fejlesztőkörnyezetre, ami segíti a hatékony munkát, ez a mi esetünkben az RStudio lesz ( https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/ )

• Azokra a speciális csomagokra, amit az adott alkalmon részletesebben megismerünk: az április meetup esetén ez a ggplot2 és a data.table lesz.

A részletes telepítési lépéseket Windows operációs rendszer fölött itt találjátok (https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_budapest/blob/9dc7f8e35f0467e31a814be5fc1ec033bf593630/Meetup_2017_03_23/03_23_install_guide.pdf). Ebben a data.table telepítését mutatjuk be, de a ggplot2 csomagé ugyanúgy működik.

Ha bármi gond adódna a telepítéssel/letöltéssel, kezdés előtt még nyugodtan kérdezzetek.

title: Tour of R in Peer to Peer Lending
description:
For this month's meetup we will be exploring how R is used Finance by a fintech company. Orchard Platform is a technology company focused on the online lending space. Our data science team uses R heavily across all three groups of the team: Data & Integration - which is my team, Account Reporting, and Credit Analytics and Investment Strategy. We use R to ingest, analyze and prepare professional reports on the data, including packages and features such as sparkR, xlsx and creation of RMarkdown files. In order to fully utilize the capacities of R, we focus on hiring people who have good experience using the platform. We have seen plenty of ups and downs of people applying for these positions and have some great stories of how to (and how not to) show your skills in R in applying for job.

Catherine Pargeter Bio:

Catherine has spent the last few years focused on data and the best ways to data from disparate sources into systems and workflows. Prior to this, she worked as a quantitative and equity research analyst for a socially responsible investment firm where she taught herself R to escape from having to use Excel to try to do a massive quantitative analysis. She spent 3 years in Malawi in sub-Saharan Africa a Peace Corps Volunteer, where she developed an environmental education system for a national park including a searchable database of lesson plans and activities. She has her masters in Environmental Science and Management, specializing in Corporate Environmental Management and Pollution Remediation Modeling, from University of California, Santa Barbara, and her bachelors in Industrial and Operations Engineering (or as she calls it Statistics for Engineers) from the University of Michigan.

Agenda

6:30 to 6:50 pm networking and introductions

6:50 to 7:00pm Rladies announcements

7:00 to 7:45 Catherine's talk and Q&A

7:45 to 8:30 Networking and catching up!

title: Let's get Git-ting!
description:
Does this image accurately portray your workflow?

http://photos1.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/8/1/5/6/600_459573110.jpeg

If so, this workshop is for you!

In this workshop we will learn how to use git, a collaborative version control software, and avoid the above situation.

Version control is a system that records changes to a file or set of files over time so that you can recall specific versions later. We will start from the very basics of version control (collaborating with your past self) and work up to the skills necessary to contribute to an existing open source project (collaborating with other people). Effective collaboration and version control are essential for researchers to easily recover from the nasty snafus that we (or our collaborators) can get ourselves into through better file management. So, what are you waiting for? Let's get git-ting!

Pre-workshop Homework:

If you plan on attending this workshop, please do the following two things ahead of time:

• Sign up for GitHub (http://github.com (http://github.com/))

• Install SourceTree client for Git ( https://www.sourcetreeapp.com/ )

title: The grammar of graphics: ggplot2 April RLadies meetup
description:
Hi Los Angeles R Ladies!

We'll be having our next meetup on April 16th at 1pm on campus at UCLA.

The next stop on our Tour de R will be "The Grammar of Graphics" with ggplot2. Bring your laptops: we'll provide code and you can work along with us. First Katie Scranton (https://twitter.com/DrScranto) give a short intro to base plot and basics of ggplot2, then Christine Zhang (https://twitter.com/christinezhang) will go further into ggplot2, with examples.

We are limiting this meetup to people who identify as female/gender non-conforming/trans/other.

See you there!
Katie
katie@rladies.org

We'll be in room 325 in the Botany building. If you enter from Charles E Young Drive South, 325 is the first room on the left (the entrance is on the third floor). We'll prop the door open, but if it happens to be locked, just send a tweet to @RLadiesLA and we'll let you in.

Please bring code to use as examples.

title: R-Ladies Co-Work Group
description:
ABOUT

Whether you are new to R or an expert user, work in academics or industry, this is a laid back ~monthly event to further connect the R-Ladies Bay Area community and hack on R projects together.

We will be meeting at Erin's workspace in Oakland near the MacArthur BART stop. Drinks and a few light snacks will be provided, but feel free to bring something to share!

SCHEDULE

2:00 - 2:15 Brief introductions

2:20 - 3:20 Short tutorial and discussion: Erin LeDell will lead an introduction to making packages in R. Erin is a Machine Learning Scientist at H2O.ai (https://www.h2o.ai/) and has authored a handful of R packages (http://www.stat.berkeley.edu/~ledell/software.html).

3:20 to 5:00 Co-working time: You can use this time to work on a package/project for the community, share R tips, tricks, and learning materials, and meet new people who work with R. If you have an idea for an R package that doesn't exist yet, you can use this time to collaborate with other R-Ladies to make your package idea a reality!

PRE-REQUISITE

No pre-requisite knowledge required.

CODE OF CONDUCT

Anyone who violates or has previously violated this community's Code of Conduct will be refused entry, expelled, and/or any other action deemed appropriate by the Organizer, regardless of event registration, meetup membership or other condition.

We are emphatically queer and trans friendly.

This group was created so those who identify as women have a comfortable place to learn. If you would like to attend and feel excluded, please introduce yourself to an organizer.

This meetup is sponsored by the Information Initiative at Duke, http://bigdata.duke.edu/.

title: R Studio Conference Recap Movie Night! (R-Ladies Edition)
description:
We will be getting together to eat pizza and watch videos presented by R-Ladies at the recent R Studio 2017 conference. We will have time to watch about 3 videos. Please take this 10 second survey (https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/W9B8BG3) to let us know which videos you would like to watch from the following:

Text Mining the tidy Way – Julia Silge (22 min)

Putting square pegs in round holes: Using list-cols in your dataframe – Jenny Bryan (19 min)

Using Web APIs from R – Amanda Gadrow (23 min)

title: #1: Hands-on data visualisation with ggplot2 & Guest R-Lady Taipei Mia
description:
Welcome!

R-Ladies Berlin would like to welcome you to our first R-Ladies Berlin session kindly hosted by Babbel, the famous language learning app. We would like to introduce R-Ladies global and ourselves and looking forward to meet up with you.

The #1 R-Ladies Berlin tutorial is focussing on data visualisation with ggplot2. R-Lady Mia from Taipei, an expert of Azure Machine Learning Studio and its integration with R, joins us and introduces to us basic principles of data visualisation.

Please bring your laptop to actively participate in a hands-on session afterwards. Additional material and further instructions are send around prior the meet-up.

IMPORTANT: Starting time: 6:30 pm. Let's start with mingling and enjoying drinks and little snacks kindly provided by Babbel. The actual program starts at 7:15 pm and ends including another round of mingling around 10 pm.

In case of questions do not hesitate to send us an e-mail: berlin@rladies.org

Best

Noa, Hanna, Ulrike & Christin

Organizer of R-Ladies Berlin

title: Building easy and interactive dashboards in R with flexdashboard
description:
Dear all,

R-Ladies Melbourne is now announcing its March event! Thanks to Zendesk! They provide us drinks and pizzas as well!!

We invite you to participate in our "Meet an R-Lady" session which will occur prior to the talks during each meetup. All you need to do is to tell us about yourself for 3 mins. As we'd like to build strong relationships with our women, we'd like to get to know each one of you better and wouldn't it be great if you get to know the others? Please email us if you'd like to volunteer!

Our speaker Kaushik Lakshman previously gave a talk about flexdashboards in Melbourne Users of R Network with fantastic feedback from the audience. So we invited him to share his knowledge with R-Ladies and he kindly accepted our invitation. Here are the details of his talk.

Title: Building easy and interactive dashboards in R with flexdashboard

Abstract: Outputs of analyses or analytics pipelines often contain visualisations, summarised data and commentary around it. While this can be achieved using multiple methods such as good old fashioned Powerpoints, RMarkdowns or Shiny Apps; the good folks at R Studio have given analysts and data scientists a new alternative via a package called flexdashboard. Find out how easy it is to build flexible, attractive and interactive dashboards with R.

Speaker: Kaushik Lakshman is a data scientist and a big fan of R. He works at Betfair Australia, the world's largest betting exchange. He came across the flexdashboard package a few months ago and has already implemented a few in his organisation. He was enamoured by its ease of use and value it provided and would like to share that with the R Ladies group. He's going to take us through flexdashboards and its different features, with examples and code Betfair's after which all attendees hopefully are in a position to create their own dashboards with ease.

Signup now!

Looking forward to seeing you all,

R-Ladies Melbourne

title: Primera Reunión de R-Ladies Buenos Aires
description:
Por fin llegó el gran día!

Las invitamos a la reunión lanzamiento de R-Ladies Buenos Aires donde les vamos a contar más de qué se trata R-Ladies y sobre la magia que ocurre cuando nos ayudamos unas a otras.

Estamos ansiosas por empezar a que las que aún no se animaron con R, conozcan todas las posibilidades que tiene y empiecen a animarse. Para las que ya están más avanzadas nos gustaría que nos traigan sus ideas para seguir armando entre todas esta comunidad.

Las que tengan, traigan sus compus. También van a necesitar DNI para acceder al edificio.

Queremos agradecerle a Jampp (http://jampp.com) por recibirnos en sus oficinas. Jampp (http://jampp.com) es una plataforma líder para la promoción y remarketing de aplicaciones móviles que combina data de comportamiento e inteligencia artificial con el objetivo de mejorar el revenue de un selecto grupo de advertisers globales. Con un equipo de 80 personas con experiencia diversa en áreas como la Ingeniería y la Economía, Jampp (http://jampp.com) combina datos de comportamiento con tecnología predictiva y optimiza los ingresos de los anunciantes en todo el mundo.

Por favor, contestá el RSVP! Nos vemos pronto!

description:

title: R Ladies + Open Data Day Mini-Hack
description:
Open Data Day (http://opendataday.org/#what)* is an annual and global celebration of open data. Most ODD events focus on encouraging people to use open data for the purpose of improving research, public works, environmental causes or human rights issues - This is awesome and we support it! Our event is a little different.

This event is inspired by places on the internet like kaggle datasets (https://www.kaggle.com/datasets) and data.world (http://data.world/) that want to collect, tag, store and host open data submitted by YOU.

People and organizations all over the world are taking the time to curate information sources (census, social media, web sites, finance, community projects, academic research…) and then turning that information into clean, well described data sets in easily accessible and ingestible formats for anyone to use.

We’re planning two 45 minute tutorials to help get people started:

- Easy web scraping in R with the rvest package

- Managing datasets on Data.World through Github and/or Google Sheets

The rest of the time is for getting together (in teams or individually) to create open data sets that have never existed before! Check out kaggle and data.world to start getting inspired by the awesome data being hosted there.

12:30 PM Arrival - Socializing

1:00 PM Welcome - Goals

1:15 PM Tutorial - Web Scraping in R with the rvest Package

2:00 PM Start Data Curation/Creation! In teams or on your own

3:15 PM Tutorial - Sharing Data on Data.World through Github or Google Sheets Management

4:45 PM Drinks & Sharing

*Yes, the official Open Data Day is supposed to be March 4th 2017, We're having this event later in the month. We want a whole Open Data Month!

title: R-Ladies + Geoinquietos: Visualización de mapas
description:
¡Hola geoinquiet@s & R-Ladies!

PARA APUNTAROS POR FAVOR DIRIGÍOS AL MEETUP DE GEOINQUIETOS PARA CONTROLAR EL AFORO:

https://www.meetup.com/es-ES/Geoinquietos-MAD/events/238111854/

El próximo sábado 25 de Marzo las chicas de R-Ladies Madrid serán las encargadas de realizar el siguiente taller, Visualización de Datos con R dentro del ciclo de

Programación GIS

que GeoInquietos Madrid estamos llevando acabo. En este taller práctico se explicará cómo crear y automatizar mapas con la aplicación RStudio, con paquetes básicos y otros más avanzados como ggplot2 y ggmap.

https://a248.e.akamai.net/secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/4/1/c/f/600_458776847.jpeg

Programa

2. Mapas y buenas prácticas cartográficas (Ramiro Aznar)
3. Visualización de datos espaciales con R (María Medina, Elena Chicaiza y Anahí Martín)
3.1. Básico: maps
3.2. Avanzado: ggplot2 y ggmap
3.3. Ejemplos

Requerimientos

Llevar portátil con un explorador moderno (se recomienda Google Chrome).
• Nivel intermedio de R. Se recomienda haber realizado al menos uno de los cursos que se citan en la sección de recursos.
• Tener instalado RStudio.

Recursos

GitHub (https://github.com/GeoinquietosMadrid), meetup (https://www.meetup.com/es-ES/Geoinquietos-MAD/) y web (http://geoinquietos.org/) de GeoInquietos Madrid.

• R project (https://www.r-project.org/).
• RStudio (https://www.rstudio.com/).
• Cursos de iniciación a R: swirl (http://swirlstats.com/), Coursera (https://www.coursera.org/learn/r-programming), DataCamp (https://www.datacamp.com/courses/free-introduction-to-r), RStudio (https://www.rstudio.com/online-learning/) o Code School (https://www.codeschool.com/courses/try-r).

title: x <- "Let's start"
description:
Menetrend:

18:00 -- 19:00 Bevezetés az R használatába (kezdőknek)

19:00 -- 19:15 Szünet (gyors pizzázás, hogy bírjuk szusszal a végéig)

19:15 -- 20:00 Szűr, szabdal, olvaszt, átalakul: a data.table csomag (haladóknak)

20:00-tól kötetlen program, jól megérdemelt pihenés

Bevezetés az R használatába (kezdőknek)

Mindazoknak, akik szeretnének megismerkedni az R alapjaival, bemutatjuk az első lépéseket.

Kiderül például,

• mi az az RStudio és miért szeretjük,

• mi az az R csomag, mi az a CRAN és mit jelent a gyakorlatban az, hogy “több mint 10 000 R csomag van CRAN-en”,

• hogyan olvassunk be adatokat R-be és dobjuk ki, ami nem kell,

• hogyan és miért definiáljunk például egy “karakter vektort”,

• milyen egyéb R objektumok és alap adatípusok vannak.

Ajánlott előismeret: nincs.

Szűr, szabdal, olvaszt, átalakul: a data.table csomag (haladóknak)

Valós adatokon történő adatelemzés esetén az idő túlnyomó része (tipikusan 80%) az adatok előkészítésére fordítódik. Éppen ezért nagyon fontos, hogy minél hatékonyabb eszközt válasszunk és azt megfelelően használjuk.

Az R-ben a data.table biztosítja a leghatékonyabb adattranszformációs függvényeket. Használata eleinte nehézkesnek tűnhet, de ha sikerül megbarátkozni vele, később sokszorosan megtérül a tanulására fordított idő. Az első meetup haladó szekciójában ezért a data.table használatába vezetjük be az érdeklődőket.

Ajánlott előismeretek: A dataframe adatszerkezet és az alap adattranszformációs függvények ismerete (bármilyen adatelemző szoftverben szerzett tapasztalat elegendő lehet: SQL, SPSS, RapidMinder, SAS, Python - Pandas, etc)

Természetesen minden segédanyagot megtaláltok majd utólag a weben, mégis nagyon jó lenne, ha minél többen hoznátok notebookokat, hogy ott helyben ki is tudjátok próbálni a kódrészleteket.

Hogyan készüljetek a meetupra?

Három dologra lesz szükségetek a gépeteken:

• Magára az R interpreterre (http://cran.rapporter.net/)

• Egy okos-ügyes fejlesztőkörnyezetre, ami segíti a hatékony munkát, ez a mi esetünkben az RStudio lesz (https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/)

• Azokra a speciális csomagokra, amit az adott alkalmon részletesebben megismerünk (a márciusi meetup esetén ez a data.table https://github.com/Rdatatable/data.table/wiki/Installation) (https://github.com/Rdatatable/data.table/wiki/Installation).)

A részletes telepítési lépéseket Windows operációs rendszer fölött itt találjátok (https://github.com/rladies/meetup-presentations_budapest/blob/9dc7f8e35f0467e31a814be5fc1ec033bf593630/Meetup_2017_03_23/03_23_install_guide.pdf) (érdemes lehet a pdf-et le is tölteni, akkor kicsit szebben renderelődik).

We’ll discuss the basics of Shiny and where to find additional resources, and also walk through a demo app. Come learn about some tips and tricks for getting started with Shiny!

title: Data wrangling with dplyr and tidyr
description:
(Scroll down for English version'

Aquesta vegada farem una sessiò molt practica amb dplyr i tidyr per aprendre a netejar/transformar dades. La sessiò és adaptada per a persones que encara saben poc de R!

Sisplau venir amb el PC cargat + instal·lar R, RStudio i els paquets dplyr, tidyr, lubridate. I descarrega les dades de https://github.com/masalmon/domar_datos/blob/master/data/data_domar_datos.zip

Probablement ho farem tot en anglés, si hi algunes persones que no ho entenen parlarem castellà o català ;). La trobada serà al Punt multimedia de la Casa del Mig, a qui agraïm acollir la nostra trobada!

Aqui (https://www.meetup.com/rladies-barcelona/) trobareu el nostre codi de conducta.

Apunteu amb RSVP, ens veiem el 20 de març!

This time we'll do a very applied session with dplyr and tidyr to learn how to clean/transform data. The session is adapted to people who don't know much about R yet!

Please come with a charged laptop and install the packages dplyr, tidyr, lubridate. And download the data from https://github.com/masalmon/domar_datos/blob/master/data/data_domar_datos.zip

The meetup will probably be in English, if there are people who don't understand Spanish or Catalan. The meetup will be at the Punt multimedia de la Casa del Mig, thanks a lot to them for having us!

Our code of conduct is here (https://www.meetup.com/rladies-barcelona/) . Please RSVP, and see you on the 20th of March!

title: Data Science CV Skills & UseR! Conference Tips
description:
We will focus on two topics in this session:

1) Data Science Skills - Grace Meyer
Tips on CV structure, formatting, key words and tailoring to job specs.

2) UseR! Conference Tips - Hannah Frick
User! is being held in Brussels in June and we want to support abstract submission. Come and learn about abstract writing and prep.

Grace Meyer is a Senior Data Science Consultant with Mango Solutions. In her last position she led an analytical team at Etihad Airways.

Hannah Frick is a statistician and data scientist with a strong background in stats methodology, research practices and R programming. She presented at User! 2016 on the trackeR package which she authored.

title: Linear regression in R
description:
Alessandra Carioli (WorldPop & University of Southampton) will host our next three R-Ladies meetups (ISET, room 5.2). On March 9 (Thursday) Alessandra will talk about the basics of linear regression analysis and how to do it in R.

title: Introduction to ggplot2
description:
Sarah Hosking will provide an introduction to ggplot2. See below for more information.

Ggplot2 is one the go-to plotting libraries in R. One reason is in ggplot2 it's easy to quickly iterate plots, making it a great tool for exploratory data analysis (EDA).

This introductory session will take you through a visual EDA of a dataset using ggplot2. We will cover:

• Single-variable analysis with histograms, boxplots, scatterplots and line graphs

• Multiple-variable analysis through faceting, colour grouping, and correlation matrices.

If time allows, we can also look at creating and plotting summary statistics.

title: [Cloud Platform Series] Azure ML Case
description:
[Agenda]

• 19:15-19:30 R Basic 常用指令1

• 19:30-20:30 主議程: Azure ML @Ning

• 20:30-20:50 閃電秀: Azure Machine Learning - Feature Engineering @懷文

• 20:50 - 自由交流時間

[Talk Information]

• Azure ML
不會寫程式是否也能預測新發單曲是否賣座[Azure及R的教學]

每張新唱片問世，都需唱片公司投入大量預算，如何能預測單曲是否暢銷變成關鍵。透過MIT/edX Popularity of Music Records課程的資料集，收集了1990-2010告示牌排行榜前十大及非前十大單曲，透過Logistic Regression來建立模型。

此次talk嘗試透過Azure讓不會寫程式的人也能建立自己的模型，也分享R + Azure有甚麼好用的小地方。

•Azure Machine Learning - Feature Engineering

被喻為是“Data scientist's Secret Sauce!”的Feature Engineering(特徵工程)，到底是有什麼樣的魔力，讓大家對他有這個稱號。

在資料分析和建模當中，要透過什麼方式，把現實生活當中的情境透過feature描述，轉化成model裡面相對應的數值？

如果你心中有些想要透過machine learning解決的問題，也對該問題有一些相對應的domain knowhow，卻不知道應該在哪裡把自己的知識加進去訓練模型的步驟裡，也許你會從這次的分享有一些收穫。

或是你已經嘗試了一些演算法，想知道在Data 跟 Model 之間的轉換到底是有哪些秘方讓自己的模型可以更fit 自己遇到的問題，也許你會從這次的分享帶給你一些新的靈感在你分析的流程上。

[Speaker Information]

• Ning
熱愛作資料解讀及分析，共同創立 TW R Ladies，曾經在網路公司做過分析師．希望能認識更多同好，一起做好玩且不一樣的事情。

• 懷文
喜歡從資料當中找出一些現象，從中和現實生活當中的問題互動。在一些不同的新創專案當中擔任資料顧問，也是Azure Taiwan社群的共同創辦人，希望和大家多認識，聽聽大家對身邊資料集的不同想像。

[Host information]

昱璇 Dana

具有研究精神的商業智慧分析人員，用過R、SPSS modeler和Tableau做數據分析，也接觸過各資料庫語法、跨平台資料介接及網頁前台語言。希望跟大家一起交流、成長。
